English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, in the tabernacle of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying
Bahnar: Năr mônh khei 'bar, sơnăm mă 'bar, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis oei lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơ Thŭng glă Sinai

English: “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of names, every male individually
Bahnar: Ih athei chih jô̆ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch, kơtum kơtŏng 'nhŏng oh gah 'bă, chih anăn rim 'nu lu kon drŏ-nglo

English: from twenty years old and above—all who are able to go to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall number them by their armies.
Bahnar: Ih păng Arôn gô chih jô̆ măt iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan đĭ-đăng kơ̆l bơngai lăm adrĕch Isơrael gơh kĕ năm tơblah.

English: And with you there shall be a man from every tribe, each one the head of his father’s house.
Bahnar: Bơngai kơdră pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch sư kơdih. Kư̆ lăm minh adrĕch athei đei minh 'nu bơ̆jang tơgŭm ih păng Arôn.

English: “These are the names of the men who shall stand with you: from Reuben, Elizur the son of Shedeur
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu bơngai wă jang hơdai păng tơgŭm lu iĕm: Gah adrĕch Rubên đei Êlisur kon drŏ-nglo Sêdur

English: from Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Simêôn đei Sêlumiel kon drŏ-nglo Surisadai

English: from Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Juđa đei Nahsôn kon drŏ-nglo Aminađap

English: from Issachar, Nethanel the son of Zuar
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Isakar đei Nathanel kon drŏ-nglo Suar

English: from Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Sabulôn đei Êliap kon drŏ-nglo Hêlôn

English: from the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep, adrĕch Êphraim đei Êlisama kon drŏ-nglo Amihut, đơ̆ng adrĕch Manase đei Gamaliel kon drŏ-nglo Pêdasur

English: from Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Bênjamin đei Abidan kon drŏ-nglo Gideôni

English: from Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Đan đei Ahiser kon drŏ-nglo Amisadai

English: from Asher, Pagiel the son of Ocran
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Aser đei Pagiel kon drŏ-nglo Ôkran

English: from Gad, Eliasaph the son of Deuel
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Gat đei Êliasap kon drŏ-nglo Đêuel

English: from Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.”
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Neptali đei Ahira kon drŏ-nglo Ênan.

English: These were chosen from the congregation, leaders of their fathers’ tribes, heads of the divisions in Israel.
Bahnar: Lu đe âu đe rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei; lu sư âu boih lu kơdră pơgơ̆r adrĕch lu sư kơdih kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bok lu sư păng jơ̆ yŏng pơgơ̆r linh bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then Moses and Aaron took these men who had been mentioned by name
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn sơng iŏk lu bơngai mă đe đei chih anăn

English: and they assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they recited their ancestry by families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, each one individually.
Bahnar: Truh năr mônh khei 'bar krao akŭm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, chih anăn lu sư kơdih iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal na chih tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung kơtum kơtŏng lu sư.

English: As the LORD commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the Wilderness of Sinai.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis chih jô̆ tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơ Thŭng glă Sinai, thoi Kră Yang Isơrael đei pơkă khan kơ sư.

English: Now the children of Reuben, Israel’s oldest son, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, every male individually, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Rubên, kon kơdră drŏ-nglo Isơrael, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư kơdih, đe jô̆ chih rim anăn lu sư đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lu kon sâu Rubên mă gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: đei puăn-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Simeon, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, of those who were numbered, according to the number of names, every male individually, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Simêôn, adrĕch adrung, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư kơdih, đe chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Simêôn gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
Bahnar: đei pơđăm-jĭt tơsĭn-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Gad, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gat, adrĕch adrung sư kiơ̆ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Gat gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
Bahnar: đei puăn-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: From the children of Judah, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Juđa, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm lu kon sâu Juđa gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Judah were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: đei tơpơh-jĭt puăn-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Issachar, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Isakar, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Isakar gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: đei pơđăm-jĭt puăn-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Zebulun, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Sabulôn, adrĕch drung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Sabulôn gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: đei pơđăm-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the sons of Joseph, the children of Ephraim, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Jôsep, noh kiơ̆ kon sâu Êphraim, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Êphraim gơh năm tơblah.

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: Đei puăn-jĭt rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Manasseh, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Manase, adrĕch adrung sư kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Manase gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
Bahnar: đei pêng-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Benjamin, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Bênjamin, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Bênjamin gơh năm tơblah.

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: Đei pêng-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Dan, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Đan, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Đan gơh năm tơblah.

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrâu-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Asher, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Aser, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Aser, gơh năm tơblah.

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Asher were forty-one thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: Đei puăn mơjĭt-mônh rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: From the children of Naphtali, their genealogies by their families, by their fathers’ house, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war
Bahnar: Kon sâu Neptali, adrĕch adrung sư, kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei chih jô̆ anăn rim 'nu drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm năm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm kon sâu Neptali gơh năm tơblah

English: those who were numbered of the tribe of Naphtali were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: đei pơđăm-jĭt pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: These are the ones who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, with the leaders of Israel, twelve men, each one representing his father’s house.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơngai mă Môis, Arôn păng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu kơdră pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael đei chih jô̆; rim kơdră chih jô̆ adrĕch bơ̆n kơdih.

English: So all who were numbered of the children of Israel, by their fathers’ houses, from twenty years old and above, all who were able to go to war in Israel
Bahnar: Thoi noh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael đe đei chih tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar jô̆ kơ̆l bơngai kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch kơdih, iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, wă khan lăm adrĕch kon sâu Isơrael gơh năm tơblah

English: all who were numbered were six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
Bahnar: đei tơdrâu-hrĕng pêng-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: But the Levites were not numbered among them by their fathers’ tribe
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư kơdih, ưh kơ chih jô̆ hơdai hăm lu adrĕch adrung nai.

English: for the LORD had spoken to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Only the tribe of Levi you shall not number, nor take a census of them among the children of Israel
Bahnar: Ih 'nĕ kơ chih jô̆ adrĕch adrung Lêwi păng kư̆m 'nĕ chih tơmơ̆t hơdai hăm adrĕch Isơrael

English: but you shall appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the Testimony, over all its furnishings, and over all things that belong to it; they shall carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; they shall attend to it and camp around the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Mă-lei athei klah lê̆ adrĕch Lêwi wă kơ lu sư wei-lăng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Pơgơ̆p Sĭt păng đĭ-đăng lu tơmam yua lăm anih akŭm đe pơm păng khăn noh, wă kơ lu sư tơiung pơdơ̆ng păng tung anhăk anih, wei-lăng đĭ lu tơmam yua lăm anih noh bơ̆jang lăm hnam noh păng pơm bơsŭn oei tăp dăr kơ Anih Akŭm noh.

English: And when the tabernacle is to go forward, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall set it up. The outsider who comes near shall be put to death.
Bahnar: Tơdah Anih Akŭm păng khăn noh pôk tơ nai lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi âu yuih, truh tơ anih boih lu sư gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng ming; lu adrĕch bơngai nai ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ tơdah năm jê̆ đe gô pơlôch.

English: The children of Israel shall pitch their tents, everyone by his own camp, everyone by his own standard, according to their armies
Bahnar: Adrĕch bơngai Isơrael gô pơm bơsŭn oei kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch lu sư, rim 'nu kiơ̆ anih sư kiơ̆ kơ hla-kơ lu sư.

English: but the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the Testimony, that there may be no wrath on the congregation of the children of Israel; and the Levites shall keep charge of the tabernacle of the Testimony.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu adrĕch Lêwi gô oei tăp dăr kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Pơgơ̆p Sĭt, wă kơ huay tơhil pơjăng pơjah hăm lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael; adrĕch Lêwi lu sư gô wei-lăng bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Pơgơ̆p Sĭt.

English: Thus the children of Israel did; according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so they did.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă boih hăm Môis.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “Everyone of the children of Israel shall camp by his own standard, beside the emblems of his father’s house; they shall camp some distance from the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Adrĕch bơngai Isơrael rim 'nu oei jê̆ hla-kơ lu sư kơdih, oei 'bơ̆t ala che đe chih adrĕch adrung sư kơdih; lu sư oei tơklă băl anăp păng tăp dăr Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: On the east side, toward the rising of the sun, those of the standard of the forces with Judah shall camp according to their armies; and Nahshon the son of Amminadab shall be the leader of the children of Judah.”
Bahnar: Kơđông linh Juđa oei tơ gah hơlĕch gah măt 'năr lĕch, đei hla-kơ khŭl lu sư. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch bơngai Juđa noh Nahsôn, kon drŏ-nglo Minađap.

English: And his army was numbered at seventy-four thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh lu sư đei chih jô̆ boih, đei tơpơh-jĭt puăn-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Issachar, and Nethanel the son of Zuar shall be the leader of the children of Issachar.”
Bahnar: Adrĕch bơngai Isakar kơđông lu sư oei jê̆ Juđa. Yŏng kơdră sư Nathanel, kon drŏ-nglo Suar

English: And his army was numbered at fifty-four thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: khŭl linh đe chih jô̆ boih pơđăm-jĭt puăn-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Then comes the tribe of Zebulun, and Eliab the son of Helon shall be the leader of the children of Zebulun.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh adrĕch Sabulôn; yŏng kơdră sư Êliap, kon drŏ-nglo Hêlôn

English: And his army was numbered at fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: păng khŭl linh sư đei chih jô̆ boih pơđăm-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu

English: “All who were numbered according to their armies of the forces with Judah, one hundred and eighty-six thousand four hundred—these shall break camp first.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai oei lăm kơđông Juđa kiơ̆ thoi lu sư đei jô̆ minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu; lu sư jing khŭl yak adrol ba trong kơplah lu sư yak năm.

English: “On the south side shall be the standard of the forces with Reuben according to their armies, and the leader of the children of Reuben shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.”
Bahnar: Hla-kơ păng kơđông linh Rubên kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư oei tơ gah gơal. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Rubên noh Êlisur kon drŏ-nglo Sêdur

English: And his army was numbered at forty-six thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: păng linh sư, đei chih jô̆, puăn-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon, and the leader of the children of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.”
Bahnar: Adrĕch Simêôn kư̆m athei oei jê̆ Rubên. Yŏng kơdră bơngai adrĕch Simêôn noh Sêlumiel kon drŏ-nglo Surisadai

English: And his army was numbered at fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
Bahnar: lu linh sư, đe jô̆ pơđăm-jĭt tơsĭn-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Then comes the tribe of Gad, and the leader of the children of Gad shall be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei adrĕch Gat, Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Gat noh Êliasap kon drŏ-nglo Rêuel

English: And his army was numbered at forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
Bahnar: lu linh sư, đe jô̆ puăn-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: “All who were numbered according to their armies of the forces with Reuben, one hundred and fifty-one thousand four hundred and fifty—they shall be the second to break camp.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai oei lăm anih linh Rubên, kiơ̆ thoi lu sư đei chih jô̆ minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt mônh rơbâu puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu. Lu khŭl sư 'nâu athei yak năm mă 'bar.

English: “And the tabernacle of meeting shall move out with the camp of the Levites in the middle of the camps; as they camp, so they shall move out, everyone in his place, by their standards.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm pôk năm hơdai lu adrĕch Lêwi, oei tŏk-bŏk anih lu khŭl bơngai nai; kơđông khŭl Lêwi gô yak kiơ̆ thoi đei asong boih, rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ khŭl păng kiơ̆ kơ hla-kơ kơdih.

English: “On the west side shall be the standard of the forces with Ephraim according to their armies, and the leader of the children of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud.”
Bahnar: Hla-kơ khŭl kơđông linh Êphraim păng lu linh sư athei oei tơ gah bơmơ̆t. Yŏng kơdră bơngai Êphraim noh Êlisama kon drŏ-nglo Amihut

English: And his army was numbered at forty thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: păng khŭl linh sư, kư̆ kiơ̆ kơ đe chih jô̆, đei puăn-jĭt rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Next to him comes the tribe of Manasseh, and the leader of the children of Manasseh shall be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.”
Bahnar: Adrĕch Manase athei oei jê̆ anih adrĕch Êphraim. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Manase noh Gamaliel, kon drŏ-nglo Pêdasur

English: And his army was numbered at thirty-two thousand two hundred.
Bahnar: păng khŭl linh sư, kiơ̆ kơ đei chih jô̆, đei pêng-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Then comes the tribe of Benjamin, and the leader of the children of Benjamin shall be Abidan the son of Gideoni.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh adrĕch adrung Bênjamin. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Bênjamin noh Abidan kon drŏ-nglo Gideôni

English: And his army was numbered at thirty-five thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: khŭl linh sư, kiơ̆ thoi đe jô̆, đei pêng-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “All who were numbered according to their armies of the forces with Ephraim, one hundred and eight thousand one hundred—they shall be the third to break camp.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, kiơ̆ kơ đe đei jô̆ khŭl linh hăm lăm kơđông Êphraim, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl linh, đei minh-hrĕng tơhngam-rơbâu minh-hrĕng 'nu: Khŭl sư athei năm kiơ̆ mă pêng.

English: “The standard of the forces with Dan shall be on the north side according to their armies, and the leader of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.”
Bahnar: Hla-kơ kơđông linh Đan păng lu linh sư athei oei gah yă-nơ̆m. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Đan noh Ahiser, kon drŏ-nglo Amisadai

English: And his army was numbered at sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
Bahnar: khŭl linh sư đe jô̆ đĭ-đăng đei tơdrâu-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Those who camp next to him shall be the tribe of Asher, and the leader of the children of Asher shall be Pagiel the son of Ocran.”
Bahnar: Adrĕch Aser khŭl kơđông sư oei jê̆ Đan. Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Aser noh Pagiel, kon drŏ-nglo Ôkran

English: And his army was numbered at forty-one thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: khŭl linh sư, đe jô̆ đĭ-đăng, puăn mơjĭt-mônh rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “Then comes the tribe of Naphtali, and the leader of the children of Naphtali shall be Ahira the son of Enan.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh adrĕch Neptali. Yŏng kơdră Neptali noh Ahira, kon drŏ-nglo Ênan

English: And his army was numbered at fifty-three thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: păng khŭl linh sư, đe jô̆ đĭ-đăng, pơđăm-jĭt pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: “All who were numbered of the forces with Dan, one hundred and fifty-seven thousand six hundred—they shall break camp last, with their standards.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, kiơ̆ kơ đe đei jô̆ kiơ̆ kơ kơđông khŭl linh Đan, đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu. Lu sư kiơ̆ kơ hla-kơ lu sư kơdih khŭl adrĕch Đan lu sư yak tuch-luch.

English: These are the ones who were numbered of the children of Israel by their fathers’ houses. All who were numbered according to their armies of the forces were six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty.
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael đe đei jô̆ boih kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư kơdih. Lăm rim kơđông linh kiơ̆ kơ khŭl linh đe jô̆ đei đĭ-đăng tơdrâu-hrĕng pêng-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel, just as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Mă-lei adrĕch bơngai Lêwi đe ưh kơ chih jô̆ ôh hơdai lăm sơ̆p hla bơar adrĕch Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă kơ Môis.

English: Thus the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses; so they camped by their standards and so they broke camp, each one by his family, according to their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: Adrĕch kon pơlei Isơrael pơm rok kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă ăn boih kơ Môis, na lu sư pơm kơđông anih kiơ̆ kơ hla-kơ lu sư kơdih păng lu sư yak nơnăm kư̆m kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư kơdih.

English: Now these are the records of Aaron and Moses when the LORD spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch adrung Arôn păng Môis, lăm năr Kră Yang khan kơ Môis tơ kông Sinai.

English: And these are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab, the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn: Kơdră sư Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar păng Ithamar.

English: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he consecrated to minister as priests.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn lu 'bok soi mă đe đei tuh đak rơmă tơ kơ̆l wă jing 'bok soi.

English: Nadab and Abihu had died before the LORD when they offered profane fire before the LORD in the Wilderness of Sinai; and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests in the presence of Aaron their father.
Bahnar: Nađap păng Abihu lôch boih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang kơplah bre sư oei soh pơyơ̆r ŭnh ưh kơ rơgoh ôh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lăm Thŭng glă Sinai păng bre sư ưh kơ đei kon ôh. Bre Êlêasar păng Ithamar pơm 'bok soi kơplah 'bă lu sư Arôn oei arih.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron the priest, that they may serve him.
Bahnar: Ăn bĕ kơ kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi năm jê̆, 'bơ̆t anăp Arôn 'bok soi tơm, wă kơ lu adrĕch Lêwi awih awăn tơgŭm sư.

English: And they shall attend to his needs and the needs of the whole congregation before the tabernacle of meeting, to do the work of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi gô awih awăn kơ sư păng awih awăn bơ̆jang kơ lu kon pơlei akŭm hơdai lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, anih kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Also they shall attend to all the furnishings of the tabernacle of meeting, and to the needs of the children of Israel, to do the work of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Kŭm wă wei-lăng đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng đĭ tơmam kiơ mă đơ̆ng adrĕch bơngai Isơrael jao wă yua lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Kră Yang.

English: And you shall give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are given entirely to him from among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei jao dôm lu bơngai Lêwi kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư; đĭ-đăng lu sư mă đei rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael Inh jao boih kơ Arôn.

English: So you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall attend to their priesthood; but the outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ih gô pôk Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă pơm 'bok soi; lu bơngai tơmoi nai năm jê̆ đe gô pơlôch.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Now behold, I Myself have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel instead of every firstborn who opens the womb among the children of Israel. Therefore the Levites shall be Mine
Bahnar: 'Nâu, lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael Inh, rơih iŏk boih bơngai Lêwi tơplih ăn kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael. Thoi noh, bơngai Lêwi noh lu sư gah Inh

English: because all the firstborn are Mine. On the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified to Myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast. They shall be Mine: I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon kơdră noh gah Inh ngăl. Sơ̆ kơplah Inh pơlôch pơrăm lu kon kơdră lăm char Êyiptơ, Inh rơih 'măn lê̆ kơ Inh lu kon kơdră lăm Isơrael, mă khan noh kon bơngai dah kon sem dơrong, lu sư gah Inh đĭ-đăng; Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis lăm Thŭng Glă Sinai thoi âu

English: “Number the children of Levi by their fathers’ houses, by their families; you shall number every male from a month old and above.”
Bahnar: Chih jô̆ bĕ kon sâu Lêwi, kiơ̆ adrĕch kơtum gah 'bă lu sư; jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng minh khei tơ kơpal.

English: So Moses numbered them according to the word of the LORD, as he was commanded.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis chih jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă khan hăm sư noh.

English: These were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi; Gersôn, Kôhat, Mêrari.

English: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Gersôn: Lipni, Simei.

English: And the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram, Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
Bahnar: 'Nâu kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat: Amram, Ishar, Hêbrôn păng Usiên.

English: And the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Marari noh: Mahil, Musi. 'Nâu adrĕch Lêwi kiơ̆ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư.

English: From Gershon came the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimites; these were the families of the Gershonites.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Gersôn đei adrĕch Lipni păng adrĕch Simei; 'nâu boih adrĕch adrung Gersôn.

English: Those who were numbered, according to the number of all the males from a month old and above—of those who were numbered there were seven thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal, đei tơpơh-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The families of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle westward.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch Gersôn oei tơ gah bơmơ̆t, gah rŏng kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the leader of the father’s house of the Gershonites was Eliasaph the son of Lael.
Bahnar: Yŏng kơdră lu adrĕch Gersôn noh Êliasap kon drŏ-nglo Lael.

English: The duties of the children of Gershon in the tabernacle of meeting included the tabernacle, the tent with its covering, the screen for the door of the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang lu kon drŏ-nglo Gersôn lăm bơsŭn wei-lăng đĭ-đăng tơmam kiơ kiơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm noh wă khan che klơ̆p bơbŭng Bơsŭn păng che pĕng 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: the screen for the door of the court, the hangings of the court which are around the tabernacle and the altar, and their cords, according to all the work relating to them.
Bahnar: lu che pĕng kơdeng păng che pĕng 'măng gah kơdeng tăp dăr kơ bơsŭn păng chơnang soi, lu tơlei giĕn chô̆ bơsŭn noh păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm noh.

English: From Kohath came the family of the Amramites, the family of the Izharites, the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites; these were the families of the Kohathites.
Bahnar: Adrĕch Amram, adrĕch Ishar adrĕch Hêbrôn păng adrĕch Usiêl, lu đe âu jing kon sâu adrĕch Kôhat.

English: According to the number of all the males, from a month old and above, there were eight thousand six hundred keeping charge of the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal, đei tơhngam-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu. Tơdrong jang lu sư wei-lăng anih rơgoh.

English: The families of the children of Kohath were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch kon sâu Kôhat pơm anih oei lu sư gah cheng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm gah gơal.

English: And the leader of the fathers’ house of the families of the Kohathites was Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
Bahnar: Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Kôhat noh Êlisaphan, kon drŏ-nglo Usiên.

English: Their duty included the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the utensils of the sanctuary with which they ministered, the screen, and all the work relating to them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang lu kon sư noh wei-lăng Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p, gơ'bang, jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng, chơnang soi păng lu tơmam yua lăm anih rơgoh wă yua lăm tơdrong akŭm kơkuh hăm che pĕng gom păng dôm tơdrong 'bơm lăm tơdrong jang 'noh.

English: And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest was to be chief over the leaders of the Levites, with oversight of those who kept charge of the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r tih hloh lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi noh Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo Arôn 'bok soi tơm; sư jao ăn kơ Êlêasar wei-lăng păng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai bơ̆jang lăm anih rơgoh.

English: From Merari came the family of the Mahlites and the family of the Mushites; these were the families of Merari.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Mêrari đei adrĕch Mahil păng adrĕch Musi; 'nâu boih adrĕch adrung Mêrari.

English: And those who were numbered, according to the number of all the males from a month old and above, were six thousand two hundred.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal đei tơdrâu-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The leader of the fathers’ house of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. These were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Yŏng kơdră adrĕch Mêrari noh Suriêl, kon drŏ-nglo Abihai; bơsŭn lu sư oei gah yă-nơ̆m cheng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the appointed duty of the children of Merari included the boards of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, its utensils, all the work relating to them
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang lu sư wei-lăng lu tơ̆r, 'long pơjô̆, jrăng, jrăng trôm, đĭ dôm lu tơmam yua pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: and the pillars of the court all around, with their sockets, their pegs, and their cords.
Bahnar: Lu jrăng tăp dăr kơdeng păng jrăng đei bơlôh, lu gơwŏk păng tơlei giĕn chô̆ jrăng.

English: Moreover those who were to camp before the tabernacle on the east, before the tabernacle of meeting, were Moses, Aaron, and his sons, keeping charge of the sanctuary, to meet the needs of the children of Israel; but the outsider who came near was to be put to death.
Bahnar: Môis, Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, đei pơdơ̆ng anih bơsŭn lu sư oei, tơ anăp gah hơlĕch kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, lu sư bơ̆jang lăm anih rơgoh tơplih kơ kon pơlei Isơrael. Lu bơngai nai năm jê̆ anih 'nâu đe gô pơlôch.

English: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of the LORD, by their families, all the males from a month old and above, were twenty-two thousand.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng adrĕch Lêwi mă Môis păng Arôn đei chih jô̆ kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư, jô̆ đĭ-đăng bơngai drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal, đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'nu.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses: “Number all the firstborn males of the children of Israel from a month old and above, and take the number of their names.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Ih jô̆ bĕ đĭ-đăng lu kon kơdră adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal, chih tơmơ̆t bĕ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar anăn lu sư.

English: And you shall take the Levites for Me—I am the LORD—instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the livestock of the children of Israel.”
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang. Ih athei chă rơih ăn kơ Inh kon kơdră drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng adrĕch bơngai Lêwi wă tơplih kơ kon drŏ-nglo kơdră lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael; kư̆m athei rôp sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a đơ̆ng bơngai Lêwi wă tơplih kơ dôm kon sem dơrong tuh blŭng-a kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: So Moses numbered all the firstborn among the children of Israel, as the LORD commanded him.
Bahnar: Thoi ei, Môis chih jô̆ pơđĭ lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang mă đei pơkă khan kơ sư.

English: And all the firstborn males, according to the number of names from a month old and above, of those who were numbered of them, were twenty-two thousand two hundred and seventy-three.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon kơdră chih jô̆ rim anăn lu sư iŏk đơ̆ng 'nao minh khei tơ kơpal, kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư kơdih, đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pêng 'nu.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock. The Levites shall be Mine: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ đĭ-đăng kon kơdră bơngai Lêwi tơplih kơ lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael păng lu sem dơrong bơngai Lêwi tuh blŭng-a noh tơplih kơ sem dơrong bơngai Isơrael mă tuh blŭng-a; thoi noh, lu bơngai Lêwi lu sư gah Inh. Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: And for the redemption of the two hundred and seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel, who are more than the number of the Levites
Bahnar: Bĕ gah wă huai iŏk kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael, jô̆ kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael hloh kơ kon kơdră bơngai Lêwi noh 'bar-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pêng 'nu

English: you shall take five shekels for each one individually; you shall take them in the currency of the shekel of the sanctuary, the shekel of twenty gerahs.
Bahnar: na ih athei ra pơđăm seikơl hlak jên hu, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl jên hu lăm Anih Rơgoh; minh seikơl jên hu noh dang 'bar-jĭt Gêraa

English: And you shall give the money, with which the excess number of them is redeemed, to Aaron and his sons.”
Bahnar: Ih athei pơjao ăn jên hu noh kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, noh jên mă huai iŏk lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael hloh kơ kon kơdră bơngai Lêwi.

English: So Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those who were redeemed by the Levites.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis iŏk jên wă huai iŏk lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael hloh kơ kon kơdră bơngai Lêwi mă huai iŏk boih.

English: From the firstborn of the children of Israel he took the money, one thousand three hundred and sixty-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk jên hu đơ̆ng lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael, minh-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt pơđăm seikơl jên hu, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl jên hu lăm anih rơgoh.b

English: And Moses gave their redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Môis chu nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang, jao ăn jên noh kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei khan pơkă ăn boih kơ sư.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn thoi âu

English: “Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the children of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ house
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi, chih jô̆ adrĕch kon sâu Kôhat kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch ioi sư.

English: from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, all who enter the service to do the work in the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, wă khan đĭ-đăng bơngai bu mă gơh jang tơgŭm lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: “This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of meeting, relating to the most holy things
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong jang lu adrĕch kon sâu Kôhat lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, lu sư wei-lăng tơmam rơgoh hloh

English: When the camp prepares to journey, Aaron and his sons shall come, and they shall take down the covering veil and cover the ark of the Testimony with it.
Bahnar: tơdah wă weh tơ nai plôh bơsŭn Anih akŭm, Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư yaih lang che pĕng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, na klơ̆p gom lê̆ hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm che noh

English: Then they shall put on it a covering of badger skins, and spread over that a cloth entirely of blue; and they shall insert its poles.
Bahnar: đe gô iŏk akar ka tih klơ̆p kơpal kơ che klơ̆p gom păng kư̆m lơ̆k che dreng plĕnh dơ̆ng kơpal noh păng sôr 'long tơnung tung.

English: “On the table of showbread they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the pans, the bowls, and the pitchers for pouring; and the showbread shall be on it.
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m lơ̆k minh blah che dreng plĕnh tơ kơpal gơ'bang dan 'bĕng pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ kơpal gơ'bang đe dan pơnhan chhĕr, pơnhan tô, pơnhan iĕ, kơthao păng 'bĭnh wă mong tơmam huch sa. 'Bĕng athei đei tơ noh ling-lang.

English: They shall spread over them a scarlet cloth, and cover the same with a covering of badger skins; and they shall insert its poles.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đe gô tơsu tơ kơpal lu tơmam noh hăm minh blah che 'brê gôh păng klơ̆p gom lê̆ dơ̆ng hăm che akar ka tih đơ̆ng noh đe sôr 'long tơnung tung.

English: And they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand of the light, with its lamps, its wick-trimmers, its trays, and all its oil vessels, with which they service it.
Bahnar: Kŭm athei iŏk minh blah che jơk plĕnh pơ̆n jơ̆ng kơđeng ŭnh jrĕnh wă nhơk pơchrang hăm ŭnh kơđeng, chơkep wă tơpăt ŭnh, kơđŏng mam mong ngar păng đĭ-đăng lu bô̆i mong đak rơmă ôliwơ wă yua pơm ŭnh jrĕnh.

English: Then they shall put it with all its utensils in a covering of badger skins, and put it on a carrying beam.
Bahnar: Đe gô dan sư hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm che gom sư pơm păng akar ka tih, na dan tơmam noh tơ kơpal hơbang.

English: “Over the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth, and cover it with a covering of badger skins; and they shall insert its poles.
Bahnar: Lu sư athei lơ̆k minh blah che jơk plĕnh kơpal gơ'bang soi maih păng gom hăm akar ka tih đang kơ noh đe sôr 'long tơnung tung

English: Then they shall take all the utensils of service with which they minister in the sanctuary, put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering of badger skins, and put them on a carrying beam.
Bahnar: lu sư gô iŏk đĭ-đăng tơmam yua 'măn kơ tơdrong bơ̆jang lăm anih rơgoh đơ̆ng noh đĭ-đăng 'nŭng tơ lăm che jơk plĕnh păng gom hăm akar ka tih đang kơ noh dan kơpal hơbang.

English: Also they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth over it.
Bahnar: Lu sư kôch tơnuh ŭnh đơ̆ng chơnang soi; đơ̆ng noh bơyar minh blah che hơhĭm kơpal chơnang soi

English: They shall put on it all its implements with which they minister there—the firepans, the forks, the shovels, the basins, and all the utensils of the altar—and they shall spread on it a covering of badger skins, and insert its poles.
Bahnar: dan kơpal noh đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm tơdrong jang chơnang soi, wă khan kơđŏng mam mong, lu tơnuh ŭnh; gơ'bênh, pơnai, pơnhan, hăm đĭ-đăng lu tơmam yua kơ chơnang soi. Đơ̆ng noh klơ̆p kơpal chơnang soi noh minh blah akar ka tih păng sôr 'long tơnung wă tung.

English: And when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, when the camp is set to go, then the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them; but they shall not touch any holy thing, lest they die. “These are the things in the tabernacle of meeting which the sons of Kohath are to carry.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư chô̆ chôm đĭ tơmam lăm anih rơgoh boih, na đe pôk bơsŭn noh yak, na lu kon sâu Kôhat năm tung iŏk lu tơmam noh; lu sư ưh kơ gơh kơ hơtŭt 'bơm ôh tơmam rơgoh noh, kơnh lu sư lôch. Tơmam lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, tơmam noh mă lu kon sâu Kôhat athei tung.

English: “The appointed duty of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest is the oil for the light, the sweet incense, the daily grain offering, the anointing oil, the oversight of all the tabernacle, of all that is in it, with the sanctuary and its furnishings.”
Bahnar: Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, sư wei-lăng gah đak rơmă ôliwơ wă tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng, tơmam 'bâu phu, tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng ling-lang, đak rơmă 'bâu phu wă pik păng đĭ-đăng tơmam kiơ lăm noh păng lu tơmam yua lăm anih rơgoh.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis păng Arôn thoi âu

English: “Do not cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites
Bahnar: Athei wei pơm liơ 'nĕ ăn kơ adrĕch Kôhat lôch đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch bơngai Lêwi

English: but do this in regard to them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint each of them to his service and his task.
Bahnar: athei pơm tơdrong 'nâu ăn kơ lu sư, wă kơ tơdah năm jê̆ tơ anih rơgoh hloh, lu sư gơh arih, huay kơ lôch: Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo athei jao ăn tơdrong jang kơ rim 'nu păng tơmam kiơ lu sư wă tung.

English: But they shall not go in to watch while the holy things are being covered, lest they die.”
Bahnar: Mă khan lăp hrei hrei đĕch lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t lăng, lu tơmam rơgoh, kơnh hli kơ lu sư lôch.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Also take a census of the sons of Gershon, by their fathers’ house, by their families.
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m athei chih jô̆ adrĕch kon sâu Gersôn kiơ̆ adrĕch 'bă lu sư.

English: From thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, you shall number them, all who enter to perform the service, to do the work in the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm. Ih athei chih jô̆ lu sư hơdôm 'nu gơh jang tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and carrying
Bahnar: 'Nâu dôm tơdrong jang lu adrĕch kon sâu Gersôn, gô pơm păng tơmam lu sư wă tung.

English: They shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle and the tabernacle of meeting with its covering, the covering of badger skins that is on it, the screen for the door of the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: Lu sư gô tung che pĕng Anih Akŭm, che pĕng lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng che gom sư, tơmam gom klơ̆p pơm hăm akar ka tơ kơpal păng che pĕng 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: the screen for the door of the gate of the court, the hangings of the court which are around the tabernacle and altar, and their cords, all the furnishings for their service and all that is made for these things: so shall they serve.
Bahnar: lu che pĕng kơđeng tăp dăr kơ bơsŭn păng chơnang soi păng che pĕng 'măng kơđeng Anih Akŭm, lu tơlei giĕn păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm tơdrong noh păng jang dôm tơdrong jang noh.

English: “Aaron and his sons shall assign all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, all their tasks and all their service. And you shall appoint to them all their tasks as their duty.
Bahnar: 'Nâu đĭ dôm tơdrong jang kơ lu kon sâu adrĕch Gersôn, tơmam kiơ mă lu sư tung ba păng dôm tơdrong jang kiơ lu sư pơm athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư tơtă athei tơhlâu tơ'bôh; ih jao ăn kơ lu sư wei-lăng tơmam kiơ lu sư athei tung ba.

English: This is the service of the families of the sons of Gershon in the tabernacle of meeting. And their duties shall be under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
Bahnar: Lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, noh tơdrong jang kơ lu kon sâu Gersôn. Lu sư athei bơ̆jang kiơ̆ kơ Ithamar, kon drŏ-nglo Arôn 'bok soi tơm.

English: “As for the sons of Merari, you shall number them by their families and by their fathers’ house.
Bahnar: Ih athei chih jô̆ adrĕch kon sâu Mêrari, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch hnam 'bă lu sư

English: From thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, you shall number them, everyone who enters the service to do the work of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: jô̆ lu kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, wă jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai gơh jang tơgŭm tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And this is what they must carry as all their service for the tabernacle of meeting: the boards of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its sockets
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang lu kon sâu Mêrari lăm Anih akŭm, 'nâu lu tơmam lu sư wei-lăng păng tung dah đe pôk tơ nai; lu tơ̆r lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm lu tơpơng, jrăng, jrăng trôm

English: and the pillars around the court with their sockets, pegs, and cords, with all their furnishings and all their service; and you shall assign to each man by name the items he must carry.
Bahnar: lu jrăng tăp dăr kơđeng păng trôm jrăng, gơwŏk, tơlei giĕn păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm noh; lu iĕm jô̆ chih anăn rim tơmam kiơ lu sư wă wei-lăng păng tung anhăk.

English: This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, as all their service for the tabernacle of meeting, under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
Bahnar: Noh boih đĭ dôm tơdrong jang lu kon sâu Mêrari, dôm tơdrong jang lăm Anih Akŭm mă lu sư athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ Ithamar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn wơh.

English: And Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families and by their fathers’ house
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis, Arôn păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r chih jô̆ kon sâu Kôhat, kiơ̆ adrĕch, hnam 'bă lu sư

English: from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, wă khan đĭ-đăng bơngai mă gơh bơ̆jang tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: and those who were numbered by their families were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
Bahnar: păng lu bơngai mă đe chih jô̆ kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch, hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư, đei 'bar-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu.

English: These were the ones who were numbered of the families of the Kohathites, all who might serve in the tabernacle of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Noh boih lu bơngai kon sâu adrĕch Kôhat mă đei chih jô̆, wă khan đĭ-đăng bơngai bu mă gơh bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Môis păng Arôn chih jô̆, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă kơ Môis bơtho khan.

English: And those who were numbered of the sons of Gershon, by their families and by their fathers’ house
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gersôn chih jô̆ tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar boih, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch gah 'bă lu sư.

English: from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt, wă khan đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo mă gơh bơ̆jang tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: those who were numbered by their families, by their fathers’ house, were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
Bahnar: đĭ-đăng đei 'bar-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'nu.

English: These are the ones who were numbered of the families of the sons of Gershon, of all who might serve in the tabernacle of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of the LORD.
Bahnar: Dôm noh boih adrĕch adrung kon sâu Gersôn chih jô̆ wă khan dôm lu bơngai mă bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm mă Môis păng Arôn chih jô̆ kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă.

English: Those of the families of the sons of Merari who were numbered, by their families, by their fathers’ house
Bahnar: Bĕ gah kon sâu adrĕch Mêrari kư̆m đei jô̆, kiơ̆ adrĕch hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư

English: from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt, kiơ̆ adrĕch hnam dơnŏ 'bă lu sư wă khan lu kon drŏ-nglo mă gơh bơ̆jang lăm Anih Akŭm

English: those who were numbered by their families were three thousand two hundred.
Bahnar: đĭ-đăng đei pêng-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng.

English: These are the ones who were numbered of the families of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Dôm noh boih jô̆ lu kon sâu Mêrari. Môis păng Arôn chih jô̆ boih, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei athei Môis bơtho khan.

English: All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel numbered, by their families and by their fathers’ houses
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm adrĕch Lêwi mă Môis, Arôn păng đĭ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael đei chih jô̆ tơmơ̆t, kiơ̆ kơ lu adrĕch lu sư

English: from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, everyone who came to do the work of service and the work of bearing burdens in the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, wă khan lu bơngai mă wă bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, tung lu tơmam yua lăm noh.

English: those who were numbered were eight thousand five hundred and eighty.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng đei tơhngam-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt 'nu.

English: According to the commandment of the LORD they were numbered by the hand of Moses, each according to his service and according to his task; thus were they numbered by him, as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Đe đei chih jô̆ jao tơdrong jang adrĕch bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă gơnang kơ Môis bơtho khan, asong jang jao ăn kơ rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư athei pơm păng tơmam kiơ lu sư wă tung; đe đei asong tơdrong jang kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang đei pơkă khan kơ Môis noh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Command the children of Israel that they put out of the camp every leper, everyone who has a discharge, and whoever becomes defiled by a corpse.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael puh tơweh lê̆ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu đei jĭ apoh, lu bơngai đei jĭ jăn lĕch đak đuh păng lu bơngai mă đei hơtŭt 'bơm kơ akâu bơngai lôch bơngai ayơ mă 'mê̆-'mach noh.

English: You shall put out both male and female; you shall put them outside the camp, that they may not defile their camps in the midst of which I dwell.”
Bahnar: Mă drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn athei puh tơweh lê̆ lu sư tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông, wă kơ lu sư huay kơ pơm mơgrĭ 'mê̆-'mach kơ anih kơđông, mă đei Inh oei tơ lăm noh

English: And the children of Israel did so, and put them outside the camp; as the LORD spoke to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
Bahnar: lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ hloi thoi noh, puh tơweh lê̆ đĭ lu jĭ 'mê̆ đơ̆ng lăm kơđông, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei tơtă lê̆ boih kơ Môis.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel: ‘When a man or woman commits any sin that men commit in unfaithfulness against the LORD, and that person is guilty
Bahnar: Ih khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai Isơrael: Tơdah đei minh 'nu drŏ-nglo dah bơngai drŏ-kăn pơm tơdrong yoch mă kon bơngai ngăl juăt kơ pơm, pơm glăi kơ Kră Yang jô̆ bơngai noh pơm yoch

English: then he shall confess the sin which he has committed. He shall make restitution for his trespass in full, plus one-fifth of it, and give it to the one he has wronged.
Bahnar: bơngai noh athei tơbral roi tơdrong yoch sư păng pơdrâu tơwih tơmam tôm dôm thoi đêl păng ăn thim minh lăm pơđăm tơmam noh tơwih ăn kơ bơngai mă bơ̆n đei pơm glăi.

English: But if the man has no relative to whom restitution may be made for the wrong, the restitution for the wrong must go to the LORD for the priest, in addition to the ram of the atonement with which atonement is made for him.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai 'nâu ưh pă đei boih 'nhŏng oh păng dah bơngai wă iŏk tơmam đe tơwih ăn kư̆m pă đei lei tơmam âu gah Kră Yang, wă khan ăn kơ lu 'bok soi, thim đei triu tơno wă soi pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai tơplih tơdrong yoch sư.

English: Every offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they bring to the priest, shall be his.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơmam pơyơ̆r 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đơ̆ng lu bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r ăn kơ lu 'bok soi boih noh lê̆ kơ lu 'bok soi.

English: And every man’s holy things shall be his; whatever any man gives the priest shall be his.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơmam ayơ bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r 'măn lê̆ pơm tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dôm lu tơmam noh ăn kơ 'bok soi; tơmam kiơ mă đe ăn kơ 'bok soi noh tơmam sư boih.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘If any man’s wife goes astray and behaves unfaithfully toward him
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael: Tơdah đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn 'blal pơm yoch hăm klo sư

English: and a man lies with her carnally, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband, and it is concealed that she has defiled herself, and there was no witness against her, nor was she caught
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo ngôi hăm sư noh, ôn hlơp đơ̆ng klo sư; tơdah sư đei pơm kư̆ kă 'mê̆ brư̆ akâu sư ôn oei hlơp păng đe ưh kơ đei bu rôp 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng ti

English: if the spirit of jealousy comes upon him and he becomes jealous of his wife, who has defiled herself; or if the spirit of jealousy comes upon him and he becomes jealous of his wife, although she has not defiled herself
Bahnar: tơdah đei klo sư gar akăn sư, tơchĕng akăn sư pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ sư boih, dah huay kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach ră.

English: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest. He shall bring the offering required for her, one-tenth of an ephah of barley meal; he shall pour no oil on it and put no frankincense on it, because it is a grain offering of jealousy, an offering for remembering, for bringing iniquity to remembrance.
Bahnar: Lei klo sư athei chông ba akăn sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi, chĕp ba tơpŭng minh lăm mơjĭt êpha phe 'ba tơ'bâu wă pơm tơmam soi, sư ưh kơ gơh hling đak rơmă ôliwơ păng đak tơmam 'bâu phu tơ kơpal tơmam ôh, yua kơ noh jơ̆ tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba ưh kơ đei pham yua kơ tơdrong gar, tơmam soi âu wă pơtih ăn đei pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆

English: ‘And the priest shall bring her near, and set her before the LORD.
Bahnar: 'bok soi gô athei bơngai drŏ-kăn noh năm jê̆ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: The priest shall take holy water in an earthen vessel, and take some of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle and put it into the water.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi iŏk đak rơgoh tuh lăm bô̆i glah, chup iŏk 'bruih đơ̆ng hơnă Anih Akŭm na tah lăm đak noh.

English: Then the priest shall stand the woman before the LORD, uncover the woman’s head, and put the offering for remembering in her hands, which is the grain offering of jealousy. And the priest shall have in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.
Bahnar: Na 'bok soi athei bơngai drŏ-kăn noh dơ̆ng năm jê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na lang achăng sŏk bơngai drŏ-kăn noh, dan tơmam wă pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t tơpang ti sư, tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba tơmam pơyơ̆r kơ gar; păng 'bok soi đei chĕp đak tăng lăm ti sư wă pơtih thoi hiap.

English: And the priest shall put her under oath, and say to the woman, “If no man has lain with you, and if you have not gone astray to uncleanness while under your husband’s authority, be free from this bitter water that brings a curse.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi athei bơngai drŏ-kăn noh pơkă pơkăm păng khan kơ sư: Tơdah ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo ayơ 'bĭch hăm ih păng ih oei lui mơ̆ng kơ klo ih ưh kơ luĕl 'blal păng huay kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆, lei đak tăng tơdrong hiap âu huay kơ pơrăm ih.

English: But if you have gone astray while under your husband’s authority, and if you have defiled yourself and some man other than your husband has lain with you”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah klo ih oei pơgơ̆r, mă ih luĕl 'blal; pơm kư̆ kă 'mê̆ brư̆ păng tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo 'nguaih kơ klo ih 'bĭch hơdai ih.

English: then the priest shall put the woman under the oath of the curse, and he shall say to the woman—“the LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people, when the LORD makes your thigh rot and your belly swell
Bahnar: Kơplah noh 'bok soi athei bơngai drŏ-kăn noh pơma pơkă hiap akâu păng khan kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn thoi âu: Apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ ih jing bơngai pŭ tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ lăm lu kon pơlei ih, pơm kơ ih iôr hiang hơkĕ hơkong păng klak ih bơôr pơpông.

English: and may this water that causes the curse go into your stomach, and make your belly swell and your thigh rot.” ‘Then the woman shall say, “Amen, so be it.”
Bahnar: Thŭ đak tăng tơdrong hiap mơ̆t truh tơ lăm klơm klak pơm ăn kơ klak ih bơôr, blu ih ôm. Bơngai drŏ-kăn noh khan A-men, A-men.

English: ‘Then the priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall scrape them off into the bitter water.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi athei chih minh hlak hla bơar akar tơdrong hiap, na đang kơ noh iŏk đak tăng noh ôp.

English: And he shall make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water that brings the curse shall enter her to become bitter.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi ăn kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn huch đak tăng tơdrong hiap, đak tăng tơdrong hiap mơ̆t lăm akâu sư wă pơm kơ sư jĭ hang nuih kơtang dêh.a

English: Then the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, shall wave the offering before the LORD, and bring it to the altar
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, 'bok soi iŏk tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba kơ tơdrong gar đơ̆ng ti bơngai drŏ-kăn, chĕp tơi wơi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang na pơyơ̆r dan kơpal chơnang soi.

English: and the priest shall take a handful of the offering, as its memorial portion, burn it on the altar, and afterward make the woman drink the water.
Bahnar: Iŏk minh kơđôp tơpŭng tơmam soi wă tơ'blŏk păng soh tơ kơpal chơnang soi; klaih kơ noh sư gô ăn kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn noh huch đak noh.

English: When he has made her drink the water, then it shall be, if she has defiled herself and behaved unfaithfully toward her husband, that the water that brings a curse will enter her and become bitter, and her belly will swell, her thigh will rot, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
Bahnar: Tơdah đang kơ ăn kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn noh huch đak tăng tơdrong hiap, tơdah bơngai đei pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆ kơđang kơ̆l hơko klo sư lei đak tăng noh pơm kơ sư hơ̆-hang chhŭr nuih klak sư pơpông tih, blu sư ôm, lei na bơngai drŏ-kăn noh jing bơngai đe hiap pơtê̆ lăm lu kon pơlei sư.

English: But if the woman has not defiled herself, and is clean, then she shall be free and may conceive children.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bơngai drŏ-kăn noh huay kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆, oei rơgoh, lei sư huay kơ đei tơdrong truh răm kiơ păng gô pơjing kon hơ'lơ̆p.b

English: ‘This is the law of jealousy, when a wife, while under her husband’s authority, goes astray and defiles herself
Bahnar: Noh boih tơdrong khôi juăt gah tơdrong gar lu bơngai drŏ-kăn. Klo sư pơgơ̆r sư, dah sư pơm kư̆ kă pơm nhŭng kŏ

English: or when the spirit of jealousy comes upon a man, and he becomes jealous of his wife; then he shall stand the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute all this law upon her.
Bahnar: dah kơplah klo sư gar akăn sư; lei athei ba bơngai drŏ-kăn noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, hăm 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi gô pơm kơ sư kiơ̆ tôm thoi tơdrong khôi juăt 'nâu bơtho tơ'bôh.

English: Then the man shall be free from iniquity, but that woman shall bear her guilt.’ ”
Bahnar: Klo sư gô huay kơ yoch, gah bơngai drŏ-kăn noh pŭ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When either a man or woman consecrates an offering to take the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to the LORD
Bahnar: Ih roi tơbăt ăn kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael khan: Mă bơngai drŏ-nglo dah bơngai drŏ-kăn, mưh pơkă pơkăm wă jao kơdih akâu sư kơ Kră Yang. Kiơ̆ thoi khŭl Nasirit

English: he shall separate himself from wine and similar drink; he shall drink neither vinegar made from wine nor vinegar made from similar drink; neither shall he drink any grape juice, nor eat fresh grapes or raisins.
Bahnar: Na sư athei pơkơ̆m ưh kơ gơh et sik dah huch tơmam kiơ suai; kư̆m ưh kơ huch sik kiơ mă đe pơm hrâu păng plei hơmu, dah sa hơmu oei adrih, dah sa plei hơmu mă kro boih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh.

English: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is produced by the grapevine, from seed to skin.
Bahnar: Lăm đĭ năr sư pơjao akâu, ưh kơ gơh sa kiơ đe pơm hăm plei hơmu, mă găr truh tơ kơđoh akar sư.

English: ‘All the days of the vow of his separation no razor shall come upon his head; until the days are fulfilled for which he separated himself to the LORD, he shall be holy. Then he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
Bahnar: Kơplah lăm năr sư wă pơkă jao akâu thoi khŭl Nasirit, ưh kơ gơh yua săng hơkôih, hơkôih kơ̆l; sư athei oei mă rơgoh, lê̆ sŏk chăt kơjung dang yơ dĭng truh tơ đĭ năr sư pơkă kơdih akâu wă pơyơ̆r sư kơ Kră Yang.

English: All the days that he separates himself to the LORD he shall not go near a dead body.
Bahnar: Kơplah đĭ lăm năr sư pơjao pơyơ̆r akâu sư kơ Kră Yang sư ưh kơ gơh jê̆ akâu bơngai lôch ôh.

English: He shall not make himself unclean even for his father or his mother, for his brother or his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is on his head.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơh pơm ăn kơ akâu sư 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ mĕ, 'bă dah 'nhŏng mai oh sư lôch, kơplah lăm đĭ năr sư pơyơ̆r jao akâu kơ Kră Yang oei kơpal kơ̆l sư.

English: All the days of his separation he shall be holy to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơplah đĭ-đăng năr sư jao akâu kơdih, sư jing rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘And if anyone dies very suddenly beside him, and he defiles his consecrated head, then he shall shave his head on the day of his cleansing; on the seventh day he shall shave it.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai bu lôch ưh kơ tam băt 'bơ̆t anăp sư, pơm kơ kơ̆l sư 'mê̆-'mach mă đei jao wă kơ rơgoh, athei hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch lăm năr rơgoh noh, wă khan lăm năr mă tơpơh.

English: Then on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơhngam sư athei chĕp ba 'bar tŏ sem pơgâm dah 'bar tŏ kơtơp ăn kơ 'bok soi 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: and the priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned in regard to the corpse; and he shall sanctify his head that same day.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk minh pôm sem âu pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch, minh pôm dơ̆ng pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh păng pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch sư mă đei pơm, yua kơ atâu bơngai lôch, thoi noh lăm năr sư gô jao kơ̆l sư wă pơm rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: He shall consecrate to the LORD the days of his separation, and bring a male lamb in its first year as a trespass offering; but the former days shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, sư athei 'măn lê̆ akâu sư kơdih kơ Kră Yang, dôm lu năr mă jao akâu sư kơdih păng rôp minh pôm kon triu tơno dang minh sơnăm pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk tơdrong sư yoch glăi; mă-lei dôm lu năr sư pơyơ̆r jao akâu sư mă adrol noh ưh pă jô̆ boih, yua kơ năr sư jao akâu noh sư yoch 'mê̆-'mach boih.

English: ‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite: When the days of his separation are fulfilled, he shall be brought to the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Nâu khôi juăt khŭl Nasirit, tơdah đĭ tôm dôm năr mă pơyơ̆r jao akâu; đe gô chông ba sư tơ anăp 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: And he shall present his offering to the LORD: one male lamb in its first year without blemish as a burnt offering, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish as a sin offering, one ram without blemish as a peace offering
Bahnar: sư athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sư kơ Kră Yang, wă khan minh pôm triu kon tơno minh sơnăm ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, pơm tơmam soi 'buh, iŏk minh pôm kon triu akăn dơ̆ng ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, dang minh sơnăm pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r yua kơ tơdrong yoch, iŏk dơ̆ng minh pôm kon triu tơno ưh kơ jĭ kiơ pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi bơnê hiôk-hian

English: a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and their grain offering with their drink offerings.
Bahnar: hơdai hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch sa păng minh bai 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih; 'bĕng pơm hăm tơpŭng bơlŭ hăm rơmă ôliwơ, lu 'bĕng klang pik đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: Then the priest shall bring them before the LORD and offer his sin offering and his burnt offering
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơdah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch hơdai hăm tơmam soi 'buh sư.

English: and he shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of a peace offering to the LORD, with the basket of unleavened bread; the priest shall also offer its grain offering and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơyơ̆r kon triu tơno kơ Kră Yang wă pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian, hơdai hăm 'bĕng mă ưh kơ đei 'buih, 'bok soi kư̆m gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huch hai.

English: Then the Nazirite shall shave his consecrated head at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and shall take the hair from his consecrated head and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace offering.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, bơngai mă pơjao akâu sư athei hơkôih kơ̆l 'ngôch, iŏk sŏk sư soh lăm ŭnh ala tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian.

English: ‘And the priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and put them upon the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved his consecrated hair
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơngai jao akâu sư hơkôih sŏk boih, 'bok soi iŏk minh pah hơngiĕng ti triu tơno hơtŭk sĭn, iŏk minh pôm 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih păng iŏk minh hlak 'bĕng klang ưh kơ đei 'buih na dan 'bơ̆t 'bar pah tơpang ti sư.

English: and the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before the LORD; they are holy for the priest, together with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering. After that the Nazirite may drink wine.’
Bahnar: Na tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; noh jing tơmam rơgoh lê̆ kơ 'bok soi, kơtơh păng blu mă sư đei pơyơ̆r 'ma 'ngiĕo. Klaih kơ noh bơngai kiơ̆ khŭl Nasirit gơh huch sik hơmu.

English: “This is the law of the Nazirite who vows to the LORD the offering for his separation, and besides that, whatever else his hand is able to provide; according to the vow which he takes, so he must do according to the law of his separation.”
Bahnar: Noh jing tơdrong khôi juăt lu khŭl Nasirit pơm tơdrong wă pơkă pơkăm. Tơmam mă sư soi pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang kơ tơdrong jao akâu kơdih kiơ̆ khŭl Nasirit, gô jing thoi sư pơkă 'nguaih kơ tơmam nai mă sư đei pơyơ̆r. Sư athei pơm kiơ̆ trŏ tơdrong juăt jao akâu thoi minh 'nu bơngai khŭl Nasirit.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying, ‘This is the way you shall bless the children of Israel. Say to them
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn hăm đĭ kon drŏ-nglo sư thoi âu: Tơdrong iĕm wă sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael lu iĕm gô khan kơ lu sư

English: “The LORD bless you and keep you
Bahnar: Apơi Kră Yang ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ iĕm păng tơgŭm wei-lăng iĕm.

English: The LORD make His face shine upon you, And be gracious to you
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang pơchrang muh măt sư kơ iĕm păng mơnat kơ iĕm.

English: The LORD lift up His countenance upon you, And give you peace.” ’
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang tơmang lăng iĕm păng ăn tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ iĕm.

English: “So they shall put My name on the children of Israel, and I will bless them.”
Bahnar: Lu sư athei dan 'măn anăn Inh tơ kơpal lu kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael thoi noh, lei na Inh gô ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư.

English: Now it came to pass, when Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, that he anointed it and consecrated it and all its furnishings, and the altar and all its utensils; so he anointed them and consecrated them.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm đang boih, tuh đak rơmă păng 'măn lê̆ pha Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dôm lu tơmam yua lăm noh, tuh đak rơmă tơ chơnang soi păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua lăm chơnang soi noh đang boih

English: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ houses, who were the leaders of the tribes and over those who were numbered, made an offering.
Bahnar: na đĭ-đăng lu kơdră lăm adrĕch Isơrael, wă khan lu yŏng pơyơ̆r adrĕch adrung mă lu đe chih jô̆ boih năm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r lu sư.

English: And they brought their offering before the LORD, six covered carts and twelve oxen, a cart for every two of the leaders, and for each one an ox; and they presented them before the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu kră pơgơ̆r năm ba tơmam lu sư pơyơ̆r noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơdrâu tŏ gre đei tơmam gom lê̆ păng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, wă khan rim kơ 'bar 'nu kră pơgơ̆r adrĕch sư pơyơ̆r minh pôm gre păng rim 'nu kră pơgơ̆r pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm. Lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam noh 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Accept these from them, that they may be used in doing the work of the tabernacle of meeting; and you shall give them to the Levites, to every man according to his service.”
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ đĭ-đăng lu tơmam pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu đe âu wă yua lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Păng jao ăn bĕ kơ lu bơngai adrĕch Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang rim 'nu lu sư.

English: So Moses took the carts and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis iŏk đĭ lu gre păng lu rơmo dăm, pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai Lêwi.

English: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service
Bahnar: Sư pơjao ăn kơ lu kon sâu Gersôn 'bar tŏ gre păng puăn tŏ rơmo dăm, kiơ̆ tơdrong jang lu sư.

English: and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
Bahnar: Sư pơjao ăn kơ lu kon sâu Mêrari puăn tŏ gre păng tơhngam tŏ rơmo dăm, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư, đei Ithamar, kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, pơm bơngai pơgơ̆r wei-lăng.

English: But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because theirs was the service of the holy things, which they carried on their shoulders.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ pơjao gre hăm rơmo dăm kơ kon sâu Kôhat, yua kơ lu sư jang wei-lăng păng tung tơmam rơgoh tơ kơpal hơngiĕng lu sư.

English: Now the leaders offered the dedication offering for the altar when it was anointed; so the leaders offered their offering before the altar.
Bahnar: Lăm năr chơnang soi đei tuh đak 'bâu phu lu kră pơgơ̆r pơyơ̆r tơmam lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang wă pơm giĕng pơyơ̆r.

English: For the LORD said to Moses, “They shall offer their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Lu kră pơgơ̆r athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ năr wă pơih chơnang soi, bơngai âu năr 'nâu, bơngai noh năr nai, rim năr.

English: And the one who offered his offering on the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, from the tribe of Judah.
Bahnar: Nahsôn kon drŏ-nglo Aminađap, adrĕch Juđa pơyơ̆r năr blŭng-a adrol kơ pơkeh.

English: His offering was one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering
Bahnar: Tơmam sư pơyơ̆r noh minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp sư minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak pơnhan hu trăp sư tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh; pơđĭ kơ 'bar hlak noh dan 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, wă pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba

English: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense
Bahnar: minh hlak chhĕr maih trăp sư mơjĭt seikơl, dan 'bĕnh kơ pơgang 'bâu phu

English: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering
Bahnar: minh pôm kon rơmo dăm, minh pôm kon triu tơno, minh pôm triu tơno, truh minh sơnăm wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh

English: one kid of the goats as a sin offering
Bahnar: minh pôm bơbe dăm wă pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch

English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
Bahnar: pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ tơdrong 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian; 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, pơđăm tŏ triu tơno, pơđăm tŏ bơbe dăm păng pơđăm tŏ kon triu tơno truh minh sơnăm. Noh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng Nahsôn, kon drŏ-nglo Aminađap.

English: On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă 'bar Nathanel kon drŏ-nglo Suar, yŏng kơdră adrĕch Isakar, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sư

English: For his offering he offered one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering
Bahnar: sư pơyơ̆r minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak pơnhan hu trăp sư tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh 'bar hlak noh tă 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, wă yua pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba

English: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense
Bahnar: minh hlak pơnhan maih trăp mơjĭt seikơl, 'bĕnh kơ pơgang 'bâu phu

English: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering
Bahnar: minh pôm kon rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu kon tơno, minh pôm triu kon tơno minh sơnăm, yua wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh

English: one kid of the goats as a sin offering
Bahnar: minh pôm bơbe tơno yua wă pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch

English: and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
Bahnar: păng tơmam soi tơdrong 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian, 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, pơđăm tŏ triu tơno, pơđăm tŏ bơbe tơno păng pơđăm tŏ triu kon minh sơnăm. Noh boih mă tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng Nathanel, kon drŏ-nglo Suar.

English: On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, leader of the children of Zebulun, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă pêng, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu adrĕch Sabulôn, noh Êliap kon drŏ-nglo Hêlôn pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

English: His offering was one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering
Bahnar: Tơmam soi sư minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak pơnhan hu trăp tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh; pơđĭ kơ 'bar hlak tă kơ 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, wă yua pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba

English: one gold pan of ten shekels, full of incense
Bahnar: minh hlak pơnhan maih mơjĭt seikơl, 'bĕnh pơgang 'bâu phu

English: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering
Bahnar: minh pôm rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu kon tơno, minh pôm triu kon minh sơnăm, yua wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh

English: one kid of the goats as a sin offering
Bahnar: minh pôm bơbe tơno yua pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r wă huai tơdrong yoch

English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

English: On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, leader of the children of Reuben, presented an offering.

English: On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, leader of the children of Simeon, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă pơđăm, truh yŏng kơdră kon sâu Simêôn, noh Sêlumiel kon drŏ-nglo Surisadai. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

English: On the sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel, leader of the children of Gad, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơdrâu, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Gat, noh Êliasap, kon drŏ-nglo Đêuel, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi

English: On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, leader of the children of Ephraim, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơpơh, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Êphraim, noh Êlisama kon drŏ-nglo Amihut. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

Bahnar: Tơmam soi sư pơyơ̆r minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak kơthao hu trăp tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh, 'bar hlak pơnhan âu mong 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng bơlŭ hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, yua pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba

Bahnar: minh pôm bơbe tơno yua pơm tơmam soi wă huai tơdrong yoch

Bahnar: gah tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê kơ tơdrong hiôk-hian, 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, pơđăm tŏ triu tơno, pơđăm tŏ triu kon tơno truh minh sơnăm, pơđăm tŏ bơbe tơno. Noh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng Êlisama, kon drŏ-nglo Amihut.

English: On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, leader of the children of Manasseh, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơhngam, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Manase, noh Gamaliel kon drŏ-nglo Pêdasur; pơyơ̆r tơmam soi

English: On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, leader of the children of Benjamin, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơsĭn, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Bênjamin noh Abidan kon drŏ-nglo Gideôni. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

English: On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, leader of the children of Dan, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă mơjĭt truh tơ yŏng kơdră Đan, noh Ahiser kon drŏ-nglo Amisadai pơyơ̆r tơmam soi

English: On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ocran, leader of the children of Asher, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă mơjĭt-mônh, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Aser, noh Pagiel kon drŏ-nglo Ôkran. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

Bahnar: Tơmam soi sư pơyơ̆r minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak pơnhan hu trăp tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl anih rơgoh, pơđĭ kơ 'bar hlak mong 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng bơlŭ hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, yua pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba

Bahnar: păng gah tơmam soi pơyơ̆r tơdrong hiôk-hian, 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, pơđăm tŏ triu tơno, pơđăm tŏ bơbe tơno păng pơđăm tŏ triu kon tơno truh minh sơnăm. Noh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng Pagiel, kon drŏ-nglo Ôkran.

English: On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, leader of the children of Naphtali, presented an offering.
Bahnar: Năr mă mơjĭt-'bar, truh tơ yŏng kơdră kon sâu Neptali, noh Ahira, kon drŏ-nglo Ênan. Pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

English: His offering was one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering
Bahnar: Tơmam soi sư pơyơ̆r minh hlak chhĕr trăp minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl, minh hlak pơnhan trăp tơpơh-jĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh, pơđĭ kơ 'bar hlak pơnhan mong 'bĕnh kơ tơpŭng bơlŭ hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, yua pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba

English: and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
Bahnar: păng gah tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê pơyơ̆r tơdrong hiôk-hian, 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, pơđăm tŏ triu tơno, pơđăm tŏ bơbe tơno păng pơđăm tŏ triu kon tơno truh minh sơnăm. Noh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng Ahira, kon drŏ-nglo Ênan.

English: This was the dedication offering for the altar from the leaders of Israel, when it was anointed: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, and twelve gold pans.
Bahnar: Noh boih tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch bơngai Isơrael lăm năr pơm giĕng pơyơ̆r pơkeh pơyơ̆r chơnang soi, kơplah lăm năr đe tuh đak rơmă kơ chơnang soi: Mơjĭt-'bar hlak chhĕr hu, mơjĭt-'bar hlak pơnhan hu, mơjĭt-'bar hlak pơnhan maih

English: Each silver platter weighed one hundred and thirty shekels and each bowl seventy shekels. All the silver of the vessels weighed two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
