Bahnar: minh hlak chhĕr hu trăp sư minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt seikơl păng minh hlak pơnhan trăp sư tơpơh-jĭt seikơl. Jô̆ akŭm đĭ chhĕr hu păng pơnhan hu noh đei 'bar-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih rơgoh.

English: The twelve gold pans full of incense weighed ten shekels apiece, according to the shekel of the sanctuary; all the gold of the pans weighed one hundred and twenty shekels.
Bahnar: Mơjĭt hlak pơnhan maih 'bĕnh kơ pơgang 'bâu phu, lăm minh hlak trăp mơjĭt seikơl, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl anih rơgoh; jô̆ akŭm đĭ-đăng maih trăp sư minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt seikơl

English: All the oxen for the burnt offering were twelve young bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs in their first year twelve, with their grain offering, and the kids of the goats as a sin offering twelve.
Bahnar: jô̆ đĭ-đăng sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi 'buh đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo dăm păng mơjĭt-'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-'bar tŏ triu kon tơno truh minh sơnăm, hơdai hăm lu tơmam soi phe 'ba păng mơjĭt tŏ bơbe tơno yua pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch.

English: And all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings were twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, and the lambs in their first year sixty. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ rơmo dăm yua pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ tơdrong hiôk-hian đei 'bar-jĭt puăn tŏ păng tơdrâu-jĭt tŏ triu tơno, tơdrâu-jĭt bơbe tơno, tơdrâu-jĭt bơbe kon tơno truh minh sơnăm. Noh boih tơmam soi pơyơ̆r lăm năr pơih pơyơ̆r chơnang soi, đang kơ chơnang soi đei tuh đak rơmă boih.

English: Now when Moses went into the tabernacle of meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice of One speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim; thus He spoke to him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis mơ̆t tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm wă pơma dơnuh hăm Kră Yang, na sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma hăm sư đơ̆ng lăm Tơnglơ̆p Mơnat ăn dan kơpal Hom tơdrong Roi Tơbăt, tŏk-bŏk sơlam kơ 'bar tŏ chêrubim; Kră Yang pơma dơnuh hăm sư.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to Aaron, and say to him, ‘When you arrange the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lampstand.’ ”
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn; kơplah ih pơdơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng, lei dan tơpơh tŏ ŭnh nhơk pơchrang hơdah tơ gah anăp kơ jơ̆ng ŭnh jrĕnh.

English: And Aaron did so; he arranged the lamps to face toward the front of the lampstand, as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Arôn pơm kiơ̆ hloi sư dan tơpơh tŏ ŭnh kơđeng wă pơchrang hơdah tơ gah anăp kơ jơ̆ng ŭnh jrĕnh, thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă khan kơ Môis.

English: Now this workmanship of the lampstand was hammered gold; from its shaft to its flowers it was hammered work. According to the pattern which the LORD had shown Moses, so he made the lampstand.
Bahnar: Đe pơm jơ̆ng ŭnh jrĕnh păng maih, iŏk đơ̆ng jơ̆ng truh tơ lu pơkao đei hơjơ̆m, thoi noh đe hơjơ̆m pơm kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang mă pơma tơ'bôh kơ Môis rup.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Take the Levites from among the children of Israel and cleanse them ceremonially.
Bahnar: rơih iŏk bĕ lu bơngai Lêwi đơ̆ng lăm khŭl bơngai Isơrael păng pơm kơ lu sư rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: Thus you shall do to them to cleanse them: Sprinkle water of purification on them, and let them shave all their body, and let them wash their clothes, and so make themselves clean.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong ih athei pơm ăn kơ lu sư rơgoh; iŏk đak rơgoh tơtreh tơ kơpal akâu lu sư wă kơ rơgoh; lu sư athei hơkôih sŏk sop jơ̆p kơ akâu lu sư, pih hơbĕn ao păng hum hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh.

English: Then let them take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you shall take another young bull as a sin offering.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu sư athei rôp minh pôm rơmo dăm hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba tơpŭng bơlŭ hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ; gah ih athei rôp iŏk minh pôm rơmo dăm plơ̆ng dơ̆ng yua pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch

English: And you shall bring the Levites before the tabernacle of meeting, and you shall gather together the whole congregation of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơdah lu bơngai Lêwi âu 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn hăm 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: So you shall bring the Levites before the LORD, and the children of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites
Bahnar: Thoi noh, ih athei lu bơngai Lêwi dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang na lu kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael gô dan ti lu sư pel akâu lu bơngai Lêwi.

English: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before the LORD like a wave offering from the children of Israel, that they may perform the work of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Arôn gô pơyơ̆r lu bơngai Lêwi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang jing tơmam soi đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo, wă kơ lu sư bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then the Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the young bulls, and you shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the LORD, to make atonement for the Levites.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai Lêwi gô dan ti lu sư kơpal kơ̆l 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm noh, na ih athei pơyơ̆r rơmo âu pơm tơmam soi yua kơ tơdrong yoch păng minh pôm dơ̆ng pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang wă pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch ăn kơ lu bơngai Lêwi.

English: “And you shall stand the Levites before Aaron and his sons, and then offer them like a wave offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh ih athei lu bơngai Lêwi dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, na ih pơyơ̆r lu bơngai Lêwi âu thoi tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo âu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be Mine.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei rơih 'măn lê̆ lu bơngai Lêwi đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, lu bơngai noh gô jing gah Inh.

English: After that the Levites shall go in to service the tabernacle of meeting. So you shall cleanse them and offer them like a wave offering.
Bahnar: Đang kơ dôm tơdrong noh, lu bơngai Lêwi pha gô bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Na ih athei pơm ăn kơ lu sư rơgoh păng pơyơ̆r lu sư thoi tơmam soi pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo.

English: For they are wholly given to Me from among the children of Israel; I have taken them for Myself instead of all who open the womb, the firstborn of all the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh rơih iŏk lu bơngai Lêwi kơ Inh kơdih, wă tơplih lu kon kơdră bơngai Isơrael.

English: For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are Mine, both man and beast; on the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt I sanctified them to Myself.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng kon kơdră mă tơpŭ blŭng-a, mă kon bơngai dah kon sem dơrong kơdră Inh iŏk 'măn lê̆ gah Inh kơdih boih, kơplah lăm năr Inh pơlôch pơrăm lu kon kơdră bơngai Êyiptơ lăm char sư sơ̆.

English: I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Păng Inh kư̆m rơih iŏk lu bơngai Lêwi tơplih kơ kon kơdră lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the work for the children of Israel in the tabernacle of meeting, and to make atonement for the children of Israel, that there be no plague among the children of Israel when the children of Israel come near the sanctuary.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael Inh rơih iŏk boih bơngai Lêwi pơjao ăn kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă kơ bơ̆jang tơplih tơdrong jang Isơrael lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, kư̆m pơm soi sơmah wă huai tơdrong yoch ăn kơ lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, wă kơ lu sư mă năm jê̆ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, huay kơ đei tơdrong kiơ truh.

English: Thus Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the children of Israel did to the Levites; according to all that the LORD commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis, Arôn păng đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai Isơrael akŭm hơdai pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă khan kơ Môis; lu bơngai Isơrael pơm hăm lu bơngai Lêwi thoi noh.

English: And the Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; then Aaron presented them like a wave offering before the LORD, and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi hơmet kơdih akâu 'lơ̆ng rơgoh huay pă yoch păng pih hơbĕn ao lu sư; đơ̆ng noh Arôn pơyơ̆r lu sư thoi tơmam soi drơng tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch lu sư, wă hơmet ăn kơ lu sư rơgoh.

English: After that the Levites went in to do their work in the tabernacle of meeting before Aaron and his sons; as the LORD commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, lu bơngai Lêwi mơ̆t jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơgŭm Arôn păng tơgŭm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư; pơm kơ lu bơngai Lêwi, kiơ̆ trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơma pơkă kơ Môis gah lu sư.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “This is what pertains to the Levites: From twenty-five years old and above one may enter to perform service in the work of the tabernacle of meeting
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong pơkă gah lu bơngai Lêwi: Iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpơ̆ng lu sư athei mơ̆t bơ̆jang tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: and at the age of fifty years they must cease performing this work, and shall work no more.
Bahnar: mă-lei truh tơ pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm lu sư gô pơdơh ưh pă bơ̆jang dơ̆ng.

English: They may minister with their brethren in the tabernacle of meeting, to attend to needs, but they themselves shall do no work. Thus you shall do to the Levites regarding their duties.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m oei tơgŭm lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, wă jang wei-lăng dôm lu tơmam mă đei pơjao boih kơ lu sư bơngai Lêwi, mă-lei lu sư ưh pă đei bơ̆jang boih. Ăn kơ ih athei pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt noh kơ bơngai Lêwi kơplah ih pơjao ăn kơ lu sư tơdrong jang.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma hăm Môis tơ char glă Sinai: Lăm khei mă mônh, sơnăm mă 'bar, đang kơ lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: “Let the children of Israel keep the Passover at its appointed time.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael athei răk 'blŏk kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih mă đei pơkă lê̆ boih.

English: On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you shall keep it at its appointed time. According to all its rites and ceremonies you shall keep it.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei răk 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih, noh năr mơjĭt-puăn lăm khei 'nâu, gah kơsơ̆ măng; lu iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ đĭ-đăng tơdrong mă đei pơkă păng khôi juăt gah năr giĕng noh.

English: So Moses told the children of Israel that they should keep the Passover.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis athei lu bơngai Isơrael răk 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih.

English: And they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month, at twilight, in the Wilderness of Sinai; according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih lăm khei mônh, năr mơjĭt-puăn, gah kơsơ̆ măng, tơ char glă Sinai, pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong thoi Kră Yang đei khan pơkă kơ Môis.

English: Now there were certain men who were defiled by a human corpse, so that they could not keep the Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and Aaron that day.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu mơ'nah ưh kơ gơh kơ năm năr pơm giĕng Năm Brih yua kơ lu sư hơtŭt 'bơm kơ akâu bơngai lôch, lu sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp Môis hăm Arôn

English: And those men said to him, “We became defiled by a human corpse. Why are we kept from presenting the offering of the LORD at its appointed time among the children of Israel?”
Bahnar: lu sư khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Lu nhôn đĭ kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ 'bơm akâu lu bơngai lôch, yua kơ kiơ đe khă ưh kơ ăn lu nhôn pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt mă đei pơkă sơ̆?

English: And Moses said to them, “Stand still, that I may hear what the LORD will command concerning you.”
Bahnar: Môis tơl: Gô 'mơ̆i iĕm athei gô inh krao apinh Kră Yang wă kơ băt Sư bơtho pơkă thoi yơ gah lu iĕm.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘If anyone of you or your posterity is unclean because of a corpse, or is far away on a journey, he may still keep the LORD’s Passover.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ lu bơngai Isơrael: Tơdah đei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm dah lăm kon sâu lu iĕm pơm mơgrĭ 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ akâu atâu bơngai lôch, dah oei năm tơ ataih, na kư̆m athei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih Kră Yang.

English: On the fourteenth day of the second month, at twilight, they may keep it. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai noh athei pơm giĕng Năm Brih âu lăm năr mơjĭt-puăn khei 'bar, gah kơsơ̆ măng, sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông hăm hla 'nhot tăng

English: They shall leave none of it until morning, nor break one of its bones. According to all the ordinances of the Passover they shall keep it.
Bahnar: sa pơđĭ ưh kơ đei 'măn kiơ tŏ sĕt truh tơ năr dơning păng kư̆m ưh kơ gơ̆ minh pôm kơting mơ̆n; athei wei răk kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt giĕng Năm Brih noh.

English: But the man who is clean and is not on a journey, and ceases to keep the Passover, that same person shall be cut off from among his people, because he did not bring the offering of the LORD at its appointed time; that man shall bear his sin.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu rơgoh păng ưh kơ đei năm tơ ataih, tơdah ưh kơ đei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r ôh kơ năr giĕng Năm Brih, đe gô puh tơweh lê̆ sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư; yua kơ bơngai noh ưh kơ đei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi đei pơkă lê̆ năr boih, sư gô pŭ yoch kơdih.

English: ‘And if a stranger dwells among you, and would keep the LORD’s Passover, he must do so according to the rite of the Passover and according to its ceremony; you shall have one ordinance, both for the stranger and the native of the land.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah đei lu bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r 'maih wă pơm giĕng Năm Brih Kră Yang, sư athei kiơ̆ tơdrong tơtă păng khôi juăt gah giĕng Năm Brih. Kŭm đei minh tơdrong juăt kơ lu iĕm bơngai tơmoi păng bơngai kơtă mă tơpŭ lăm dêh char âu.

English: Now on the day that the tabernacle was raised up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, the tent of the Testimony; from evening until morning it was above the tabernacle like the appearance of fire.
Bahnar: Lăm năr đei pơdơ̆ng tơiung Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm đei hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn noh, Bơsŭn Tơdrong Tơbăt; đơ̆ng drơ̆m kơsơ̆ đei ŭnh kơpal Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dĭng truh pơgê dơning.

English: So it was always: the cloud covered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.
Bahnar: Đei thoi noh ling-lang; kơ'năr đei hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng kơmăng hơmơ̆l noh thoi ŭnh.

English: Whenever the cloud was taken up from above the tabernacle, after that the children of Israel would journey; and in the place where the cloud settled, there the children of Israel would pitch their tents.
Bahnar: Mưh khan hơmơ̆l noh đông weh tơ nai đơ̆ng bơsŭn, lu kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm tơ lăm anih ayơ mă hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng, na kon pơlei Isơrael oei tơ noh pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn.

English: At the command of the LORD the children of Israel would journey, and at the command of the LORD they would camp; as long as the cloud stayed above the tabernacle they remained encamped.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael yak năm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă păng kư̆m oei pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn kư̆m kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang. Kư̆ mơ̆ng kơ hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dang yơ, kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael oei tơ noh dang noh.

English: Even when the cloud continued long, many days above the tabernacle, the children of Israel kept the charge of the LORD and did not journey.
Bahnar: Mưh hơmơ̆l oei gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm noh đunh dang yơ, kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă, ưh kơ đei yak năm tơ nai.

English: So it was, when the cloud was above the tabernacle a few days: according to the command of the LORD they would remain encamped, and according to the command of the LORD they would journey.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mưh hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm lăm tŏ sĕt năr đĕch, na kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael kư̆ chu kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă oei pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn dah yak năm tơ nai.

English: So it was, when the cloud remained only from evening until morning: when the cloud was taken up in the morning, then they would journey; whether by day or by night, whenever the cloud was taken up, they would journey.
Bahnar: Tơdah hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm noh đơ̆ng kơsơ̆ truh pơgê păng dah pơgê dơning hơmơ̆l noh đông weh, na lu sư yak; mă kơ'năr dah kơmăng mơ̆ng kơ hơmơ̆l đông weh, na lu sư yak năm.

English: Whether it was two days, a month, or a year that the cloud remained above the tabernacle, the children of Israel would remain encamped and not journey; but when it was taken up, they would journey.
Bahnar: Hơmơ̆l gom hnam akŭm 'bar năr, dah minh khei, dah đunh hloh, kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael kư̆ kơ oei, ưh kơ yak weh; mă-lei mưh khan hơmơ̆l đông weh, na lu sư yak năm.

English: At the command of the LORD they remained encamped, and at the command of the LORD they journeyed; they kept the charge of the LORD, at the command of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael oei pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn dah yak năm mơ̆ng kơ Kră Yang tơtă; lu sư oei jang pơm kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang tơtă ăn kơ Môis.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Make two silver trumpets for yourself; you shall make them of hammered work; you shall use them for calling the congregation and for directing the movement of the camps.
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ 'bar tŏ keng hu; ih hơjơ̆m sư, na ih gô yua hlôm sư 'bơ̆t năr wă krao akŭm dah roi tơbăt wă yak năm.

English: When they blow both of them, all the congregation shall gather before you at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Tơdah đe hlôm yua pơđĭ 'bar tŏ keng lei đĭ-đăng lu bơngai năm akŭm tơ ih 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: But if they blow only one, then the leaders, the heads of the divisions of Israel, shall gather to you.
Bahnar: tơdah đe hlôm lăp minh pôm keng đĕch lei lu yŏng kơdră wă khan lu yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh bơngai Isơrael gô năm akŭm tơ ih.

English: When you sound the advance, the camps that lie on the east side shall then begin their journey.
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm hlôm keng re pơtĕnh roi tơbăt wă tơblah lei lu bơngai oei gah hơlĕch lu sư năm

English: When you sound the advance the second time, then the camps that lie on the south side shall begin their journey; they shall sound the call for them to begin their journeys.
Bahnar: mưh lu iĕm hlôm keng re pơtĕnh mă 'bar lei lu bơngai oei gah gơal năm; đe gô hlôm pơtĕnh kơplah noh lei wă tơbăt kơ 'bar kơđông noh năm.

English: And when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall blow, but not sound the advance.
Bahnar: Wă krao akŭm kon pơlei, lu iĕm hlôm re, mă-lei 'nĕ kơ hlôm re pơtĕnh

English: The sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets; and these shall be to you as an ordinance forever throughout your generations.
Bahnar: lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, lu bơngai mă pơm 'bok soi, lu sư gô hlôm keng noh. Đơ̆ng chăl arih âu dĭng truh tơ chăl nai, noh boih tơdrong juăt ăn kơ lu iĕm ling-lang.

English: “When you go to war in your land against the enemy who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets, and you will be remembered before the LORD your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.
Bahnar: Layơ lăm dêh iĕm đei tơdrong lu iĕm wă năm blah lu ayăt dah ayăt năm blah iĕm, lei lu iĕm athei hlôm keng re pơtĕnh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô 'blŏk kơ lu iĕm păng lu iĕm gô klaih đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt.

English: Also in the day of your gladness, in your appointed feasts, and at the beginning of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be a memorial for you before your God: I am the LORD your God.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr chơt hiôk, lăm năr pơm giĕng et sa tih păng lăm khei blŭng-a lu iĕm, lu iĕm hlôm keng 'bơ̆t kơplah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian păng tơmam soi 'buh bơ̆n kơdih, keng noh pơm tơmam tơ'blŏk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: Now it came to pass on the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, that the cloud was taken up from above the tabernacle of the Testimony.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm mă 'bar, khei 'bar, năr 'bar-jĭt, hơmơ̆l đông đơ̆ng bơbŭng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm roi tơbăt.

English: And the children of Israel set out from the Wilderness of Sinai on their journeys; then the cloud settled down in the Wilderness of Paran.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei Isơrael, pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong tơdă lê̆ boih lu sư năm lĕch đơ̆ng char glă Sinai păng hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t char glă Pharan

English: So they started out for the first time according to the command of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơngai Isơrael chu kiơ̆ Kră Yang tơtă thoi sư đei khan boih kơ Môis, na lu sư lĕch yak năm tăl mă mônh.

English: The standard of the camp of the children of Judah set out first according to their armies; over their army was Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
Bahnar: Hla-kơ adrĕch Juđa, yak kiơ̆ kơ khŭl, yak adrol. Nahsôn kon drŏ-nglo Aminađap pơm yŏng kơdră pơyơ̆r lu sư.

English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Issachar was Nethanel the son of Zuar.
Bahnar: Nathanel kon drŏ-nglo Suar pơm yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch Isakar.

English: And over the army of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.
Bahnar: Êliap kon drŏ-nglo Hêlôn, yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r khŭl Sabulôn.

English: Then the tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set out, carrying the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Đe yuih Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm boih na lu bơngai drŏ-nglo kon sâu Gersôn păng lu drŏ-nglo kon sâu Mêrari, lu sư tung tơmam Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na yak năm.

English: And the standard of the camp of Reuben set out according to their armies; over their army was Elizur the son of Shedeur.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, khŭl adrĕch kon sâu Rubên chĕp hla-kơ yak năm kiơ̆ kơ khŭl linh lu sư. Êlisur kon drŏ-nglo Sêdur yŏng pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch Rubên.

English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
Bahnar: Sêlumiel kon drŏ-nglo Surisadai yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch kon sâu Simêôn.

English: And over the army of the tribe of the children of Gad was Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
Bahnar: Êliasap kon drŏ-nglo Đêuel yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch kon sâu Gat.

English: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy things. (The tabernacle would be prepared for their arrival.)
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh khŭl Kôhat yak năm, tung ba tơmam rơgoh; lu đe tơiung pơdơ̆ng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng khăn noh boih adrol kơ lu sư truh.

English: And the standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set out according to their armies; over their army was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, khŭl kon sâu Êphraim yak năm chĕp hla-kơ khŭl lu sư, Êlisama kon drŏ-nglo Amihut yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
Bahnar: Gamaliel kon drŏ-nglo Pêdasur yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r khŭl adrĕch kon sâu Manase.

English: And over the army of the tribe of the children of Benjamin was Abidan the son of Gideoni.
Bahnar: Abidan kon drŏ-nglo Gideôni yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r lu adrĕch kon sâu Bênjamin.

English: Then the standard of the camp of the children of Dan (the rear guard of all the camps) set out according to their armies; over their army was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
Bahnar: Na, khŭl kon sâu Dan chĕp hla-kơ kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư; lu sư jing khŭl yak đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu khŭl adrĕch nai. Ahiser kon drŏ-nglo Amisadai, yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r khŭl adrĕch kon sâu Đan.

English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Asher was Pagiel the son of Ocran.
Bahnar: Pagiel kon drŏ-nglo Ôkran yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r khŭl lu adrĕch kon sâu Aser.

English: And over the army of the tribe of the children of Naphtali was Ahira the son of Enan.
Bahnar: Ahira kon drŏ-nglo Ênan yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r khŭl adrĕch kon sâu Naptali.

English: Thus was the order of march of the children of Israel, according to their armies, when they began their journey.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong lu sư asong băl năm hơtuch adrol kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lu sư tơdah lu sư wă yak năm.

English: Now Moses said to Hobab the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which the LORD said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will treat you well; for the LORD has promised good things to Israel.”
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Hôbap kon drŏ-nglo Rêuel, bơngai Madian, Hêbap 'nhŏng akăn sư, thoi âu: Lu nhôn năm truh tơ dêh char mă Kră Yang đei pơkă khan: Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm dêh char noh. Apinh ih năm hơdai nhôn, lu nhôn gô pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm ih; yua kơ Kră Yang pơkă wă ăn pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael.

English: And he said to him, “I will not go, but I will depart to my own land and to my relatives.”
Bahnar: Hôbap tơl: Inh ưh kơ năm ôh, mă-lei inh wih brŏk tơ dêh char inh kơdih, noh kon pơlei inh.

English: So Moses said, “Please do not leave, inasmuch as you know how we are to camp in the wilderness, and you can be our eyes.
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: Inh apinh ih 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ nhôn, yua kơ ih băt tơ lăm char glă anih ayơ lu nhôn mă gơh oei pơdơh pơdơ̆ng bơsŭn; ih thoi măt

English: And it shall be, if you go with us—indeed it shall be—that whatever good the LORD will do to us, the same we will do to you.”
Bahnar: tơdah ih năm hơdai nhôn, lu nhôn pơm ăn kơ ih đei pŭn hiôk kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk kơ nhôn.

English: So they departed from the mountain of the LORD on a journey of three days; and the ark of the covenant of the LORD went before them for the three days’ journey, to search out a resting place for them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael yak năm đơ̆ng kông Kră Yang, pêng năr kơ trong; hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p Kră Yang yak adrol kơ lăm pêng năr kơ trong 'nâu, wă chă anih ăn kơ kon pơlei pơdơh.

English: And the cloud of the LORD was above them by day when they went out from the camp.
Bahnar: Kơplah kơ'năr, kon pơlei Isơrael yuih anih bơsŭn lu sư yak năm, na hơmơ̆l Kră Yang kiơ̆ hơdai kơpal lu sư.

English: So it was, whenever the ark set out, that Moses said: “Rise up, O LORD! Let Your enemies be scattered, And let those who hate You flee before You.”
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t Hom Pơgơ̆p năm, na Môis khan thoi âu: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh ih iung yak bĕ, wă kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ Ih kơdâu tơklah tơklang đĭ; lu đe bu areh kơ Ih gô kơdâu ôn đĭ đơ̆ng anăp Ih!

English: And when it rested, he said: “Return, O LORD, To the many thousands of Israel.”
Bahnar: Mưh đe tơjur Hom Pơgơ̆p, na Môis khan thoi âu: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih wih brŏk bĕ tơ rơbâu hơngan bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now when the people complained, it displeased the LORD; for the LORD heard it, and His anger was aroused. So the fire of the LORD burned among them, and consumed some in the outskirts of the camp.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơma jŏk, kơ tơdrong pơmat-tat anat anot. Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, Kră Yang hil mĭl, ŭnh đơ̆ng Kră Yang soh sa khơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei păng ŭnh sa đơ̆ng jih kơđông.

English: Then the people cried out to Moses, and when Moses prayed to the LORD, the fire was quenched.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei krao apinh Môis; Môis krao khan apinh Kră Yang, na ŭnh păt.

English: So he called the name of the place Taberah, because the fire of the LORD had burned among them.
Bahnar: Đe anăn hloi anih 'nâu Tabêra, yua kơ ŭnh đơ̆ng Kră Yang soh sa tơ lăm lu sư.

English: Now the mixed multitude who were among them yielded to intense craving; so the children of Israel also wept again and said: “Who will give us meat to eat?
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei Isơrael đei jơhngơ̆m rơhing 'maih wă sa dêh; na pơm kơ kon pơlei Isơrael nhơ̆m apinh hơpơi khan: Rŏ kơ đei 'nhĕm sa dêh?

English: We remember the fish which we ate freely in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic
Bahnar: Lu nhôn 'blŏk kơ đêl 'nhĕm ka đe ăn kơ lu nhôn sa đĕch lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, đei pia đak pia bih, 'bum kơdĭm, kơdĭm hmă, kơdĭm toih.

English: but now our whole being is dried up; there is nothing at all except this manna before our eyes!”
Bahnar: Na dang ei, jơhngơ̆m lu nhôn đĭ jô hŏnh, ưh kơ đei kiơ sa! Măt nhôn 'bôh 'băi pôm mana đĕch.

English: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and its color like the color of bdellium.
Bahnar: Mana thoi găr hla ngo, hlăng thoi chai 'long.

English: The people went about and gathered it, ground it on millstones or beat it in the mortar, cooked it in pans, and made cakes of it; and its taste was like the taste of pastry prepared with oil.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei chă dônh tah, peh hăm tơpăl wă kơ hĕch, dah ot hăm tơpăl ot, hơtŭk sư lăm gŏ dah pơm 'bĕng; sa sư thoi 'bĕng đe hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: And when the dew fell on the camp in the night, the manna fell on it.
Bahnar: Kơmăng tŭk jur tơ kơpal bơsŭn lu sư lăm kơđông na mana kư̆m jruh hơdai.

English: Then Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, everyone at the door of his tent; and the anger of the LORD was greatly aroused; Moses also was displeased.
Bahnar: Môis kơtơ̆ng kon pơlei nhơ̆m, rim 'nu, 'bơ̆t 'măng bơsŭn sư kơdih; tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl dêh na Môis sư sơ'ngon dêh kơ tơdrong noh.

English: So Moses said to the LORD, “Why have You afflicted Your servant? And why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You have laid the burden of all these people on me?
Bahnar: Môis krao khan apinh Kră Yang: Yua kơ kiơ Ih pơm ăn kơ đĭch đam Ih thoi noh? Yua kơ kiơ inh mă ưh kơ đei mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, na mă Ih ăn kơ inh pŭ dôm tơdrong trăp, đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla 'nâu?

English: Did I conceive all these people? Did I beget them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a guardian carries a nursing child,’ to the land which You swore to their fathers?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ inh anăp tơpŭ lu sư ưh? Na mă Ih khan kơ inh: Pŭ krôp kon pơlei wei kon pơla âu lăm jơhngơ̆m ih bĕ, thoi bơngai 'bă mă pôk kon hơ'lơ̆p sư oei mŏm, dĭng mă truh tơ dêh char mă Ih đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok yă lu sư.

English: Where am I to get meat to give to all these people? For they weep all over me, saying, ‘Give us meat, that we may eat.’
Bahnar: Inh gô chă đei 'nhĕm đơ̆ng yơ wă asong kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei âu? Yua kơ lu sư năm nhơ̆m tơ inh khan: Asong ăn kơ lu nhôn 'nhĕm sa.

English: I am not able to bear all these people alone, because the burden is too heavy for me.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ kĕ pŭ đĭ lu kon pơlei âu ôh, lu sư jing trăp trĭn tơpă kơ inh!

English: If You treat me like this, please kill me here and now—if I have found favor in Your sight—and do not let me see my wretchedness!”
Bahnar: Tơdah Ih pơm kơ inh thoi noh păng dah inh đei tơdrong mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp ih, 'lơ̆ng hloh Ih jah pơlôch inh đĕch, wă kơ inh huay pă 'bôh tơdrong pơmat-tat inh!

English: So the LORD said to Moses: “Gather to Me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people and officers over them; bring them to the tabernacle of meeting, that they may stand there with you.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis dơ̆ng thoi âu: Krao akŭm bĕ kơ inh tơpơh-jĭt 'nu lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael wă khan dôm lu kră wei-lăng kon pơlei mă ih băt; ba lu sư năm tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t noh hơdai ih.

English: Then I will come down and talk with you there. I will take of the Spirit that is upon you and will put the same upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, that you may not bear it yourself alone.
Bahnar: Na Inh gô jur, pơma dơnuh hăm ih tơ noh; Inh gô iŏk ăn Yang Bơhngol Inh oei lăm ih păng oei lăm lu sư mơ̆n, wă kơ lu sư wang pŭ tơdrong trăp kon pơlei hơdai ih păng ih huay pă pŭ minh drô̆ ih.

English: Then you shall say to the people, ‘Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you shall eat meat; for you have wept in the hearing of the LORD, saying, “Who will give us meat to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt.” Therefore the LORD will give you meat, and you shall eat.
Bahnar: Ih athei roi tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei thoi âu: Pơgê dơning athei rim 'nu hơmet akâu kơdih mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; lei na lu iĕm đei 'nhĕm sa, yua kơ lu iĕm nhơ̆m boih, đon Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng lu iĕm nhơ̆m khan: Bu gô ăn kơ lu nhôn 'nhĕm sa, yua kơ lu nhôn đĭ hiôk boih oei lăm dêh char Êyiptơ, na Kră Yang gô ăn kơ lu iĕm 'nhĕm sa, na lu iĕm gô đei 'nhĕm sa.

English: You shall eat, not one day, nor two days, nor five days, nor ten days, nor twenty days
Bahnar: Lu iĕm sa 'nhĕm ưh kơ sĭ lăp minh năr, lăp 'bar năr, lăp pơđăm năr, mơjĭt năr dah 'bar-jĭt năr đĕch ôh

English: but for a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you, because you have despised the LORD who is among you, and have wept before Him, saying, “Why did we ever come up out of Egypt?” ’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dĭng truh tơ minh khei hloi, dĭng mă 'nhĕm iĕm 'bĕnh mah lĕch trong muh păng lu iĕm đĭ pă 'maih sa, yua kơ lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Kră Yang mă oei tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm păng nhơ̆m krao 'bơ̆t anăp Sư khan: Yua kơ kiơ lu nhôn mă lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: And Moses said, “The people whom I am among are six hundred thousand men on foot; yet You have said, ‘I will give them meat, that they may eat for a whole month.’
Bahnar: Môis tơl khan: Lăm kon pơlei mă inh oei âu, đei tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, na Ih khan: Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei âu sa 'nhĕm lăm minh khei.

English: Shall flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, to provide enough for them? Or shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to provide enough for them?”
Bahnar: Đe gô pơlôch triu păng rơmo dĭng mah tôm ăn kơ lu sư hă? Dah đe gô rôp akŭm pơpôi đĭ ka lăm đak dơsĭ dĭng mah tôm kơ lu sư hă?

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Has the LORD’s arm been shortened? Now you shall see whether what I say will happen to you or not.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Ti Kră Yang kơđeh hă?a Ih gô lăng hŏ tơdrong mă Inh đei khan boih hăm ih gô lăng hăm truh trŏ 'blep.

English: So Moses went out and told the people the words of the LORD, and he gathered the seventy men of the elders of the people and placed them around the tabernacle.
Bahnar: Môis lĕch, năm roi ăn dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang kơ kon pơlei, dơ̆ng noh na krao akŭm tơpơh-jĭt 'nu lu kră wei-lăng kon pơlei, tơoei lê̆ lu sư tăp dăr kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then the LORD came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was upon him, and placed the same upon the seventy elders; and it happened, when the Spirit rested upon them, that they prophesied, although they never did so again.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur hăm hơmơ̆l, pơma hăm Môis. Sư iŏk Yang Bơhngol ăn oei hăm Môis păng ăn kơ tơpơh-jĭt 'nu lu kră wei-lăng. Lăp Yang Bơhngol jur oei hăm lu kră, lu sư pơtơm pơma khan lê̆ adrol, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ pơma khan lê̆ adrol ling-lang hloi ôh.

English: But two men had remained in the camp: the name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad. And the Spirit rested upon them. Now they were among those listed, but who had not gone out to the tabernacle; yet they prophesied in the camp.
Bahnar: Đei 'bar 'nu oei lăm kơđông; minh 'nu anăn sư Eldat, minh noh dơ̆ng anăn sư Mêdat, na Yang Bơhngol mơ̆t oei lăm bre sư, bre sư pơtơm pơma khan lê̆ adrol lăm kơđông. 'Bar 'nu bre sư âu, lăm khŭl mă đe đei chih jô̆ anăn noh, mă-lei ưh kơ đei năm tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And a young man ran and told Moses, and said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm năm khan kơ Môis: Eldat păng Mêdat bre sư pơma khan lê̆ adrol lăm kơđông.

English: So Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ assistant, one of his choice men, answered and said, “Moses my lord, forbid them!”
Bahnar: Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, bơngai awih awăn ăn kơ Môis, tơl thoi âu: Ơ Môis, kơdră inh, khă lu sư bĕ!

English: Then Moses said to him, “Are you zealous for my sake? Oh, that all the LORD’s people were prophets and that the LORD would put His Spirit upon them!”
Bahnar: Môis tơl sư: Ih wă chrih gar kơ inh loh? Ô! Apơi rŏ kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Kră Yang gơh pơma khan lê̆ adrol păng rŏ kơ Kră Yang ăn Yang Bơhngol kơ lu sư.

English: And Moses returned to the camp, he and the elders of Israel.
Bahnar: Môis păng lu kră wei-lăng wih brŏk tơ kơđông dơ̆ng.

English: Now a wind went out from the LORD, and it brought quail from the sea and left them fluttering near the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and about a day’s journey on the other side, all around the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the ground.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn hloi kial tơthu bah đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ, puh ba hloi sem wăt huŏng tơ jê̆ tăp dăr kơđông, minh pah âu huŏng dă să wă đei minh năr kơ trong yak, minh pah to dơ̆ng huŏng dă să wă đei minh năr kơ trong yak; hơ'bơ̆l wă dang 'bar hlok đơ̆ng teh.

English: And the people stayed up all that day, all night, and all the next day, and gathered the quail (he who gathered least gathered ten homers); and they spread them out for themselves all around the camp.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei iung dônh sem wăt lăm năr noh, măng noh păng truh năr dơning; bơngai bu dônh tŏ sĕt hloh wă dang mơjĭt hnŏngb đe sơ̆k tơraih sư tăp dăr kơđông.

English: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the wrath of the LORD was aroused against the people, and the LORD struck the people with a very great plague.
Bahnar: Sa 'nhĕm oei đom lăm hơnĕnh, ưh kơ tam kơkă đei hloi tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ kon pơlei, pơm ăn đei tơdrong truh pơrăm kon pơlei pơla trăp dêh tơpă.

English: So he called the name of that place Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had yielded to craving.
Bahnar: Đe anăn hloi anih noh Kibrôt Hatawa,c yua kơ tơ anih noh đe 'bŭ lu bơngai mă jơhngơ̆m ham kơ sa.

English: From Kibroth Hattaavah the people moved to Hazeroth, and camped at Hazeroth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Kibrôt Hatawa kon pơlei năm truh tơ Haserôt, oei pơdơh tơ noh.

English: Then Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Ethiopian woman whom he had married; for he had married an Ethiopian woman.
Bahnar: Miriam păng Arôn pơma 'bơm Môis yua kơ sư iŏk oei kơ minh 'nu drŏ-kăn bơngai Kus

English: So they said, “Has the LORD indeed spoken only through Moses? Has He not spoken through us also?” And the LORD heard it.
Bahnar: Bre sư khan: “Kră Yang yua lăp minh 'nu Môis đĕch hă, wă khan tơbăt kơ kon pơlei? Sư kư̆m ưh kơ wă yua ba hai ah?” Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh.

English: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more than all men who were on the face of the earth.)
Bahnar: Môis boih mă iŏk đon ala iơ̆m dim hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai kơpal teh âu.

English: Suddenly the LORD said to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the tabernacle of meeting!” So the three came out.
Bahnar: Chĭnh đei hloi nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, Arôn, Miriam thoi âu: Pêng 'nu iĕm athei năm bĕ tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, năm pơđĭ pêng 'nu iĕm hloi.

English: Then the LORD came down in the pillar of cloud and stood in the door of the tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam. And they both went forward.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur hăm hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na krao Arôn păng Miriam; na bre sư năm.

English: Then He said, “Hear now My words: If there is a prophet among you, I, the LORD, make Myself known to him in a vision; I speak to him in a dream.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ bre sư thoi âu: Mơ̆ng mă nhen bĕ nơ̆r Inh. Tơdah lăm lu iĕm đei bơngai bu pơma khan lê̆ adrol, Inh boih Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh kơ sư lăm tơdrong sư 'bôh, păng pơma kơ sư lăm tơdrong sư apo.

English: Not so with My servant Moses; He is faithful in all My house.
Bahnar: Đĭch đam Inh Môis ưh kơ trŏ thoi noh ôh, sư bơngai tơpăt tơnăp dêh lăm hnam Inh.

English: I speak with him face to face, Even plainly, and not in dark sayings; And he sees the form of the LORD. Why then were you not afraid To speak against My servant Moses?”
Bahnar: Inh pơma dơnuh hăm sư 'bơ̆r păng 'bơ̆r, hơđăl hơdah, ưh kơ đei tơdrong pơpơn ôn ôh; păng sư 'bôh boih rup Kră Yang. Thoi noh, liơ lu iĕm ưh kơ hli pơ̆n pơma 'bơm kơ đĭch đam Inh Môis?

English: So the anger of the LORD was aroused against them, and He departed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl dêh kơ bre sư; đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang tŏk.

English: And when the cloud departed from above the tabernacle, suddenly Miriam became leprous, as white as snow. Then Aaron turned toward Miriam, and there she was, a leper.
Bahnar: Kơplah hơmơ̆l tŏk đông đơ̆ng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na Miriam 'bơm kơnê̆ jĭ chin 'bĕnh akâu tơkhôih nhen prĕl, Arôn lăng tơ Miriam, 'bôh sư đĭ jĭ chin boih.

English: So Aaron said to Moses, “Oh, my lord! Please do not lay this sin on us, in which we have done foolishly and in which we have sinned.
Bahnar: Arôn khan kơ Môis: Ô, yŏng inh, apinh 'nĕ tơpŭ tơ nhi tơdrong yoch mă nhi pơm kơtul, tơdrong yoch mă nhi pơm ưh kơ hlôh kơwao mă đei pơm boih.

English: Please do not let her be as one dead, whose flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother’s womb!”
Bahnar: Apinh ih 'nĕ ăn kơ sư thoi minh 'nu kon nge sĕch akâu sư đĭ bluch răm minh puăt boih.

English: So Moses cried out to the LORD, saying, “Please heal her, O God, I pray!”
Bahnar: Môis krao khan apinh Kră Yang thoi âu: Ơ, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei! Inh hơdrĭ hơpơi kơ Ih pơklaih ăn kơ mŏ inh.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not be shamed seven days? Let her be shut out of the camp seven days, and afterward she may be received again.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơl Môis thoi âu: Tơdah 'bă sư gơsoh đak hai 'bơ̆t muh măt sư, hăm trŏ kơ sư mơlâu lăp tơpơh năr? Đe athei chĭt lê̆ sư tơ 'nguaih kơđông tơpơh năr; đơ̆ng noh đe iŏk sư tơmơ̆t lăm anih kơđông dơ̆ng.

English: So Miriam was shut out of the camp seven days, and the people did not journey till Miriam was brought in again.
Bahnar: Thoi ei, đe chĭt lê̆ Miriam lăm tơpơh năr tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông, lu kon pơlei ưh kơ đei năm tơ nai ôh dĭng truh tơ Miriam mă đe iŏk tơmơ̆t sư 'mơ̆i.

English: And afterward the people moved from Hazeroth and camped in the Wilderness of Paran.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh, kon pơlei yak năm lĕch đơ̆ng Haserôt, na oei pơdơh tơ char glă Pharan.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Send men to spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel; from each tribe of their fathers you shall send a man, every one a leader among them.”
Bahnar: Athei ăn bơngai năm chop dăr lăng dêh char Kanaan, dêh char mă Inh gô ăn kơ lu kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael. Kư̆ kơ rim adrĕch ih rơih iŏk minh 'nu năm; minh 'nu mă pơm yŏng kơdră kơ adrĕch sư.

English: So Moses sent them from the Wilderness of Paran according to the command of the LORD, all of them men who were heads of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang Môis wơh lu yŏng kơdră Isơrael năm đơ̆ng char glă Pharan.

English: Now these were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur
Bahnar: 'Nâu dôm anăn lu sư: Samua kon drŏ-nglo Sakur đơ̆ng adrĕch Rubên

English: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori
Bahnar: Saphat kon drŏ-nglo Hôri đơ̆ng adrĕch Simêôn

English: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh
Bahnar: Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê đơ̆ng adrĕch Juđa

English: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph
Bahnar: Igal kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep đơ̆ng adrĕch Isakar

English: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun
Bahnar: Hôsêa kon drŏ-nglo Nun đơ̆ng adrĕch Êphraim

English: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu
Bahnar: Palti kon drŏ-nglo Raphu đơ̆ng adrĕch Bênjamin

English: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi
Bahnar: Gadiel kon drŏ-nglo Sôdi đơ̆ng adrĕch Sabulôn

English: from the tribe of Joseph, that is, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi
Bahnar: Gatdi kon drŏ-nglo Susi đơ̆ng adrĕch Jôsep, wă khan kiơ̆ adrĕch Manase

English: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli
Bahnar: Ammiel kon drŏ-nglo Gêmali đơ̆ng adrĕch Đan

English: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael
Bahnar: Sêthur kon drŏ-nglo Mikel đơ̆ng adrĕch Aser

English: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi
Bahnar: Nahbi kon drŏ-nglo Wôsi đơ̆ng adrĕch Naptali

English: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
Bahnar: Gêuel kon drŏ-nglo Maki đơ̆ng adrĕch Gat.

English: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun, Joshua.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơngai mă Môis wơh lu sư năm chop dăr lăng char. Môis tơplih anăn Hôsê, kon drŏ-nglo Nun krao anăn Jôsuê.

English: Then Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, “Go up this way into the South, and go up to the mountains
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis wơh lu sư năm chop dăr lăng char Kanaan păng pơkă khan: Đơ̆ng âu tŏk năm bĕ tơ thŭng glă gah gơal păng năm tŏk tơ gah groi kông

English: and see what the land is like: whether the people who dwell in it are strong or weak, few or many
Bahnar: na lăng char noh thoi yơ, lu kon pơlei oei tơ lăm noh pran dah tơrăn, lu sư lơ dah tŏ sĕt.

English: whether the land they dwell in is good or bad; whether the cities they inhabit are like camps or strongholds
Bahnar: Lăng dêh char lu sư oei noh 'lơ̆ng dah kơnê̆; lăng lăm pơlei tih noh, lu sư chă oei pơm bơsŭn pơdơh đĕch dah đei anih hnam dur kơjăp

English: whether the land is rich or poor; and whether there are forests there or not. Be of good courage. And bring some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the season of the first ripe grapes.
Bahnar: teh lu sư jang sa, 'lơ̆ng dah kơnê̆, hăm đei 'long dah ưh. Athei mă nuih păng phĕ ba plei hơmu đum.

English: So they went up and spied out the land from the Wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob, near the entrance of Hamath.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu đe noh năm chop dăr lăng dêh char, iŏk đơ̆ng char glă Yin truh tơ Rêhôp, jê̆ 'măng jang Hamat.

English: And they went up through the South and came to Hebron; Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, were there. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
Bahnar: Lu sư yak năm đơ̆ng gah gơal tŏk truh tơ pơlei tih Hêbrôn, tơ noh đei Ahiman, Sêsai păng Tanmai, lu kon sâu Anak oei tơ noh. Đe pơjing pơlei tih Hêbrôn tơpơh sơnăm adrol kơ pơlei Sôan lăm char Êyiptơ

English: Then they came to the Valley of Eshcol, and there cut down a branch with one cluster of grapes; they carried it between two of them on a pole. They also brought some of the pomegranates and figs.
Bahnar: lu sư năm truh tơ Thŭng Êskôl, tơ noh lu sư chơ̆ng iŏk minh tơ'bla, đei minh hơie plei hơmu trem; lu sư chă 'long 'bar 'nu tung, lu sư kư̆m đei phĕ ba plei hơra păng plei gărnăt mơ̆n.

English: The place was called the Valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the men of Israel cut down there.
Bahnar: Đe anăn anih 'nâu thŭng Êskôl,a kơ lu bơngai Isơrael đei chơ̆ng iŏk hơie plei hơmu đơ̆ng noh.

English: And they returned from spying out the land after forty days.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai năm chop dăr lăng char noh lăm puăn-jĭt năr na brŏk.

English: Now they departed and came back to Moses and Aaron and all the congregation of the children of Israel in the Wilderness of Paran, at Kadesh; they brought back word to them and to all the congregation, and showed them the fruit of the land.
Bahnar: Brŏk truh boih lu sư năm tơ Môis, Arôn păng đĭ khŭl adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, tơ Kades lăm char glă Pharan, lu sư roi ăn kơ bre sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei băt păng tơ'bôh ăn plei 'long sa đơ̆ng lăm char noh.

English: Then they told him, and said: “We went to the land where you sent us. It truly flows with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Môis, lu nhôn đei truh boih tơ char mă ih đei wơh nhôn năm; lăm char noh teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơmam sa rơkah rơkai, 'nâu boih plei 'long sa đơ̆ng char noh.

English: Nevertheless the people who dwell in the land are strong; the cities are fortified and very large; moreover we saw the descendants of Anak there.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei oei lăm char noh bơngai pran kơtang, anih pơlei dur kơjăp păng tih; mă-lei lu nhôn 'bôh đei kon sâu Anak oei tơ noh.

English: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the South; the Hittites, the Jebusites, and the Amorites dwell in the mountains; and the Canaanites dwell by the sea and along the banks of the Jordan.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Amalek oei tơ gah gơal, kon pơlei Hêtit, kon pơlei Jêbus păng kon pơlei Amôrit oei lăm tơring jê̆ kông, kon pơlei Kanaan oei cheng dơsĭ păng rok kiơ̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses, and said, “Let us go up at once and take possession, for we are well able to overcome it.”
Bahnar: Kalep pơm ăn kơ lu kon pơlei oei hreh 'bơ̆t anăp Môis, na sư khan: Lu bơ̆n athei năm tŏk blah iŏk oei hloi lăm char noh, gô jei lu bơ̆n.

English: But the men who had gone up with him said, “We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai drŏ-nglo năm hơdai Kalep khan: Lu bơ̆n ưh kơ kĕ năm blah iŏk char 'nâu đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei noh ôh, lu sư pran hloh kơtang hloh kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: And they gave the children of Israel a bad report of the land which they had spied out, saying, “The land through which we have gone as spies is a land that devours its inhabitants, and all the people whom we saw in it are men of great stature.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael, lu đe noh roi pơăm tơă khan: Lu kon pơlei oei lăm char mă lu nhôn đei năm chop dăr lăng tơ jơ̆p-jang, char noh luăn sa pơđĭ kon pơlei sư kơdih; lu nhôn 'bôh đĭ lu kon pơlei noh akâu tih kơjung ngăl.

English: There we saw the giants (the descendants of Anak came from the giants); and we were like grasshoppers in our own sight, and so we were in their sight.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn 'bôh lu sư tih kơjung, noh lu kon sâu Anak, adrĕch bơngai nuih pran kơtang; lu nhôn lăng bơ̆n kơdih rŏ thoi lep 'ba, lu sư lăng lu nhôn kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: So all the congregation lifted up their voices and cried, and the people wept that night.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu tơpôl bơngai akŭm ôr re păng lu kon pơlei nhơ̆m hmoi lăm măng noh.

English: And all the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron, and the whole congregation said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt! Or if only we had died in this wilderness!
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael jŏk kơ Môis păng Arôn; đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl khan kơ bre sư thoi âu: 'Lơ̆ng hloh kơ lu nhôn jah lôch tơ lăm char Êyiptơ ki, dah jah lôch tơ lăm char glă âu đĕch!

English: Why has the LORD brought us to this land to fall by the sword, that our wives and children should become victims? Would it not be better for us to return to Egypt?”
Bahnar: Liơ mă Kră Yang chông ba lu nhôn mơ̆t tơ lăm dêh char 'nâu wă ăn kơ lu nhôn lôch ngôi kơ đao gưm đe? Kon akăn lu nhôn jing tơmam đe plah tơgar iŏk đĕch. Hăm trŏ 'lơ̆ng hloh lu nhôn jah wih hơlơ̆k tơ char Êyiptơ hă?

English: So they said to one another, “Let us select a leader and return to Egypt.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu kon pơlei pơma pơđâu tơduă lu sư khan: Bĕ bơ̆n chă pơjing pôk minh 'nu pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r bơ̆n jah wih hơlơ̆k tơ char Êyiptơ năm.

English: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Bre Môis păng Arôn drap bon tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Isơrael akŭm.

English: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had spied out the land, tore their clothes
Bahnar: Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun păng Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê bre sư kư̆m lăm lu bơngai năm chop dăr lăng char noh, hek ao bre sư kơdih.

English: and they spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying: “The land we passed through to spy out is an exceedingly good land.
Bahnar: Bre sư năm tơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael oei akŭm khan: Char mă lu nhôn năm chop dăr jing minh char 'lơ̆ng dêh

English: If the LORD delights in us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us, ‘a land which flows with milk and honey.’
Bahnar: tơdah Kră Yang lăp đon hăm bơ̆n sư chông ba ăn kơ bơ̆n mơ̆t oei lăm char noh; char noh đei mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơmam sa rơkah rơkai. Kră Yang gô ăn char noh kơ lu bơ̆n.

English: Only do not rebel against the LORD, nor fear the people of the land, for they are our bread; their protection has departed from them, and the LORD is with us. Do not fear them.”
Bahnar: Lăp kơ bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ hil blah Kră Yang; păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hli kơ lu kon pơlei lăm char noh, yua kơ lu sư jing thoi tơmam sa bơ̆n boih, ưh pă đei bu tơgŭm lu sư kĕ blah bơ̆n dơ̆ng păng 'nĕ pă hli Kră Yang oei gah bơ̆n.

English: And all the congregation said to stone them with stones. Now the glory of the LORD appeared in the tabernacle of meeting before all the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu kon pơlei Isơrael akŭm wă klơ̆m bre sư tơmo, mă-lei đei tơdrong rang mơnhal Kră Yang đei pơdah pơchrang tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei Isơrael Akŭm.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses: “How long will these people reject Me? And how long will they not believe Me, with all the signs which I have performed among them?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Kon pơlei 'nâu hil areh păng ưh kơ lui kơ Inh dĭng dang yơ, mă khan Inh đei pơm tơ'bôh tơdrong hlĭch 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư boih ră?

English: I will strike them with the pestilence and disinherit them, and I will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ kon pơlei âu jĭ lôch hơbuh, Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ dôm tơmam mă lu sư đei, na Inh gô pơjing minh adrĕch lĕch dơ̆ng ih kơdrâ̆m păng pran kơtang hloh kơ lu sư.

English: And Moses said to the LORD: “Then the Egyptians will hear it, for by Your might You brought these people up from among them
Bahnar: Môis tơl Kră Yang thoi âu: Lu kon pơlei char Êyiptơ gô kơtơ̆ng, ih chông tơlĕch lu kon pơlei Isơrael âu hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang Ih

English: and they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, LORD, are among these people; that You, LORD, are seen face to face and Your cloud stands above them, and You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
Bahnar: păng đei roi tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei char 'nâu. Ơ! Kră Yang lu sư băt Ih oei hơdai hăm lu kon pơlei âu, yua kơ Ih tơ'bôh kơ lu sư, hơmơ̆l dơ̆ng boih kơpal lu kon pơlei âu păng Ih yak adrol, jrăng hơmơ̆l gah kơ'năr, jrăng ŭnh gah kơmăng.

English: Now if You kill these people as one man, then the nations which have heard of Your fame will speak, saying
Bahnar: Tơdah Ih pơlôch đĭ kon pơlei adrĕch 'nâu, minh 'măng, na lu dêh char nai mă kơtơ̆ng boih gah lu sư khan

English: ‘Because the LORD was not able to bring this people to the land which He swore to give them, therefore He killed them in the wilderness.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ gơh ôh chông ba lu adrĕch adrung 'nâu mơ̆t tơ lăm dêh char mă sư pơkă wă ăn kơ lu sư; yua kơ thoi noh, sư pơlôch boih lu đe noh tơ lăm char glă.

English: And now, I pray, let the power of my Lord be great, just as You have spoken, saying
Bahnar: Dang ei, inh apinh Ih, ăn tơdrong mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang Ih tih thoi Ih đei khan

English: ‘The LORD is longsuffering and abundant in mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression; but He by no means clears the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and fourth generation.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang hiơ̆ kơ hil păng 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong 'mêm mơnat; huay kơ jô̆ yo tơdrong yoch; mă-lei Sư ưh kơ jô̆ ôh lu bơngai pơm yoch khan 'lơ̆ng; păng ưh kơ lê̆ pŭ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng 'bok yă lu sư truh tơ kon sâu sư pêng puăn jơhnơr.

English: Pardon the iniquity of this people, I pray, according to the greatness of Your mercy, just as You have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih mơnat 'nĕ jô̆ tơdrong kon pơlei âu pơm yoch kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong mơnat tih đơ̆ng Ih, thoi Ih đei mơnat ăn boih kơ lu nhôn đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei.

English: Then the LORD said: “I have pardoned, according to your word
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơl tơwih: Inh ưh kơ jô̆ yoch thoi ih đei apinh.

English: but truly, as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the LORD
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh Kră Yang oei arih na pơkă, tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang gô 'bĕnh-'bang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak

English: because all these men who have seen My glory and the signs which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have put Me to the test now these ten times, and have not heeded My voice
Bahnar: lu iĕm 'bôh boih dôm tơdrong ư-ang, tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Inh đei pơm boih lăm char Êyiptơ păng lăm char glă, lu iĕm đei pơlong lăng Inh mơjĭt wơ̆t păng kuă pă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh

English: they certainly shall not see the land of which I swore to their fathers, nor shall any of those who rejected Me see it.
Bahnar: lei na lăm lu sư ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu mă gơh 'bôh char mă Inh đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu 'bok yă lu sư păng lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu boih nơ̆r Inh, ưh kơ đei bu mă gơh 'bôh char noh.

English: But My servant Caleb, because he has a different spirit in him and has followed Me fully, I will bring into the land where he went, and his descendants shall inherit it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kalep buăl Inh, chu kiơ̆ lui ngeh kơ nơ̆r Inh tơpă ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ nơ̆r lu đe, na Inh gô chông ba ăn kơ sư mơ̆t lăm char noh, char mă đêl sư đei năm boih, ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung sư oei jang sa tơ noh.

English: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the valley; tomorrow turn and move out into the wilderness by the Way of the Red Sea.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Amalek păng kon pơlei Kanaan oei lăm thŭng; dơning lu iĕm athei kơdŭn tơ rŏng 'biơ̆, năm rok char glă gah đak Dơsĭ 'Brê.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation who complain against Me? I have heard the complaints which the children of Israel make against Me.
Bahnar: Oei pă dang yơ dơ̆ng Inh gô mơ̆ng lu tơpôl bơngai kơnê̆ âu jŏk? Inh đei kơtơ̆ng boih lu tơpôl kon pơlei Isơrael jŏk chrih kơ Inh.

English: Say to them, ‘As I live,’ says the LORD, ‘just as you have spoken in My hearing, so I will do to you
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ tơpôl kon pơlei: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh pao tơdrong arih Inh na pơkă, Inh gô pơm kơ lu iĕm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r mă Inh đei kơtơ̆ng lu iĕm pơm

English: The carcasses of you who have complained against Me shall fall in this wilderness, all of you who were numbered, according to your entire number, from twenty years old and above.
Bahnar: akâu lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch tơ lăm char glă âu, dôm lu bơngai jŏk chrih kơ Inh jô̆ đĭ dôm yơ kư̆m lei-lăi, đei jô̆ boih iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal

English: Except for Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun, you shall by no means enter the land which I swore I would make you dwell in.
Bahnar: na gô ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t oei tơ char mă Inh đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu iĕm oei, lăp Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê păng Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun đĕch.

English: But your little ones, whom you said would be victims, I will bring in, and they shall know the land which you have despised.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô ăn lu kon hơ'lơ̆p iĕm gô mơ̆t oei tơ lăm char noh mă lu iĕm đei khan: Lu sư jing tơmam đe tơtông tơgar iŏk; đơ̆ng noh lu sư gô oei lăm char mă lu iĕm pơjăm.

English: But as for you, your carcasses shall fall in this wilderness.
Bahnar: Bĕ lu iĕm akâu lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch tơ lăm char glă 'nâu.

English: And your sons shall be shepherds in the wilderness forty years, and bear the brunt of your infidelity, until your carcasses are consumed in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Lu kon sâu iĕm gô wei triu lăm char glă 'nâu lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm lu sư gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong phak đơ̆ng lu iĕm ngôi kư̆ kă ưh kơ wă lui dĭng truh tơ lu iĕm pơ̆k lôch đĭ lăm char glă 'nâu.

English: According to the number of the days in which you spied out the land, forty days, for each day you shall bear your guilt one year, namely forty years, and you shall know My rejection.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô yak dăr lăng hơdôm năr wă khan puăn-jĭt năr păng lu iĕm gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong phak đơ̆ng yoch lu iĕm kơdih dôm yơ, wă khan puăn-jĭt sơnăm, minh sơnăm jô̆ thoi minh năr; kơplah noh lu iĕm băt boih kơ Inh achăng lê̆ iĕm.

English: I the LORD have spoken this. I will surely do so to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against Me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh Kră Yang khan boih: Inh gô pơm kơ lu tơpôl adrĕch kon pơlei kơnê̆ 'nâu, mă lu sư đei pơgơ̆p pôm đon pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh; lu sư gô lôch huach hiong tơ lăm char glă 'nâu.

English: Now the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned and made all the congregation complain against him by bringing a bad report of the land
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă Môis đei wơh năm chop dăr lăng char, pơtrŭt lu kon pơlei akŭm pơma jŏk kơ Môis

English: those very men who brought the evil report about the land, died by the plague before the LORD.
Bahnar: păng lu bơngai roi hơlĕnh khan char noh kơnê̆, lu bơngai 'nâu lôch lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ pơmat tơpă 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive, of the men who went to spy out the land.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm lu bơngai năm chop dăr lăng char, oei pă Jôsuê, kon drŏ-nglo Nun păng Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê oei arih.

English: Then Moses told these words to all the children of Israel, and the people mourned greatly.
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis roi khan đơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei; đơ̆ng noh đĭ lu kon pơlei nhơ̆m hmoi sơ'ngon dêh tơpă.

English: And they rose early in the morning and went up to the top of the mountain, saying, “Here we are, and we will go up to the place which the LORD has promised, for we have sinned!”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei iung đơ̆ng hrôih tŏk năm tơ kơpal kông păng khan: Lu nhôn 'nâu gô năm tŏk truh tơ char Kră Yang mă đei pơkă boih, yua kơ lu nhôn pơm yoch boih.

English: And Moses said, “Now why do you transgress the command of the LORD? For this will not succeed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis khan: Liơ lu iĕm pơm pơhloh kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă? Tơdrong noh ưh kơ gơh ôh.

English: Do not go up, lest you be defeated by your enemies, for the LORD is not among you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ tŏk tơ noh, kơnh hli kơ lu ayăt blah lu iĕm, yua kơ Kră Yang ưh pă oei hơdai iĕm boih.

English: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and you shall fall by the sword; because you have turned away from the LORD, the LORD will not be with you.”
Bahnar: To, kon pơlei Amalek păng kon pơlei Kanaan oei 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, lu iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao gưm đĭ, yua kơ lu iĕm blah Kră Yang boih, Kră Yang ưh kơ oei hơdai iĕm.

English: But they presumed to go up to the mountaintop. Nevertheless, neither the ark of the covenant of the LORD nor Moses departed from the camp.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei năm tơ anăp khŏm tŏk kơpal kông noh; gah Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang păng Môis ưh kơ năm ôh đơ̆ng kơđông.

English: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who dwelt in that mountain came down and attacked them, and drove them back as far as Hormah.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Amalek păng kon pơlei Kanaan đơ̆ng kông noh jur druh blah prah pơlôch pơrăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael, dĭng truh tơ pơlei Horma.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you have come into the land you are to inhabit, which I am giving to you
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Mưh iĕm mơ̆t lăm char mă Inh pơkă wă ăn kơ lu iĕm oei

English: and you make an offering by fire to the LORD, a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering or in your appointed feasts, to make a sweet aroma to the LORD, from the herd or the flock
Bahnar: lu iĕm pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi soh păng ŭnh dah tơmam soi 'buh, noh minh tơmam soi dah pơyơ̆r, dah tơmam soi wă pơsĭt nơ̆r pơkă, dah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm năr kơ̆m tih, lu iĕm 'maih wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi đei 'bâu phu păng rơmo dah triu

English: then he who presents his offering to the LORD shall bring a grain offering of one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of oil
Bahnar: na bơngai bu wă pơyơ̆r tơmam ăn kơ Kră Yang athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba dang minh lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng bơlŭ hăm minh lăm puăn hin đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: and one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering you shall prepare with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, for each lamb.
Bahnar: Mưh minh pôm triu kon, pơm tơmam soi 'buh dah hăm tơmam soi nai ih athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huch minh lăm puăn lit sik hơmu.

English: Or for a ram you shall prepare as a grain offering two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-third of a hin of oil
Bahnar: Dah minh pôm triu tơno, na ih athei iŏk tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba dang 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng bơlŭ hăm minh lăm pêng lit rơmă ôliwơ

English: and as a drink offering you shall offer one-third of a hin of wine as a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: păng minh lăm pêng hin sik hơmu pơm tơmam soi huch sa păng pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And when you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering, or as a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a peace offering to the LORD
Bahnar: Kơplah ih pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm, dah jing soi 'buh, dah tơmam soi kơ tơdrong pơkă lăm tơmam soi bơnê ăn kơ Kră Yang

English: then shall be offered with the young bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil
Bahnar: thoi noh athei đe pơyơ̆r hơdai rơmo dăm hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba iŏk pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng bơlŭ hrâu hăm minh puăt hin đak rơmă ôliwơ

English: and you shall bring as the drink offering half a hin of wine as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: păng iŏk minh puăt hin sik hơmu pơm tơmam soi huch: Noh boih jing minh tơmam soi yua ŭnh soh pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘Thus it shall be done for each young bull, for each ram, or for each lamb or young goat.
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m gô pơm thoi noh kơ rim tơmam soi pơyơ̆r rơmo tơno, dah triu tơno, rim tơmam soi hăm triu kon, dah kơ rim bơbe kon.

English: According to the number that you prepare, so you shall do with everyone according to their number.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ lu iĕm đei pơyơ̆r, iĕm athei pơm hơmet thoi noh kơ rim tŏ tơmam soi noh.

English: All who are native-born shall do these things in this manner, in presenting an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơ đĭ-đăng rim bơngai bu mă tơpŭ lăm char athei pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh, tơdah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi soh păng ŭnh, đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And if a stranger dwells with you, or whoever is among you throughout your generations, and would present an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD, just as you do, so shall he do.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai tơmoi oei hăm iĕm đunh dah 'nao đơ̆ng chăl âu truh tơ chăl nai, lu sư wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang, athei pơm kiơ̆ rok thoi lu iĕm đei pơm hơmet noh.

English: One ordinance shall be for you of the assembly and for the stranger who dwells with you, an ordinance forever throughout your generations; as you are, so shall the stranger be before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lăm tơpôl akŭm đei lăp minh khôi juăt 'nâu đĕch ăn kơ lu iĕm păng lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai iĕm. 'Nâu boih minh tơdrong juăt pơkă ling-lang kơ adrĕch adrung lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; bơngai tơmoi kư̆m lei-lăi thoi lu iĕm mơ̆n.

English: One law and one custom shall be for you and for the stranger who dwells with you.’ ”
Bahnar: Gô đei minh khôi juăt păng tơdrong juăt lei-lăi ăn kơ lu iĕm păng kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai iĕm.

English: Again the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land to which I bring you
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu kon pơlei adrĕch bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: Tơdah lu iĕm mơ̆t boih lăm char mă Inh đei chông anhăk lu iĕm mơ̆t

English: then it will be, when you eat of the bread of the land, that you shall offer up a heave offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: păng tơdah iĕm sa đơ̆ng char noh, lei lu iĕm athei iŏk minh puăt pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: You shall offer up a cake of the first of your ground meal as a heave offering; as a heave offering of the threshing floor, so shall you offer it up.
Bahnar: Iĕm iŏk minh tơpei 'bĕng wă pơm tơmam soi, wă khan đơ̆ng tơpŭng blŭng-a iĕm tam mă bơlŭ hrâu; lu iĕm pơyơ̆r lei-lăi thoi tơmam soi đơ̆ng anih đe preh 'ba noh mơ̆n.

English: Of the first of your ground meal you shall give to the LORD a heave offering throughout your generations.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng jơhnơr âu truh tơ jơhnơr ning-mônh, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r yơ̆r ti tơpơng ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi gah tơpŭng phe 'ba blŭng-a lu iĕm kĕch yuă.

English: ‘If you sin unintentionally, and do not observe all these commandments which the LORD has spoken to Moses
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm đei pơm yoch glăi 'bơm, ưh kơ kĕ wei răk dôm tơdrong juăt pơkă 'nâu mă Kră Yang đei pơkă boih kơ Môis

English: all that the LORD has commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day the LORD gave commandment and onward throughout your generations
Bahnar: wă khan dôm tơdrong kiơ mă Kră Yang đei tơtă ăn boih kơ Môis wă roi tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm, iŏk đơ̆ng năr Kră Yang tơbăt dôm khôi juăt 'nâu kơ ning-mônh kơ lu adrĕch adrung gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu iĕm

English: then it will be, if it is unintentionally committed, without the knowledge of the congregation, that the whole congregation shall offer one young bull as a burnt offering, as a sweet aroma to the LORD, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one kid of the goats as a sin offering.
Bahnar: tơdah tơdrong yoch glăi hơch 'bơm mă kon pơlei ưh tam băt, lei đĭ-đăng kơ bơngai tơpôl kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă athei yua minh pôm rơmo dăm pơm tơmam soi 'buh đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang, hơdai hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba pham hăm tơmam soi huch; păng minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch.

English: So the priest shall make atonement for the whole congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them, for it was unintentional; they shall bring their offering, an offering made by fire to the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD, for their unintended sin.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô soi sơmah huai iŏk đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch ăn kơ đĭ-đăng tơpôl kon pơlei Isơrael, lei na tơdrong yoch đĭ tơpôl kon pơlei noh gô mơnat ăn, yua kơ noh tơdrong yoch glăi hơch 'bơm păng kon pơlei đei anhăk ba 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơmam soi kơdih, wă khan tơmam soi yua ŭnh soh pơyơ̆r, hơdai hăm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch.

English: It shall be forgiven the whole congregation of the children of Israel and the stranger who dwells among them, because all the people did it unintentionally.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei Isơrael păng lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai lu sư gô klaih đơ̆ng yoch, yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei glăi 'bơm pơm yoch boih.

English: ‘And if a person sins unintentionally, then he shall bring a female goat in its first year as a sin offering.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu glăi hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, sư athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm bơbe akăn truh minh sơnăm pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch

English: So the priest shall make atonement for the person who sins unintentionally, when he sins unintentionally before the LORD, to make atonement for him; and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô soi sơmah huai yoch ăn kơ bơngai mă glăi 'bơm pơm yoch thoi noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng dah đei soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch thoi noh na bơngai noh gơh klaih đơ̆ng yoch.

English: You shall have one law for him who sins unintentionally, for him who is native-born among the children of Israel and for the stranger who dwells among them.
Bahnar: Khôi juăt 'nâu yua kơ rim 'nu bơngai hơch 'bơm kơ pơm yoch mă tơdah glăi 'bơm pơm yoch, kư̆m gô pơm lei-lăi minh pôm khôi juăt kơ lu iĕm bơngai Isơrael dah lu bơngai tơmoi mă tơpŭ lăm char âu.

English: ‘But the person who does anything presumptuously, whether he is native-born or a stranger, that one brings reproach on the LORD, and he shall be cut off from among his people.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei bơngai bu, kon pơlei Isơrael dah lu bơngai tơpŭ lăm char 'nâu, pơrơ̆ng pơm yoch, kuă kơ chu Kră Yang; bơngai noh gô tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng adrĕch kon pơlei sư kơdih

English: Because he has despised the word of the LORD, and has broken His commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his guilt shall be upon him.’ ”
Bahnar: yua kơ sư kuă kơ mơ̆ng kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang păng pơm glăi kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă; bơngai noh ăn đe pơrăm lê̆ sư tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ sư pơm gô tuh kơ sư kơdih.

English: Now while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael oei lăm char glă, tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai dônh 'long ŭnh lăm năr Sa'bat

English: And those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation.
Bahnar: lu bơngai mă tơ'bơ̆p bơngai noh oei dônh 'long ŭnh chông ba sư tơ Môis, Arôn păng tơ đĭ-đăng khŭl tơpôl akŭm.

English: They put him under guard, because it had not been explained what should be done to him.
Bahnar: Đe rôp chĭt bơngai noh, yua kơ tơdrong đe pơm kơ sư noh tam mă pơsĭt.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “The man must surely be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Bơngai 'nâu athei pơlôch, đĭ-đăng khŭl tơpôl akŭm athei klơ̆m tơmo kơ sư tơ đaih kơđông.

English: So, as the LORD commanded Moses, all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him with stones, and he died.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na khŭl tơpôl akŭm chông sư tơ đaih kơ kơđông linh na klơ̆m sư păng tơmo, na sư lôch, thoi Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis.

English: Again the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel: Tell them to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and to put a blue thread in the tassels of the corners.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael păng athei lu sư sĭt reng 'bơ̆t tơdrơi hơbĕn ao lu sư, iŏk đơ̆ng jơhnơr 'nâu truh tơ ning-mônh, sĭt reng noh iŏk brai dreng plĕnh

English: And you shall have the tassel, that you may look upon it and remember all the commandments of the LORD and do them, and that you may not follow the harlotry to which your own heart and your own eyes are inclined
Bahnar: lu iĕm athei đei sĭt reng noh tơ hơbĕn dah ao, mưh iĕm lăng 'bôh reng noh lu iĕm gô 'blŏk kơ dôm khôi juăt nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆, ưh kơ kiơ̆ jơhngơ̆m lăp măt lăng, ngăl pơm kơ iĕm pơm yoch ngôi kư̆ kă.

English: and that you may remember and do all My commandments, and be holy for your God.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu iĕm gô 'blŏk păng pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong inh tơtă păng oei sa rơgoh ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm.

English: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD your God.”
Bahnar: Inh boih, Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm Tơ'ngla mă đei chông ba tơlĕch iĕm đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ wă pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm. Inh boih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: Now Korah the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men
Bahnar: Kôrê kon drŏ-nglo Ishar, sâu Kôhat, sâu i Lêwi, chông ba Đathan păng Abiram kiơ̆ sư; Abiram, Đathan kon drŏ-nglo Êliap, hơdai hăm Ôn, kon drŏ-nglo Pêlet, kon sâu Rubên.

English: and they rose up before Moses with some of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty leaders of the congregation, representatives of the congregation, men of renown.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu păng hăm 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu lăm kon pơlei Isơrael, bơngai mă đe đei rơih iŏk pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai jang lăm khŭl tơpôl đe ư-ang, lu sư kư̆m pôm đon năm pơjah pơjăng hăm Môis păng Arôn

English: They gathered together against Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “You take too much upon yourselves, for all the congregation is holy, every one of them, and the LORD is among them. Why then do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the LORD?”
Bahnar: na khan: Lê̆ pă yua kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl kon pơlei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ngăl păng Kră Yang oei lăm lu sư. Yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm oei wă pơang kơdih tơ kơpal lu bơngai Kră Yang đei akŭm?

English: So when Moses heard it, he fell on his face
Bahnar: Môis kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, sư kŭp kơ̆l drap tơ teh

English: and he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Tomorrow morning the LORD will show who is His and who is holy, and will cause him to come near to Him. That one whom He chooses He will cause to come near to Him.
Bahnar: khan kơ Kôrê păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pôm đon hăm sư thoi âu: Pơgê dơning Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh ăn bơngai bu gah Sư mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; Sư gô ăn kơ lu bơngai noh gô năm jê̆ Sư, wă khan ăn kơ bơngai mă Sư đei rơih iŏk boih năm jê̆ Sư.

English: Do this: Take censers, Korah and all your company
Bahnar: Ơ Kôrê, pơm bĕ tơdrong 'nâu: Ih păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ ih iŏk bĕ gĕl tah nhang pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: put fire in them and put incense in them before the LORD tomorrow, and it shall be that the man whom the LORD chooses is the holy one. You take too much upon yourselves, you sons of Levi!”
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning tah ŭnh lăm ge iĕ păng dan pơgang 'bâu phu kơpal ŭnh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Bơngai bu mă Kră Yang rơih iŏk, noh boih bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Ơ kon sâu Lêwi, lê̆ pă!

English: Then Moses said to Korah, “Hear now, you sons of Levi
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Kôrê: Ơ kon sâu Lêwi, dang ei mơ̆ng bĕ

English: Is it a small thing to you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Himself, to do the work of the tabernacle of the LORD, and to stand before the congregation to serve them
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei 'măn lê̆ iĕm pha boih đơ̆ng khŭl kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael păng ăn kơ lu iĕm gơh năm jê̆ Sư wă bơ̆jang kơ Sư lăm Bơsŭn Kră Yang, wă kơ iĕm bơ̆jang awih awăn 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei, tơdrong noh iĕm lăng iĕ dêh hă?

English: and that He has brought you near to Himself, you and all your brethren, the sons of Levi, with you? And are you seeking the priesthood also?
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao ih păng đĭ-đăng 'nhŏng oh ih kon sâu Lêwi năm jê̆ Sư, lu iĕm oei chă tơdrong jang thoi 'bok soi dơ̆ng hă?

English: Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against the LORD. And what is Aaron that you complain against him?”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh ih păng lu khŭl kiơ̆ ih oei pơgơ̆p chă đon wă blah Kră Yang! Arôn noh bu mă lu iĕm hil jŏk kơ sư?

English: And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, but they said, “We will not come up!
Bahnar: Môis athei đe năm krao bre Đathan hăm Abiram, kon drŏ-nglo Êliap; mă-lei bre sư tơl: Nhi ưh kơ năm ôh.

English: Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, that you should keep acting like a prince over us?
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'nâu iĕ đĕch hă? Ih chông anhăk nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char đak toh đak sut đei tơmam sa rơkah rơkai, wă pơlôch lu nhôn tơ lăm char glă, mă ih kư̆m oei 'maih pơm yŏng pơjuă kơ̆l nhôn dơ̆ng hă?

English: Moreover you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up!”
Bahnar: Tơpă, ih ưh kơ đei chông ba nhôn tơ lăm char mă đak toh đak sut ôh, ih ưh kơ đei pơjao ăn kơ lu nhôn mir chŭn pơgar wă kơ jang sa ôh! Ih wă kuek lê̆ măt lu nhôn hă? Lu nhôn ưh kơ wă năm ôh.
