English: Then Moses was very angry, and said to the LORD, “Do not respect their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them, nor have I hurt one of them.”
Bahnar: Môis blĕk dêh krao apinh Kră Yang thoi âu: Ih lê̆ pă iŏk dôm tơmam lu sư pơyơ̆r; inh ưh kơ đei rôp iŏk minh pôm kon aseh iĕ đơ̆ng lu sư ôh păng inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơrăm bu lăm lu sư.

English: And Moses said to Korah, “Tomorrow, you and all your company be present before the LORD—you and they, as well as Aaron.
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Kôrê: Dơning ih păng lu khŭl bơngai kiơ̆ ih hăm Arôn năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: Let each take his censer and put incense in it, and each of you bring his censer before the LORD, two hundred and fifty censers; both you and Aaron, each with his censer.”
Bahnar: rim 'nu athei chĕp gĕl tah pơgang 'bâu phu tơ lăm noh, đơ̆ng noh na rim 'nu athei pơyơ̆r gĕl păng pơgang 'bâu phu noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, wă khan đei 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tŏ gĕl iĕ tah pơgang 'bâu phu. Ih păng Arôn, kư̆m athei đei gĕl iĕ tah pơgang 'bâu phu kơdih.

English: So every man took his censer, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and stood at the door of the tabernacle of meeting with Moses and Aaron.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, rim 'nu iŏk gĕl tah ŭnh lăm noh, tah pơgang 'bâu phu kơpal, đơ̆ng noh năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng Môis hăm Arôn.

English: And Korah gathered all the congregation against them at the door of the tabernacle of meeting. Then the glory of the LORD appeared to all the congregation.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kôrê pơtơm akŭm, lu kon pơlei iung pơma blah Môis păng Arôn 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm; tơdrong rang hơdah Kră Yang pơchrang kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl kon pơlei akŭm.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn thoi âu

English: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.”
Bahnar: Weh bĕ đơ̆ng tơpôl kon pơlei akŭm âu, na Inh gô pơlôch lu sư wă loh ưh kơ tam kơ băt.

English: Then they fell on their faces, and said, “O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and You be angry with all the congregation?”
Bahnar: Bre sư drap tơ teh kơkuh păng khan: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong arih kơ lu sĕch akar kon bơngai! Lăp minh 'nu đĕch pơm yoch lei Ih wă hil mĭl kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei hă?

English: So the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the congregation, saying, ‘Get away from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.’ ”
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei lu akŭm thoi âu: Athei weh ataih bĕ dơ̆ng anih Kôrê, Đathan păng Abiram.

English: Then Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
Bahnar: Môis iung, năm hloi tơ Đathan păng Abiram; lu kră pơlei bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ sư.

English: And he spoke to the congregation, saying, “Depart now from the tents of these wicked men! Touch nothing of theirs, lest you be consumed in all their sins.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ tơpôl kon pơlei akŭm thoi âu: Dang ei athei weh bĕ ataih đơ̆ng anih bơsŭn lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ âu păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam kiơ lu sư, kơnh hli kơ iĕm lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: So they got away from around the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram; and Dathan and Abiram came out and stood at the door of their tents, with their wives, their sons, and their little children.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu kon pơlei weh ataih đơ̆ng bơsŭn anih Kôrê, Đathan păng Abiram. Đathan păng Abiram dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t măng bơsŭn hơdai hăm kon akăn sư, kon drŏ-nglo sư, kon hơ'lơ̆p oei iĕ sư kơdih.

English: And Moses said: “By this you shall know that the LORD has sent me to do all these works, for I have not done them of my own will.
Bahnar: Môis khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: Đơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu lu iĕm gô băt Kră Yang đei wơh inh pơm tơdrong 'nâu păng inh ưh kơ đei layơ pơm kiơ̆ kơ inh kơdih

English: If these men die naturally like all men, or if they are visited by the common fate of all men, then the LORD has not sent me.
Bahnar: tơdah lu đe noh lôch kư̆m thoi lu bơngai nai lôch, tơdah lu sư kư̆m chu pŭ thoi lu bơngai nai pŭ, lei Kră Yang ưh kơ đei wơh athei inh.

English: But if the LORD creates a new thing, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the pit, then you will understand that these men have rejected the LORD.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah Kră Yang pơm minh tơdrong kiơ 'nao, tơdah teh ha 'bơ̆r luăn lu sư păng dôm tơmam kiơ lu sư đei, kơplah lu sư oei arih mă-lei jur lăm anih lôch, lu iĕm gô băt lu bơngai 'nâu ưh kơ chu păng pơjăm Kră Yang.

English: Now it came to pass, as he finished speaking all these words, that the ground split apart under them
Bahnar: Lăp Môis pơma tơdrong 'nâu 'nao wă tôch, teh tơklă lu sư oei dơ̆ng hơđang hloi

English: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, with their households and all the men with Korah, with all their goods.
Bahnar: teh ha 'bơ̆r luăn lu sư, hnam dơnŏ lu sư đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam lu sư păng đĭ-đăng bơngai mă kiơ̆ Kôrê.

English: So they and all those with them went down alive into the pit; the earth closed over them, and they perished from among the assembly.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh oei arih păng đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam lu sư huŏng lăm pơlei lôch; teh 'bŭ klơ̆p pơđĭ lu sư hiong tôch ưh pă đei oei hơdai kon pơlei.

English: Then all Israel who were around them fled at their cry, for they said, “Lest the earth swallow us up also!”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael oei tăp dăr kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư ôr, kơdâu ôn đĭ, yua kơ lu sư khan: Lu bơ̆n athei kơchăng bĕ, kơnh teh kư̆m luăn đĭ lu bơ̆n hai!

English: And a fire came out from the LORD and consumed the two hundred and fifty men who were offering incense.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, đei ŭnh đơ̆ng Kră Yang dơhlông sa pơđĭ 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu lu bơngai drŏ-nglo mă đei soh pơyơ̆r tơmam 'bâu phu.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Tell Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, to pick up the censers out of the blaze, for they are holy, and scatter the fire some distance away.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn 'bok soi, athei sư kơih iŏk bĕ lu gĕl soh pơgang 'bâu phu đơ̆ng lăm ŭnh sa noh păng tuh lê̆ ngar lăm lu gĕl iĕ noh tơ ataih, yua kơ lu gĕl iĕ noh jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh boih

English: The censers of these men who sinned against their own souls, let them be made into hammered plates as a covering for the altar. Because they presented them before the LORD, therefore they are holy; and they shall be a sign to the children of Israel.”
Bahnar: gah lu gŏl đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơm yoch tah pơgang 'bâu phu păng soh pơyơ̆r boih jô̆ dĭng đĭ chăl arih lu sư, ih athei iŏk tơtang mă hơtăng na gom chơnang soi. Yua kơ lu gŏl noh pơyơ̆r boih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang jing tơmam rơgoh; lu gĕl tơtang sư hơtăng noh wă pơm tơdra tơ'blŏk ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers, which those who were burned up had presented, and they were hammered out as a covering on the altar
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Êlêasar, 'bok soi, iŏk lu gĕl tah pơgang 'bâu phu đe pơm păng kong mă đêl ŭnh sa đe soh pơyơ̆r pơgang 'bâu phu na sư tơtang jing hơtăng yua wă gom chơnang soi.

English: to be a memorial to the children of Israel that no outsider, who is not a descendant of Aaron, should come near to offer incense before the LORD, that he might not become like Korah and his companions, just as the LORD had said to him through Moses.
Bahnar: Noh boih tơmam wă tơ'blŏk hơdơ̆r ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael, wă ưh kơ đei bu 'nguaih kơ kon sâu Arôn mă gơh năm jê̆ soh pơyơ̆r pơgang 'bâu phu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, hli kơnh kư̆m rok thoi Kôrê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ hơdai sư, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan ăn boih kơ Môis.

English: On the next day all the congregation of the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You have killed the people of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning, đĭ-đăng lu khŭl bơngai Isơrael pơma jŏk kơ Môis păng Arôn khan: Măr iĕm pơlôch boih kon pơlei Kră Yang.

English: Now it happened, when the congregation had gathered against Moses and Aaron, that they turned toward the tabernacle of meeting; and suddenly the cloud covered it, and the glory of the LORD appeared.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu khŭl kon pơlei oei pơma kơ Môis păng Arôn, lu sư lăng tơ gah Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'bôh hơmơ̆l gom Bơsŭn păng đei tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal Kră Yang pơchrang.

English: Then Moses and Aaron came before the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Get away from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.” And they fell on their faces.
Bahnar: Kơdâu weh bĕ đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm âu; na Inh gô pơlôch pơrăm lê̆ lu sư ưh kơ tam băt. Mă-lei bre sư drap tơ teh kơkuh

English: So Moses said to Aaron, “Take a censer and put fire in it from the altar, put incense on it, and take it quickly to the congregation and make atonement for them; for wrath has gone out from the LORD. The plague has begun.”
Bahnar: na Môis khan kơ Arôn: Iŏk bĕ gĕl soh pơgang 'bâu phu ih, tơ̆k ŭnh iŏk đơ̆ng chơnang soi, dan pơgang 'bâu phu kơpal, mă tĕnh tĕnh năm tơ lu khŭl tơpôl oei akŭm to păng pơyơ̆r huai tơdrong yoch lu sư; yua kơ tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl boih păng tơdrong gleh wă truh.

English: Then Aaron took it as Moses commanded, and ran into the midst of the assembly; and already the plague had begun among the people. So he put in the incense and made atonement for the people.
Bahnar: Arôn iŏk gĕl pơgang 'bâu phu thoi Môis đei athei sư, kơdâu năm truh tơ lu tơpôl kon pơlei; to tơdrong gleh truh boih tơ lu kon pơlei. Arôn iŏk pơgang 'bâu phu tah, na pơyơ̆r huai tơdrong yoch kơ kon pơlei.

English: And he stood between the dead and the living; so the plague was stopped.
Bahnar: Sư dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk lu bơngai lôch păng bơngai arih, na tơdrong gleh noh khơ̆t pơdơh hĭ.

English: Now those who died in the plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, besides those who died in the Korah incident.
Bahnar: Đei mơjĭt-puăn rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lôch yua kơ tơdrong gleh truh 'nâu; ưh kơ jô̆ lu bơngai lôch yua kơ Kôrê.

English: So Aaron returned to Moses at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, for the plague had stopped.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Arôn wih brŏk tơ Môis tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na tơdrong pơrăm noh pơdơh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and get from them a rod from each father’s house, all their leaders according to their fathers’ houses—twelve rods. Write each man’s name on his rod.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei bơngai Isơrael păng iŏk bĕ đơ̆ng lu sư minh pôm 'long jra; wă khan mơjĭt-'bar tŏ 'long jra đơ̆ng lu yŏng kơdră rim kơ adrĕch.

English: And you shall write Aaron’s name on the rod of Levi. For there shall be one rod for the head of each father’s house.
Bahnar: Ih athei chih anăn tơ rim 'long jra, 'long jra bu chih anăn sư păng chih anăn Arôn tơ 'long jra bơngai Lêwi; rim adrĕch đei minh pôm 'long jra

English: Then you shall place them in the tabernacle of meeting before the Testimony, where I meet with you.
Bahnar: ih athei 'măn lê̆ lu 'long jra noh 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Tơdrong Pơgơ̆p, anih mă Inh ngăl tơ'bơ̆p ih.

English: And it shall be that the rod of the man whom I choose will blossom; thus I will rid Myself of the complaints of the children of Israel, which they make against you.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă inh rơih iŏk, 'long jra noh đei bluh pơkao; thoi noh Inh wă chĭt lê̆ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael mă đei jŏk pơjah hăm lu iĕm.

English: So Moses spoke to the children of Israel, and each of their leaders gave him a rod apiece, for each leader according to their fathers’ houses, twelve rods; and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, hăm đĭ-đăng lu yŏng kơdră, kiơ̆ kơ rim adrĕch sư kơdih, năm ba 'long jra, wă khan mơjĭt-'bar tŏ 'long jra, 'long jra Arôn dan tŏk-bŏk lu 'long jra noh.

English: And Moses placed the rods before the LORD in the tabernacle of witness.
Bahnar: Môis tah lu 'long jra noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ lăm Bơsŭn Roi Tơbăt.

English: Now it came to pass on the next day that Moses went into the tabernacle of witness, and behold, the rod of Aaron, of the house of Levi, had sprouted and put forth buds, had produced blossoms and yielded ripe almonds.
Bahnar: Truh pơgê Môis mơ̆t tơ lăm Bơsŭn Roi Tơbăt 'bôh 'long jra Arôn adrĕch Lêwi đei bluh pơkao; chơnăt bluh, đei pơkao păng plei đum.

English: Then Moses brought out all the rods from before the LORD to all the children of Israel; and they looked, and each man took his rod.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk lu 'long jra đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang tơlĕch tơ đaih, 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai Isơrael. Lu sư lăng păng lu sư iŏk 'long jra lu sư kơdih.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Bring Aaron’s rod back before the Testimony, to be kept as a sign against the rebels, that you may put their complaints away from Me, lest they die.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis: Iŏk bĕ 'long jra Arôn na dan 'bơ̆t Hom Roi Tơbăt, wă răk tơ'blŏk pơm tơdra tơ'bôh kơ kon sâu wă iung blah, “ih athei khă chĭt lê̆ nơ̆r lu sư jŏk iung blah pơjah hăm Inh, kơnh hli kơ lu sư lôch.”

English: Thus did Moses; just as the LORD had commanded him, so he did.
Bahnar: Môis pơm thoi noh, wă khan pơm kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei tơtă kơ sư boih.

English: So the children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Surely we die, we perish, we all perish!
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael hli tơrơ khan kơ Môis: Âu 'nâu, lu nhôn gô lôch, lu nhôn lôch răm, lu nhôn gô lôch hiong đĭ-đăng!

English: Whoever even comes near the tabernacle of the LORD must die. Shall we all utterly die?”
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu mă năm jê̆ bơsŭn Kră Yang gô lôch, na lu nhôn gô lôch đĭ hă?

English: Then the LORD said to Aaron: “You and your sons and your father’s house with you shall bear the iniquity related to the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity associated with your priesthood.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Arôn: Ih, lu kon drŏ-nglo ih păng adrĕch adrung ih kư̆m gô pŭ iŏk lu tơdrong yoch lăm anih rơgoh; gah ih lu kon drŏ-nglo ih gô pŭ tơdrong yoch lăm tơdrong jang 'bok soi.

English: Also bring with you your brethren of the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, that they may be joined with you and serve you while you and your sons are with you before the tabernacle of witness.
Bahnar: Chông ba bĕ lu 'nhŏng oh ih hơdai ih mă adrĕch Lêwi, adrĕch 'bă ih, wă kơ lu sư pơgơ̆p hơdai ih păng tơgŭm ih jang; 'bơ̆t kơplah ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Roi Tơbăt.

English: They shall attend to your needs and all the needs of the tabernacle; but they shall not come near the articles of the sanctuary and the altar, lest they die—they and you also.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô bơ̆jang wei-lăng kiơ mă ih jao ăn, tơdrong jang kiơ mă lăm Bơsŭn; mă-lei lăp ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh dơ̆ng jê̆ chơnang soi đĕch, kơnh hli kơ lu sư lôch păng lu iĕm kư̆m lôch hai mơ̆n.

English: They shall be joined with you and attend to the needs of the tabernacle of meeting, for all the work of the tabernacle; but an outsider shall not come near you.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơgơ̆r hơdai ih, bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, đĭ-đăng tơdrong jang lăm Bơsŭn; lu bơngai tơmoi nai ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ ôh

English: And you shall attend to the duties of the sanctuary and the duties of the altar, that there may be no more wrath on the children of Israel.
Bahnar: lu iĕm athei wei-lăng tôm tơdrong lăm bơsŭn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng chơnang soi, wă kơ huay pă đei tơdrong Kră Yang hil kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: Behold, I Myself have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel; they are a gift to you, given by the LORD, to do the work of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh đei iŏk boih lu 'nhŏng oh ih, adrĕch bơngai Lêwi đơ̆ng lăm khŭl bơngai Isơrael, yua kơ đei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang boih, wă bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Therefore you and your sons with you shall attend to your priesthood for everything at the altar and behind the veil; and you shall serve. I give your priesthood to you as a gift for service, but the outsider who comes near shall be put to death.”
Bahnar: Ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih athei jang mă pơ'lơ̆ng tơdrong jang 'bok soi, wei-lăng dôm tơdrong gah chơnang soi păng tơmam kiơ tơ lăm che pĕng; lu iĕm jang tơdrong jang iĕm tơ lăm noh. Tơdrong jang 'bok soi noh minh tơdrong jang inh pôk ăn jing thoi minh tơdrong pơchĕp ăn; bơngai bu năm jê̆ tơ noh gô pơlôch.

English: And the LORD spoke to Aaron: “Here, I Myself have also given you charge of My heave offerings, all the holy gifts of the children of Israel; I have given them as a portion to you and your sons, as an ordinance forever.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Arôn: 'Nâu Inh ăn kơ ih wei-lăng tơmam mă Inh đei iŏk akŭm đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r kơ Inh, jing tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; Inh ăn boih tơmam 'nâu jing tơmam ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih, tơdrong juăt 'nâu yua ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: This shall be yours of the most holy things reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, every grain offering and every sin offering and every trespass offering which they render to Me, shall be most holy for you and your sons.
Bahnar: Lăm lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dêh 'nâu ưh kơ đei soh 'buh mă đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Inh tơmam 'nâu lê̆ kơ ih: Đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng lu sư, tơmam soi phe 'ba, tơmam soi wă huai tơdrong yoch, tơmam soi kơ tơdrong yoch hơch 'bơm; dôm tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng 'nâu lê̆ kơ ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih

English: In a most holy place you shall eat it; every male shall eat it. It shall be holy to you.
Bahnar: Noh tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh ih athei iŏk sa tơmam soi noh lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lu bơngai drŏ-nglo gơh iŏk sa.

English: “This also is yours: the heave offering of their gift, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel; I have given them to you, and your sons and daughters with you, as an ordinance forever. Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
Bahnar: Tơmam 'nâu kư̆m 'măn kơ ih. Tơmam ayơ mă bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo, na 'nâu tơdrong juăt yua ling-lang ăn kơ ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn ih. Bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh oei lăm hnam ih gơh sa tơmam noh.

English: “All the best of the oil, all the best of the new wine and the grain, their firstfruits which they offer to the LORD, I have given them to you.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei ăn kơ ih dôm tơmam bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r plei blŭng-a kơ Kră Yang, đĭ-đăng pơyơ̆r tơmam blŭng-a, sik hơmu păng 'ba tơ'bâu iŏk lu 'lơ̆ng hloh.

English: Whatever first ripe fruit is in their land, which they bring to the LORD, shall be yours. Everyone who is clean in your house may eat it.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam plei 'long sa mă đơ̆ng teh, plei blŭng-a bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang boih, noh 'măn kơ ih ngăl; hăm bơngai bu lăm hnam ih mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh gơh sa.

English: “Every devoted thing in Israel shall be yours.
Bahnar: Mă dôm tơmam kiơ đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael pơyơ̆r noh jing tơmam ih ngăl.

English: “Everything that first opens the womb of all flesh, which they bring to the LORD, whether man or beast, shall be yours; nevertheless the firstborn of man you shall surely redeem, and the firstborn of unclean animals you shall redeem.
Bahnar: Dôm lu kon kơdră mă kon bơngai dah kon sem dơrong đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael đei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang, noh jing gah ih ngăl; mă-lei ih athei huai iŏk kon kơdră kon bơngai; kư̆m athei huai iŏk dôm kon sem dơrong mă ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tuh adrol.

English: And those redeemed of the devoted things you shall redeem when one month old, according to your valuation, for five shekels of silver, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong ih huai iŏk, ih athei huai iŏk lu kon mă đei minh khei boih, kiơ̆ thoi đei hơgăt wă huai iŏk ih, iŏk pơđăm kăk jên hu, kiơ̆ kơ seikơl lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; minh seikơl lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh noh dang 'bar-jĭt Gêra.a

English: But the firstborn of a cow, the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat you shall not redeem; they are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar, and burn their fat as an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ưh kơ đei huai ôh kon rơmo, kon triu, kon bơbe mă tuh adrol; noh jing kon sem dơrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh boih. Ih athei iŏk pham lu sư tơtraih kơpal chơnang soi păng athei soh rơmă sư jing tơmam pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And their flesh shall be yours, just as the wave breast and the right thigh are yours.
Bahnar: 'Nhĕm sĕch sư noh lê̆ kơ ih, thoi lu 'nhĕm sĕch đe pơyơ̆r tơpơng 'ma 'ngiĕo păng blu gah 'ma noh 'măn kơ ih.

English: “All the heave offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer to the LORD, I have given to you and your sons and daughters with you as an ordinance forever; it is a covenant of salt forever before the LORD with you and your descendants with you.”
Bahnar: Inh pơkă 'nâu ling-lang ăn kơ ih, lu kon drŏ-nglo lu kon drŏ-kăn ih, đĭ-đăng tơmam pơyơ̆r 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă bơngai Isơrael đei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang; noh tơdrong pơgơ̆p pơkă 'bohb pơm ling-lang, ưh kơ gơh hiơt ôh, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang ăn kơ ih păng adrĕch adrung ih.

English: Then the LORD said to Aaron: “You shall have no inheritance in their land, nor shall you have any portion among them; I am your portion and your inheritance among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Arôn: Lăm char bơngai Isơrael ih ưh kơ đei ôh teh jang sa păng ưh kơ đei asong ih tơmam kiơ ôh đơ̆ng adrĕch noh; Inh boih jing mŭk tơmam ih đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael.

English: “Behold, I have given the children of Levi all the tithes in Israel as an inheritance in return for the work which they perform, the work of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Bĕ gah lu kon sâu Lêwi, Inh ăn kơ lu sư yua iŏk đơ̆ng tơmam lu adrĕch Isơrael pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt apah lu sư jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Hereafter the children of Israel shall not come near the tabernacle of meeting, lest they bear sin and die.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dơ̆ng, kơnh hli kơ lu sư pơm yoch na lôch.

English: But the Levites shall perform the work of the tabernacle of meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity; it shall be a statute forever, throughout your generations, that among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Lêwi boih bơ̆jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm noh; dah đei pơm yoch, lu sư pŭ iŏk kơdih; lu sư ưh kơ đei teh jang sa ôh lăm adrĕch khŭl bơngai Isơrael; noh jing tơdrong juăt đei pơkă lăm đĭ chăl, jơhnơr lu sư truh ning-mônh.

English: For the tithes of the children of Israel, which they offer up as a heave offering to the LORD, I have given to the Levites as an inheritance; therefore I have said to them, ‘Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh đei ăn boih kơ adrĕch Lêwi tơdrong jang sa, dôm lu tơmam đơ̆ng đe ra akŭm minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng adrĕch bơngai Isơrael mă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang. Yua kơ thoi noh, Inh đei pơma boih gah lu sư thoi âu: Lu sư ưh kơ đei teh jang sa ôh lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak thus to the Levites, and say to them: ‘When you take from the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them as your inheritance, then you shall offer up a heave offering of it to the LORD, a tenth of the tithe.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi thoi âu: Tơdah layơ lu iĕm đei iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt mă Inh ăn đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơyơ̆r noh wă pơm mŭk tơmam iĕm, na iŏk bĕ minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng tơmam noh na jing pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r soi ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And your heave offering shall be reckoned to you as though it were the grain of the threshing floor and as the fullness of the winepress.
Bahnar: Tơmam lu iĕm pơyơ̆r noh jô̆ thoi 'ba mi iŏk đơ̆ng anih đe preh 'ba păng kư̆m thoi sik đak hơmu 'bĕnh blai đơ̆ng anih đe hmĕt sư.

English: Thus you shall also offer a heave offering to the LORD from all your tithes which you receive from the children of Israel, and you shall give the LORD’s heave offering from it to Aaron the priest.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na, lăm lu tơmam minh lăm mơjĭt lu iĕm iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael, iĕm kư̆m athei iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang păng jao tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang noh kơ Arôn 'bok soi.

English: Of all your gifts you shall offer up every heave offering due to the LORD, from all the best of them, the consecrated part of them.’
Bahnar: Lăm dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r mă iĕm đei iŏk, lu iĕm athei rơih iŏk tơmam mă 'lơ̆ng hloh 'măn lê̆ pha jing tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Therefore you shall say to them: ‘When you have lifted up the best of it, then the rest shall be accounted to the Levites as the produce of the threshing floor and as the produce of the winepress.
Bahnar: Lei na ih athei khan ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi: Tơdah lu iĕm đei pơyơ̆r boih tơmam mă 'lơ̆ng hloh iŏk đơ̆ng tơmam minh lăm mơjĭt, lei ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi jô̆ thoi tơmam lu sư đơ̆ng anih preh 'ba, kư̆m nhen thoi tơmam lu sư đơ̆ng anih hmĕt sik hơmu mơ̆n.

English: You may eat it in any place, you and your households, for it is your reward for your work in the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm păng hnam dơnŏ iĕm iŏk sa đơ̆ng anih ayơ kư̆m bưh, yua kơ noh tơdrong apah đêl lu iĕm jang lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And you shall bear no sin because of it, when you have lifted up the best of it. But you shall not profane the holy gifts of the children of Israel, lest you die.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh tơdah lu iĕm đei pơyơ̆r boih tơmam mă 'lơ̆ng hloh ăn kơ Kră Yang, lu iĕm huay pă pŭ tơdrong yoch boih, lu iĕm huay pă pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ dôm lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh bơngai Isơrael, lu iĕm huay kơ lôch ôh.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD has commanded, saying: ‘Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring you a red heifer without blemish, in which there is no defect and on which a yoke has never come.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jing tơdrong tơtă đơ̆ng lăm khôi juăt mă Kră Yang ăn boih: Khan bĕ kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael păng athei lu sư rôp ba rơmo adruh sŏk gôh huay kơ jĭ kiơ păng ưh tam mă tah 'long ăt.

English: You shall give it to Eleazar the priest, that he may take it outside the camp, and it shall be slaughtered before him
Bahnar: Jao ăn rơmo noh kơ 'bok soi Êlêasar, chông ba tơ 'nguaih kơđông, na pơlôch rơmo noh 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: and Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, and sprinkle some of its blood seven times directly in front of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Êlêasar 'bok soi, gô tôt hơnglâu ti tơ lăm pham noh na tơtreh tơpơh wơ̆t tơ gah Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then the heifer shall be burned in his sight: its hide, its flesh, its blood, and its offal shall be burned.
Bahnar: Đe gô 'buh rơmo adruh noh 'bơ̆t anăp sư, 'buh akar, sĕch păng pham hrâu hơbĭ hăm ĭch sư.

English: And the priest shall take cedar wood and hyssop and scarlet, and cast them into the midst of the fire burning the heifer.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk 'long hơngo, iŏk minh hơchô̆ 'long pơgang păng brai 'brê, iŏk klơ̆m lăm ŭnh oei soh rŭk 'buh rơmo adruh noh.

English: Then the priest shall wash his clothes, he shall bathe in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp; the priest shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, 'bok soi athei pih ao tai păng hum môch akâu tơ lăm đak, klaih kơ noh mơ̆t tơ kơđông, 'bok soi jing mơgrĭ 'mê̆ dĭng truh kơsơ̆ măng noh.

English: And the one who burns it shall wash his clothes in water, bathe in water, and shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla mă 'buh rơmo kư̆m athei pih hơbĕn ao păng hum môch akâu sư tơ lăm đak, bơngai noh kư̆m jing 'mê̆ mơgrĭ truh kơsơ̆ măng.

English: Then a man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and store them outside the camp in a clean place; and they shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for the water of purification; it is for purifying from sin.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo rơgoh 'lơ̆ng gô năm kôch iŏk tơnuh rơnok rơmo adruh đơ̆ng đe 'buh noh năm tuh tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông, 'bơ̆t anih rơgoh; đe athei mong tơnuh rơnok noh kơ adrĕch Isơrael yua wă pơm đak, wă sut rơgoh tơdrong yoch.

English: And the one who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until evening. It shall be a statute forever to the children of Israel and to the stranger who dwells among them.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă kôch tơnuh rơnok rơmo adruh noh gô năm pih hơbĕn ao sư păng bơngai âu jing mơgrĭ yoch truh kơsơ̆ măng. Tơdrong 'nâu gô pơm jing tơdrong juăt ling-lang lăm bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei noh.

English: ‘He who touches the dead body of anyone shall be unclean seven days.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă jê̆ hơtŭt kơ akâu bơngai lôch bơngai noh jing 'mê̆ lăm tơpơh năr.

English: He shall purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day; then he will be clean. But if he does not purify himself on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not be clean.
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng năr mă tơpơh bơngai noh athei yua đak 'nâu wă sŭt rơgoh sư kơdih, na jing rơgoh; tơdah lăm năr mă pêng păng năr mă tơpơh ưh kơ sŭt rơgoh sư kơdih, lei ưh kơ gơh rơgoh.

English: Whoever touches the body of anyone who has died, and does not purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of the LORD. That person shall be cut off from Israel. He shall be unclean, because the water of purification was not sprinkled on him; his uncleanness is still on him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm akâu bơngai lôch păng ưh kơ ôp sut sư rơgoh, gô pơm ăn kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Kră Yang 'mê̆-'mach. Bơngai noh đe gô pơpuh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng lăm khŭl bơngai Isơrael; yua kơ đak ôp sut tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach ưh kơ đei tơtreh tơ akâu sư, lei na sư oei 'mê̆-'mach đĕch, tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach oei tơ lăm akâu sư.

English: ‘This is the law when a man dies in a tent: All who come into the tent and all who are in the tent shall be unclean seven days
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong juăt mưh đei minh 'nu bơngai lôch lăm bơsŭn; mă bơngai bu mơ̆t lăm bơsŭn păng bơngai oei lăm bơsŭn gô 'bơm 'mê̆ lăm tơpơh năr.

English: and every open vessel, which has no cover fastened on it, is unclean.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm lu gŏ 'bĭnh ayơ mă ưh kơ đơ̆p, ưh kơ đei tơnglơ̆p đơ̆p, gô jing 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain by a sword or who has died, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
Bahnar: Tơ bri brah, bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm kơ bơngai lôch kơ đao gưm đe 'bet, dah akâu bơngai lôch, kơting bơngai lôch dah bơsat, gô jing 'mê̆-'mach lăm tơpơh năr

English: ‘And for an unclean person they shall take some of the ashes of the heifer burnt for purification from sin, and running water shall be put on them in a vessel.
Bahnar: gah bơngai mă 'bơm 'mê̆-'mach, đe iŏk tơnuh rơnok 'buh soh rơmo wă huai đơ̆ng yoch, tah lăm bô̆i păng tuh đaka ro hlăng lăm noh.

English: A clean person shall take hyssop and dip it in the water, sprinkle it on the tent, on all the vessels, on the persons who were there, or on the one who touched a bone, the slain, the dead, or a grave.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh minh 'nu bơngai rơgoh gô iŏk minh hơchô̆ hla 'long pơgang djrŭ tơ lăm đak, na tơtraih jơ̆p kơ anih lăm bơsŭn, tơ rim lu ge bô̆i, tơ rim 'nu lu bơngai oei tơ lăm noh păng tơ akâu bơngai bu mă đei hơtŭt 'bơm 'mê̆, dah lu kơting bơngai lôch, dah akâu minh 'nu bơngai đe pơlôch, dah akâu bơngai lôch dah bơsat.

English: The clean person shall sprinkle the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he shall purify himself, wash his clothes, and bathe in water; and at evening he shall be clean.
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng păng năr mă tơpơh, bơngai mă rơgoh athei iŏk đak noh tơtraih tơ akâu bơngai mă hơtŭt 'bơm 'mê̆-'mach păng năr mă tơpơh bơngai rơgoh noh athei pơm ăn rơgoh; bơngai mă 'bơm 'mê̆ noh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum tong akâu lăm đak păng dĭng truh tơ kơsơ̆ măng na gơh rơgoh.

English: ‘But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from among the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the LORD. The water of purification has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean.
Bahnar: Gah bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm 'mê̆ mă ưh kơ pơm hơmet kơdih akâu rơgoh, minh 'nu bơngai thoi noh đe gô puh tơweh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng tơpôl kon pơlei, yua kơ sư pơm kơ hnam Kră Yang jing 'mê̆-'mach. Đak ôp sut tơdrong 'mê̆ ưh kơ đei tơtraih tơ akâu sư, sư noh đe jô̆ oei 'mê̆-'mach.

English: It shall be a perpetual statute for them. He who sprinkles the water of purification shall wash his clothes; and he who touches the water of purification shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Noh boih jing tơdrong juăt pơm ling-lang lăm kon pơlei pơla. Bơngai bu mă tơtraih rơgoh đơ̆ng 'mê̆-'mach hăm đak bơngai noh sư athei pih hơbĕn ao tai sư; bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm kơ đak ôp sut 'mê̆-'mach bơngai noh jing 'mê̆-'mach truh kơsơ̆ măng.

English: Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the person who touches it shall be unclean until evening.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă tơmam kiơ bơngai 'bơm 'mê̆ hơtŭt 'bơm gô apoh 'mê̆-'mach; dah bu hơtŭt 'bơm bơngai noh gô apoh 'mê̆-'mach truh kơsơ̆ măng.

English: Then the children of Israel, the whole congregation, came into the Wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people stayed in Kadesh; and Miriam died there and was buried there.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng khŭl adrĕch bơngai Isơrael truh tơ lăm char glă Sin. Lăm khei mônh păng pơdơh tơ Kades. Miriam lôch păng 'bŭ hloi tơ noh.

English: Now there was no water for the congregation; so they gathered together against Moses and Aaron.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, đak nhă ưh kơ đei kơ lu bơngai akŭm wă nhă; lu sư iung pơma kơ Môis păng Arôn.

English: And the people contended with Moses and spoke, saying: “If only we had died when our brethren died before the LORD!
Bahnar: Kon pơlei hil kơ Môis păng khan: Kuă kơ kiơ lu nhôn lôch hơdai lu 'nhŏng oh nhôn mă lôch boih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang sơ̆!

English: Why have you brought up the assembly of the LORD into this wilderness, that we and our animals should die here?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ ih chông ba lu khŭl kon pơlei âu năm tơ char glă âu, pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn păng sem dơrong nhôn lôch?

English: And why have you made us come up out of Egypt, to bring us to this evil place? It is not a place of grain or figs or vines or pomegranates; nor is there any water to drink.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ ih chông lu nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ na năm ba lu nhôn tơ anih kơnê̆ dêh thoi âu, anih mă ưh kơ gơh rei 'ba păng ưh kơ đei 'long plei hơra, dah hơmu, plei gărnăt păng ưh kơ đei đak nhă?

English: So Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and they fell on their faces. And the glory of the LORD appeared to them.
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn kơdŭn weh đơ̆ng anăp lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm ei, năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm na kŭp kơ̆l drap bon tơ teh; păng đei tơdrong rang hơdah đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơchrang tơ măr sư.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Take the rod; you and your brother Aaron gather the congregation together. Speak to the rock before their eyes, and it will yield its water; thus you shall bring water for them out of the rock, and give drink to the congregation and their animals.”
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ 'long jra ih, hăm Arôn 'nhŏng ih, năm akŭm bĕ kon pơlei, na măr iĕm athei khan kơ tơmo 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei, na tơmo noh đei đak lĕch; ih gô pơm kơ tơmo noh đei đak lĕch ăn kơ kon pơlei hăm lu sem dơrong nhă.

English: So Moses took the rod from before the LORD as He commanded him.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk 'long jra đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei athei sư.

English: And Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock; and he said to them, “Hear now, you rebels! Must we bring water for you out of this rock?”
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn krao akŭm kon pơlei năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp tơmo noh păng khan: Ơ kon pơlei arăng kơ̆l! Mơ̆ng bĕ! Nhi hăm gơh pơm ăn kơ tơmo 'nâu đei đak lĕch ăn kơ iĕm hă?

English: Then Moses lifted his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod; and water came out abundantly, and the congregation and their animals drank.
Bahnar: Môis yơ̆r ti sư teh tơmo 'bar wơ̆t hăm 'long jra sư. Đak lĕch ro hloi lơ tơpă, kon pơlei nhă păng lu sem dơrong sư kư̆m nhă.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not believe Me, to hallow Me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis păng Arôn thoi âu: Yua kơ măr iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Inh ưh kơ wă pôk pơyom Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Isơrael lei na măr iĕm ưh kơ gơh chông kon pơlei âu năm truh tơ char mă Inh đei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: This was the water of Meribah, because the children of Israel contended with the LORD, and He was hallowed among them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jing đak Mêriba, a wă khan anih mă kon pơlei Isơrael hil plơ̆ kơ Kră Yang; Kră Yang pơdah akâu sư kơdih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei.

English: Now Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom. “Thus says your brother Israel: ‘You know all the hardship that has befallen us
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng pơlei Kades, Môis wơh bơngai năm roi tơbăt ăn kơ pơtao Eđôm thoi âu: Isơrael noh oh ih, đei khan thoi âu: Ơ pơtao ih băt boih đei tơdrong pơmat-tat truh kơ lu nhôn

English: how our fathers went down to Egypt, and we dwelt in Egypt a long time, and the Egyptians afflicted us and our fathers.
Bahnar: tơdrong 'bok yă lu nhôn năm boih tơ dêh Êyiptơ, lu nhôn oei tơ noh kư̆m đunh, mă-lei kon pơlei lăm dêh char noh pơm kơnê̆ kơ nhôn păng 'bok yă lu nhôn.

English: When we cried out to the LORD, He heard our voice and sent the Angel and brought us up out of Egypt; now here we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your border.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đei krao apinh Kră Yang; sư kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r lu nhôn krao khan, na ăn hloi đei minh 'nu linh jang chông tơlĕch nhôn đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ. 'Nâu, dang ei lu nhôn oei lăm pơlei Kades, noh jĭ minh pôm pơlei oei jih sơlam char iĕm.

English: Please let us pass through your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, nor will we drink water from wells; we will go along the King’s Highway; we will not turn aside to the right hand or to the left until we have passed through your territory.’ ”
Bahnar: Apinh ih asong ăn kơ lu nhôn rok trong kiơ̆ lăm jih char ih ơ pơtao! Lu nhôn ưh kơ đei yak rok mir chŭn, dah pơgar hơmu, lu nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ đei chă chhŏ nhă đak sơlŭng iĕm; lu nhôn gô yak rok trong tih ih, lu nhôn ưh kơ weh-woh 'ma, 'ngiĕo ôh dĭng yak hlôi đĭ kơ dêh char ih.

English: Then Edom said to him, “You shall not pass through my land, lest I come out against you with the sword.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơtao Eđôm khan kơ sư: Ih ưh kơ gơh yak rok trong sơlam noh, tơdah ưh kơ chu inh gô iŏk đao gưm năm găn tơblah hăm ih.

English: So the children of Israel said to him, “We will go by the Highway, and if I or my livestock drink any of your water, then I will pay for it; let me only pass through on foot, nothing more.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael tơl khan: Lu nhôn gô yak rok trong tih; tơdah lu nhôn dah lu sem dơrong nhôn chă nhă đak iĕm, lu nhôn ăn jên. Apinh ăn kơ lu nhôn hơya yak jơ̆ng hoh rok noh, ưh kơ đei kiơ.

English: Then he said, “You shall not pass through.” So Edom came out against them with many men and with a strong hand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư tơl khan: Ih ưh kơ gơh yak rok noh ôh! Sư chông ba linh pơlei lơ tơpă, ti lu sư chĕp đao kơtuang ngăl, lĕch năm găn kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his territory; so Israel turned away from him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh pơtao Eđôm oei sơngah ưh kơ ăn Isơrael yak rok sơlam dêh sư; Isơrael weh đơ̆ng sư.

English: Now the children of Israel, the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu khŭl tơpôl kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm đơ̆ng pơlei Kades truh tơ kông Hôr.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor by the border of the land of Edom, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn 'bơ̆t kơpal kông Hôr, tơ hơdral dêh Eđôm, thoi âu

English: “Aaron shall be gathered to his people, for he shall not enter the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against My word at the water of Meribah.
Bahnar: Arôn gô lôch brŏk tơ anih yă 'bok sư, yua kơ sư ưh kơ gơh kơ mơ̆t ôh tơ dêh char mă inh wă ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael yua kơ sư sơngah pơjah kơ nơ̆r Inh tơtă tơ anih đak Mêriba.

English: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor
Bahnar: Chông bĕ Arôn păng Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo sư, athei tŏk tơ kông Hôr

English: and strip Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son; for Aaron shall be gathered to his people and die there.”
Bahnar: plôh bĕ ao tai Arôn na pơhrŭk ăn kơ Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo sư, Arôn gô lôch tơ anih noh

English: So Moses did just as the LORD commanded, and they went up to Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis pơm rok thoi Kră Yang athei sư; pêng 'nu sư tŏk tơ kơpal kông Hôr, đĭ-đăng khŭl akŭm 'bôh

English: Moses stripped Aaron of his garments and put them on Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there on the top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
Bahnar: Môis plôh lê̆ ao tai đơ̆ng Arôn, pơhrŭk ăn kơ Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo sư. Arôn lôch tơ noh, đe 'bŭ sư tơ kơ̆l kông; đơ̆ng noh Môis păng Êlêasar jur.

English: Now when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, all the house of Israel mourned for Aaron thirty days.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael akŭm 'bôh Arôn kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m boih, na nhơ̆m hmoi grong pơdong sư lăm pêng-jĭt năr.

English: The king of Arad, the Canaanite, who dwelt in the South, heard that Israel was coming on the road to Atharim. Then he fought against Israel and took some of them prisoners.
Bahnar: Kơplah pơtao Arat, bơngai Kanaan, oei tơ gah gơal, kơtơ̆ng khan bơngai Isơrael yak năm rok trong Atharim, lei sư năm găn blah bơngai Isơrael, sư kư̆m đei rôp lu mơ'nah pơm bơnă.

English: So Israel made a vow to the LORD, and said, “If You will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael pơma pơkă hăm Kră Yang khan: Tơdah Ih jao ăn kon pơlei âu lăm ti Inh, nhôn gô pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei tih sư.

English: And the LORD listened to the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanites, and they utterly destroyed them and their cities. So the name of that place was called Hormah.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iŏk nơ̆r apinh đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael na jao ăn kon pơlei Kanaan. Đe pơlôch đĭ kon pơlei păng pơrăm đĭ lu pơlei tih sư, anăn anih 'nâu Hormaa

English: Then they journeyed from Mount Hor by the Way of the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom; and the soul of the people became very discouraged on the way.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kông Hôr kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm trong đak Dơsĭ 'Brê wă wer dăr kơ char Eđôm. Tơ rok trong lu kon pơlei ơh klai đĭ pă kĕ.

English: And the people spoke against God and against Moses: “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no food and no water, and our soul loathes this worthless bread.”
Bahnar: Lei na, lu kon pơlei pơma hil plơ̆ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng Môis khan: Liơ ih chông tơlĕch nhôn đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ wă pơlôch nhôn lăm char glă hă? Yua kơ tơ âu por sŏng 'bĕng sa sap ưh kơ đei, đak kư̆m ưh kơ đei păng lu nhôn đĭ bơ̆l boih kơ sa tơmam sa tơdrong kơ đei lâu.

English: So the LORD sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and many of the people of Israel died.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn 'bih tang truh choh kon pơlei Isơrael đei lơ bơngai lôch kơ 'bih choh

English: Therefore the people came to Moses, and said, “We have sinned, for we have spoken against the LORD and against you; pray to the LORD that He take away the serpents from us.” So Moses prayed for the people.
Bahnar: kon pơlei kơdâu tơkan tơ Môis păng khan: Lu nhôn pơm glăi yoch boih pơma hil plơ̆ kơ Kră Yang păng ih. Krao khan apinh Kră Yang bĕ, wă kơ sư pơm kơ 'bih 'nâu weh tơ nai ataih đơ̆ng lu nhôn. Môis krao khan apinh ăn kơ kon pơlei.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Make a fiery serpent, and set it on a pole; and it shall be that everyone who is bitten, when he looks at it, shall live.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Ih athei pơm minh dăng rup 'bih tang, na ih tơ'băk sư tơ tơ̆r 'long gơgiĕr. Tơdah bơngai bu 'bih choh sư athei lăng tơ 'bih noh, sư gô arih.

English: So Moses made a bronze serpent, and put it on a pole; and so it was, if a serpent had bitten anyone, when he looked at the bronze serpent, he lived.
Bahnar: Thoi ei, Môis pơm minh dăng rup 'bih tang hling hăm kong, na tơ'băk tơ tơ̆r 'long gơgiĕr; bơngai bu mă 'bih choh sư boih, sư lăng tơ 'bih kong noh lei sư arih.

English: Now the children of Israel moved on and camped in Oboth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, kon pơlei yak năm păng oei pơdơh tơ Ôbôt.

English: And they journeyed from Oboth and camped at Ije Abarim, in the wilderness which is east of Moab, toward the sunrise.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Ôbôt lu sư yak năm oei pơdơh tơ Iyê Abarim, tơ char glă, tơklă char Môap gah măt 'năr lĕch.

English: From there they moved and camped in the Valley of Zered.
Bahnar: Lu sư yak đơ̆ng noh năm oei pơdơh tơ lăm thŭng Sêret.

English: From there they moved and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that extends from the border of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu sư yak năm oei pơdơh tơ pah to đak krong Arnôn, oei tơ lăm char glă, să truh tơ char Amôrit; yua kơ đak Krong Arnôn hơdral hăm char Môap păng kon pơlei Amôrit.

English: Therefore it is said in the Book of the Wars of the LORD: “Waheb in Suphah, The brooks of the Arnon
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh đe đei chih boih sơ̆p hla bơar anăn Tơdrong Kră Yang Tơblah khan thoi âu: Wahep oei lăm Supha păng lăm thŭng đak Krong Arnôn

English: And the slope of the brooks That reaches to the dwelling of Ar, And lies on the border of Moab.”
Bahnar: Păng thŭng glă truh tơ Ar păng tơ'bưh 'bơm hơdral char Môap.

English: From there they went to Beer, which is the well where the LORD said to Moses, “Gather the people together, and I will give them water.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng anih noh lu kon pơlei Isơrael yak năm dơ̆ng truh tơ Ber, b noh boih hơlŭng đak mă Kră Yang pơma hăm Môis khan thoi âu: Pơpôi akŭm bĕ lu kon pơlei, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư đak nhă.

English: Then Israel sang this song: “Spring up, O well! All of you sing to it
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai Isơrael hat hơri tơdrong âu: Ơ sơlŭng đak, bluh đak bĕ! Hat hơri kơ sư bĕ!

English: The well the leaders sank, Dug by the nation’s nobles, By the lawgiver, with their staves.” And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah
Bahnar: Hơlŭng đak mă lu yŏng kơdră sir boih, lu kon pơtao kư̆m sir boih sơlŭng đak. Hăm 'long jra pơtao păng hăm 'long jra lu sư. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng char glă na năm tơ Mathana.

English: from Mattanah to Nahaliel, from Nahaliel to Bamoth
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng char glă hơloh năm tơ Matana; đơ̆ng Matana năm truh tơ Nahalien; đơ̆ng Nahalien năm truh tơ Bamôt

English: and from Bamoth, in the valley that is in the country of Moab, to the top of Pisgah which looks down on the wasteland.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Bamôt truh tơ thŭng hơdral char Môap, tơ kơpal kông Pisga, tơ anih đe lăng tơmang 'bôh đĭ char glă.

English: Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael wơh bơngai năm tơbăt ăn kơ Sihôn, pơtao bơngai Amôrit khan

English: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn aside into fields or vineyards; we will not drink water from wells. We will go by the King’s Highway until we have passed through your territory.”
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu nhôn yak rok char ih, lu nhôn ưh kơ mơ̆t ôh tơ chŭn mir dah lăm pơgar hơmu păng lu nhôn kư̆m ưh kơ đei wă chă nhă đak sơlŭng iĕm, lu nhôn kư̆ kơ yak rok trong tih yak tơpăt dĭng hloh hlôi kơ char ih.

English: But Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his territory. So Sihon gathered all his people together and went out against Israel in the wilderness, and he came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sihôn ưh kơ ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael yak rok kiơ̆ trong lăm char sư, akŭm đĭ lu kon pơlei năm găn lu bơngai Isơrael gah lăm char glă; tơ Jahas na tơblah hăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then Israel defeated him with the edge of the sword, and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as the people of Ammon; for the border of the people of Ammon was fortified.
Bahnar: Isơrael iŏk đao gưm tơblah pơrăm na iŏk hloi char noh đơ̆ng đak Krong Arnôn truh tơ Krong Jabôk, truh tơ hơdral char kon pơlei Ammôn; yua kơ dur hơdral char lu kon pơlei Ammôn kơjăp.

English: So Israel took all these cities, and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon and in all its villages.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael blah iŏk đĭ lu pơlei tih păng oei hloi tơ lăm pơlei tih bơngai Amôrit oei tơ lăm lu pơlei tih Hesbôn păng kư̆m oei jơ̆p lăm lu pơlei iĕ hai.

English: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and had taken all his land from his hand as far as the Arnon.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Hesbôn pơlei tih Sihôn, pơtao bơngai Amôrit, bơngai mă đei tơblah hăm char Môap adrol sơ̆, blah iŏk đĭ jơ̆p tơring truh tơ Krong Arnôn.

English: Therefore those who speak in proverbs say: “Come to Heshbon, let it be built; Let the city of Sihon be repaired.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh boih, lu bơngai hơgei hơri pôk khan: Năm bĕ tơ pơlei tih Hesbôn! Pơlei tih Sihôn đe gô man pơdơ̆ng kơjăp!

English: “For fire went out from Heshbon, A flame from the city of Sihon; It consumed Ar of Moab, The lords of the heights of the Arnon.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Hesbôn. Pla ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Sihôn. Ŭnh noh sa pơlei Ar lăm char Môap. Đĭ-đăng anih kơjung lu yŏng pơgơ̆r oei tơ đak Krong Arnôn.

English: Woe to you, Moab! You have perished, O people of Chemosh! He has given his sons as fugitives, And his daughters into captivity, To Sihon king of the Amorites.
Bahnar: Ơ Môap! Răm-'băm tơpă kơ ih! Ơ kon pơlei Kêmôs, ih lôch răm đĭ boih! Lu kon drŏ-nglo gô kơdâu ôn păng tơklah tơklang, lu kon drŏ-kăn ih gô jing bơnă, kơ Sihôn, pơtao đe Amôrit.

English: “But we have shot at them; Heshbon has perished as far as Dibon. Then we laid waste as far as Nophah, Which reaches to Medeba.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n blah blơ̆ kon sâu sư lôch đĭ iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Hesbôn truh tơ Đibôn, Lu nhôn pơrăm đĭ truh tơ pơlei Napha, dĭng truh tơ pơlei Mêdêba

English: Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu bơngai Isơrael oei tơ lăm char bơngai Amôrit.

English: Then Moses sent to spy out Jazer; and they took its villages and drove out the Amorites who were there.
Bahnar: Môis wơh bơngai năm chop lăng pơlei Jaser; lu sư blah iŏk đĭ lu pơlei iĕ iĕ, na pơpuh tơweh lê̆ lu kon pơlei Amôrit đơ̆ng noh.

English: And they turned and went up by the way to Bashan. So Og king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
Bahnar: Lu sư wih yak năm trong tơ Basan, Ôk pơtao đe Basan păng đĭ kon pơlei sư năm găn blah 'bơ̆t pơlei Êdrei.

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have delivered him into your hand, with all his people and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, 'nĕ hli kơ sư ôh, yua kơ Inh jao tơring sư hăm kon pơlei sư tơ lăm ti ih boih; pơm bĕ kơ lu sư thoi ih pơm kơ Sihôn pơtao Amôrit, bơngai mă lăm pơlei Hesbôn.

English: So they defeated him, his sons, and all his people, until there was no survivor left him; and they took possession of his land.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, bơngai Isơrael blah rôp pơlôch Ôk, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư, ưh pă đei minh 'nu oei arih; lu bơngai Isơrael iŏk đĭ char lu sư.

English: Then the children of Israel moved, and camped in the plains of Moab on the side of the Jordan across from Jericho.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael yak năm lăm thŭng glă char Môap, oei pơdơh paih to đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă pơlei Jêrikô.

English: Now Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
Bahnar: Balak kon drŏ-nglo Sipôr 'bôh đĭ boih tơdrong lu bơngai Isơrael pơm kơ kon pơlei Amôrit.

English: And Moab was exceedingly afraid of the people because they were many, and Moab was sick with dread because of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Môap hli dêh kơ lu bơngai Isơrael yua kơ kon pơlei Isơrael lơ tơpă.

English: So Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this company will lick up everything around us, as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” And Balak the son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at that time.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Môap khan kơ lu kră pơgơ̆r char Madian; Dang ei lu kon pơlei lơ noh gô sa pơđĭ dôm tơmam sa tăp dăr kơ bơ̆n thoi rơmo sa 'nhĕt lăm mir. Kơplah noh, Balak kon drŏ-nglo Sipôr pơm pơtao char Môap.

English: Then he sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor at Pethor, which is near the River in the land of the sons of his people, to call him, saying: “Look, a people has come from Egypt. See, they cover the face of the earth, and are settling next to me!
Bahnar: Sư wơh minh 'nu bơngai năm tơ Balaam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr tơ pơlei Pêthôr jê̆ đak krong lăm char adrĕch adrung 'bok sư, wă krao sư păng khan: Lăng deh đei minh khŭl kon pơlei 'nao lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ lơ 'bĕnh jơ̆p-jang kơ teh oei jê̆ tơklă anăp inh.

English: Therefore please come at once, curse this people for me, for they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I shall be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land, for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, inh apinh ih năm hiap lu sư dang ei hloi, yua kơ lu sư pran hloh kơ inh. Wă kơ inh kĕ blah pơrăm păng puh lu sư weh đơ̆ng char, yua kơ inh băt tơdah ih hơpơi kơ đe pŭn hiôk đei pŭn hiôk, tơdah ih hiap bu bơngai noh gô răm gô pŭ hơngiap.

English: So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the diviner’s fee in their hand, and they came to Balaam and spoke to him the words of Balak.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu kră pơgơ̆r char Môap păng lu kră pơgơ̆r char Madian, năm chĕp ba tơmam apah lu pơjâu, lu sư năm truh tơ Balaam roi dôm nơ̆r Balak đei tơtă.

English: And he said to them, “Lodge here tonight, and I will bring back word to you, as the LORD speaks to me.” So the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
Bahnar: Balaam tơl lu sư: 'Bĭch bĕ tơ âu măng 'nâu, inh gô roi ăn kơ lu iĕm kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang đei khan kơ inh. Lu kră pơgơ̆r char Môap 'bĭch tơ hnam Balaam.

English: Then God came to Balaam and said, “Who are these men with you?”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ Balaam păng khan thoi âu: Lu đe bu lăm hnam ih?

English: So Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent to me, saying
Bahnar: Balaam tơl Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, “Balak kon drŏ-nglo Sipôr pơtao char Môap wơh lu sư năm tơ inh, khan

English: ‘Look, a people has come out of Egypt, and they cover the face of the earth. Come now, curse them for me; perhaps I shall be able to overpower them and drive them out.’ ”
Bahnar: Lăng deh, đei minh khŭl kon pơlei 'nao lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ lơ 'bĕnh jơ̆p-jang kơ teh; apinh ih năm hiap lu sư hrei âu hloi; wă kơ inh blah pơrăm păng puh tơweh lu sư.”

English: And God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them; you shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Balaam thoi âu: “Ih 'nĕ kơ năm hơdai lu sư, 'nĕ kơ hiap khŭl kon pơlei 'nâu yua kơ adrĕch kon pơlei 'nâu lu sư đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.”

English: So Balaam rose in the morning and said to the princes of Balak, “Go back to your land, for the LORD has refused to give me permission to go with you.”
Bahnar: Balaam iung đơ̆ng hrôih, năm khan kơ lu kră pơgơ̆r char đơ̆ng Balak wơh noh. Wih bĕ tơ char iĕm, yua kơ Kră Yang ưh kơ ăn kơ inh yak hơdai iĕm.

English: And the princes of Moab rose and went to Balak, and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu Kră pơgơ̆r char Môap iung, wih brŏk tơ Balak păng khan: Balaam sư ưh kơ năm hăm nhôn.

English: Then Balak again sent princes, more numerous and more honorable than they.
Bahnar: Balak wơh lu kră pơgơ̆r nai rai lơ hloh dơ̆ng păng lu mă đe pơyom hloh kơ lu kră pơgơ̆r adrol noh

English: And they came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak the son of Zippor: ‘Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me
Bahnar: truh tơ Balaam păng khan: Balak kon drŏ-nglo Sipôr, đei khan thoi âu: 'Nĕ ăn đei tơdrong kiơ khă găn ih năm tơ inh

English: for I will certainly honor you greatly, and I will do whatever you say to me. Therefore please come, curse this people for me.’ ”
Bahnar: yua kơ inh gô apah ih tih tơpă păng gô pơm kiơ̆ ih athei inh pơm. Apinh ih năm hiap pơrăm adrĕch 'nâu.

English: Then Balaam answered and said to the servants of Balak, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the word of the LORD my God, to do less or more.
Bahnar: Balaam tơl nơ̆r lu kră pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng Balak wơh thoi âu: Mă khan Balak ăn kơ inh hnam sư 'bĕnh kơ hu maih, inh kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơhloh kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh tơtă, na pơm minh tơdrong mă tih mă iĕ.

English: Now therefore, please, you also stay here tonight, that I may know what more the LORD will say to me.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m apinh iĕm 'bĭch tơ âu hăm inh măng 'nâu, wă kơ băt Kră Yang gô pơma khan kơ inh tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: And God came to Balaam at night and said to him, “If the men come to call you, rise and go with them; but only the word which I speak to you—that you shall do.”
Bahnar: Kơplah kơmăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jur tơ Balaam păng khan: Tơdah lu đe noh năm truh krao ih, iung năm kiơ̆ lu sư bĕ; mă-lei ih athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r đơ̆ng Inh gô khan

English: So Balaam rose in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Balaam iung đơ̆ng hrôih, drôih iŏk an aseh iĕ sư hao năm kiơ̆ lu kră pơgơ̆r char Môap.

English: Then God’s anger was aroused because he went, and the Angel of the LORD took His stand in the way as an adversary against him. And he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil, yua kơ sư năm; Linh jang Kră Yang dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t trong găn sư, Balaam hao aseh iĕ sư năm, kư̆m đei 'bar 'nu đam năm hơdai sư.

English: Now the donkey saw the Angel of the LORD standing in the way with His drawn sword in His hand, and the donkey turned aside out of the way and went into the field. So Balaam struck the donkey to turn her back onto the road.
Bahnar: Aseh sư 'bôh Linh jang Kră Yang dơ̆ng găn trong ti Linh jang chĕp đao gưm ưh kơ đei hơnglop, aseh weh trong lăm chŭn; Balaam teh aseh wă kơ sư rok trong.

English: Then the Angel of the LORD stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, with a wall on this side and a wall on that side.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei Linh jang Kră Yang năm găn lăm trong iĕ lăm pơgar hơmu đei dur war 'bar pah.

English: And when the donkey saw the Angel of the LORD, she pushed herself against the wall and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall; so he struck her again.
Bahnar: Aseh iĕ 'bôh Linh jang Kră Yang sư năm gơning rok dur na jơ̆ng Balaam kep kơ dur; Balaam teh aseh sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then the Angel of the LORD went further, and stood in a narrow place where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
Bahnar: Linh jang Kră Yang năm găn 'bơ̆t trong iĕ hrăt-hrot kơ-cher-ep ưh pă gơh weh gah 'ma dah gah 'ngiĕo.

English: And when the donkey saw the Angel of the LORD, she lay down under Balaam; so Balaam’s anger was aroused, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
Bahnar: Aseh 'bôh Linh jang Kră Yang na sư drap drum ala Balaam. Na Balaam blĕk hil, teh aseh sư hăm 'long jra.

English: Then the LORD opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Kră Yang pơih 'bơ̆r aseh iĕ gơh pơma, aseh khan kơ Balaam: Inh đei pơm kiơ kơ ih, mă ih teh inh pêng wơ̆t?

English: And Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have abused me. I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now I would kill you!”
Bahnar: Balaam tơl aseh sư khan: Noh yua kơ e ưh kơ chu kơ inh. Tơdah inh đei đao gưm inh pơlôch e boih!

English: So the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey on which you have ridden, ever since I became yours, to this day? Was I ever disposed to do this to you?” And he said, “No.”
Bahnar: Aseh tơl Balaam khan: Inh hăm trŏ kơ aseh ih mă ih juăt kơ yua hao rim năr dĭng truh năr 'nâu? Inh hăm ngăl lah kơ pơm thoi âu? Balaam tơl: Ưh.

English: Then the LORD opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the Angel of the LORD standing in the way with His drawn sword in His hand; and he bowed his head and fell flat on his face.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơih măt Balaam, na Balaam 'bôh Linh jang Kră Yang dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk trong ti sư chĕp minh hlak đao gưm. Balaam kŭp kơ̆l drap tơ teh.

English: And the Angel of the LORD said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out to stand against you, because your way is perverse before Me.
Bahnar: Linh jang Kră Yang khan: Liơ ih teh aseh ih pêng wơ̆t? 'Nâu inh năm tơ âu wă găn ih, yua kơ inh 'bôh ih wă năm kiơ̆ trong năm tơ tơdrong hiong răm.

English: The donkey saw Me and turned aside from Me these three times. If she had not turned aside from Me, surely I would also have killed you by now, and let her live.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, aseh sư 'bôh inh na weh đơ̆ng anăp inh pêng wơ̆t kơ 'nâu, tơdah sư ưh kơ weh trong nai đơ̆ng anăp inh lei inh pơlôch ih boih, na lê̆ sư arih.

English: And Balaam said to the Angel of the LORD, “I have sinned, for I did not know You stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases You, I will turn back.”
Bahnar: Balaam tơl Linh jang Kră Yang khan: Inh pơm glăi boih, ưh kơ băt kơ ih dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t trong găn inh, na dang ei, tơdah ih ưh kơ wă kơ inh năm, inh wih brŏk.

English: Then the Angel of the LORD said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but only the word that I speak to you, that you shall speak.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
Bahnar: Linh jang Kră Yang khan kơ Balaam thoi âu: Yak năm hơdai bĕ lu đe noh, mă-lei ih wă pơma kiơ ih athei mơ̆ng kơ inh athei pơma. Balaam sư yak năm hơdai lu kră pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng pơtao Balak wơh.

English: Now when Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the city of Moab, which is on the border at the Arnon, the boundary of the territory.
Bahnar: Wă Balak kơtơ̆ng khan Balaam truh boih, na sư năm tơ'bơ̆p tơ pơlei, pơlei noh jê̆ đak Krong Arnôn, wă khan ter jih kơ teh đak Môap.

English: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not earnestly send to you, calling for you? Why did you not come to me? Am I not able to honor you?”
Bahnar: Balak pơma hăm Balaam khan: Hăm trŏ inh đei wơh boih bơngai năm krao ih? Liơ ih ưh kơ năm? Inh ưh kơ gơh wă apah ih hă?

English: And Balaam said to Balak, “Look, I have come to you! Now, have I any power at all to say anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that I must speak.”
Bahnar: Balaam tơl Balak khan: 'Nâu inh năm truh tơ ih boih, dang ei inh ưh kơ gơh chă pơma minh 'bar nơ̆r Inh gô pơma kiơ̆ mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn nơ̆r lăm 'bơ̆r inh.

English: So Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kirjath Huzoth.
Bahnar: Balaam yak năm hăm Balak, truh tơ Kiriat Husôt.

English: Then Balak offered oxen and sheep, and he sent some to Balaam and to the princes who were with him.
Bahnar: Balak 'bet rơmo, triu pơyơ̆r pơm yang păng athei đe năm ba ăn kơ Balaam hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r kiơ̆ sư.

English: So it was, the next day, that Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the high places of Baal, that from there he might observe the extent of the people.
Bahnar: Truh tơ pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng Balak năm ba Balaam tơ Bamôt Baal, đơ̆ng anih noh sư gơh tơmang 'bôh tơ anih lu bơngai Isơrael oei pơdơh.

English: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
Bahnar: Balaam khan kơ Balak: Pơm pơdơ̆ng bĕ tơpơh tŏ chơnang soi tơ âu kơ inh păng kư̆m chă ăn kơ inh tơpơh tŏ rơmo tơno păng chă tơpơh tŏ triu tơno.

English: And Balak did just as Balaam had spoken, and Balak and Balaam offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
Bahnar: Balak pơm kiơ̆ thoi Balaam khan; bre sư pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo tơno păng minh pôm triu tơno tơ rim kơ chơnang soi.

English: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps the LORD will come to meet me, and whatever He shows me I will tell you.” So he went to a desolate height.
Bahnar: Na Balaam pơma hăm Balak khan: Ih athei dơ̆ng jê̆ tơmam ih soi 'buh noh, na inh wă năm, rŏ lăng Kră Yang gô năm tơ'bơ̆p inh, inh gô roi ăn kơ ih dôm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang tơ'bôh kơ ih. Sư tŏk hloi tơ kơpal kơ̆l kông kơjung 'nguaih glă.

English: And God met Balaam, and he said to Him, “I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered on each altar a bull and a ram.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bơ̆p Balaam păng Balaam pơma hăm Sư khan: Inh đei pơdơ̆ng tơpơh tŏ chơnang soi păng tơ rim chơnang soi noh inh pơyơ̆r dan minh pôm rơmo tơno păng minh pôm triu tơno.

English: Then the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơtă nơ̆r lăm 'bơ̆r Balaam păng khan. “Wih brŏk bĕ tơ Balak păng khan thoi âu:”

English: So he returned to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, he and all the princes of Moab.
Bahnar: Balaam wih brŏk tơ Balak; na 'bôh Balak oei dơ̆ng jê̆ tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r sư hơdai hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r char Môap.

English: And he took up his oracle and said: “Balak the king of Moab has brought me from Aram, From the mountains of the east. ‘Come, curse Jacob for me, And come, denounce Israel!’
Bahnar: Balaam roi pơdah hăm nơ̆r hơri sư khan: Balak, pơtao Môap, krao inh đơ̆ng dêh Aram, đơ̆ng kông gah hơlĕch păng khan: Năm hiap lu adrĕch Jakôp bĕ! Năm hiap hil kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael bĕ.

English: “How shall I curse whom God has not cursed? And how shall I denounce whom the LORD has not denounced?
Bahnar: Liơ inh gơh hiap? Liơ inh gơh hil lu bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ hiap ưh kơ hil mĭl?

English: For from the top of the rocks I see him, And from the hills I behold him; There! A people dwelling alone, Not reckoning itself among the nations.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kơpal kơ̆l kông, inh 'bôh lu sư đơ̆ng kông groi kơjung, inh lăng lu sư: To, minh khŭl kon pơlei oei hơdrô̆ phara ưh kơ jô̆ lu sư hơdai thoi kon bơngai lăm teh đak ôh.

English: “Who can count the dust of Jacob, Or number one-fourth of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, And let my end be like his!”
Bahnar: Bu kĕ jô̆ 'bruih chuơh Jakôp? Bu kĕ jô̆ minh lăm puăn lu adrĕch Isơrael? Lu bơngai tơpăt lôch thoi yơ ăn kơ inh lôch thoi lu sư? Năr tôch kơ lu bơngai tơpăt thoi yơ inh hơpơi năr tôch kơ inh thoi noh!

English: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and look, you have blessed them bountifully!”
Bahnar: Balak khan kơ Balaam: Ih đei pơm kiơ kơ inh bơih? Inh apinh ih năm tơ âu wă kơ ih hiap lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh na mă rai hơpơi ăn kơ lu sư pŭn hiôk dơ̆ng!

English: So he answered and said, “Must I not take heed to speak what the LORD has put in my mouth?”
Bahnar: Balaam tơl: Inh athei pơma dôm nơ̆r mă Kră Yang đei ăn boih nơ̆r pơma lăm 'bơ̆r inh?

English: Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place from which you may see them; you shall see only the outer part of them, and shall not see them all; curse them for me from there.”
Bahnar: Balak khan kơ sư: “Hiăng bĕ năm kiơ̆ inh tơ anih nai, đơ̆ng noh ih gô 'bôh lu sư, 'bôh lu sư jê̆ 'biơ̆, mă-lei ih ưh kơ đei 'bôh đĭ lu sư ôh, ih 'bôh minh puăt đĕch, na ih gô hiap lu sư đơ̆ng noh.”

English: So he brought him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Balak chông ba Balaam truh tơ mir Sôphim, kơpal kơ̆l kông Pisga, pơdơ̆ng tơpơh tŏ chơnang soi păng tơ rim chơnang soi pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm păng minh pôm triu tơno.

English: And he said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offering while I meet the LORD over there.”
Bahnar: Balaam khan kơ Balak: “Ih athei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng tơmam soi, inh gô năm tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang tơ noh.”

English: Then the LORD met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, “Go back to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur tơ'bơ̆p Balaam, dan nơ̆r pơma lăm 'bơ̆r sư, khan: Wih tơ Balak bĕ păng khan thoi âu

English: So he came to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab were with him. And Balak said to him, “What has the LORD spoken?”
Bahnar: Balaam wih dơ̆ng tơ Balak; sư oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t cheng tơmam soi hơdai hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r dêh Môap. Balak apinh: Kră Yang khan kiơ?

English: Then he took up his oracle and said: “Rise up, Balak, and hear! Listen to me, son of Zippor!
Bahnar: Balaam drơ̆ng sư hăm nơ̆r hơri thoi âu: Ơ Balak, iung mơ̆ng bĕ! Ơ kon drŏ-nglo Sipôr, pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ!

English: “God is not a man, that He should lie, Nor a son of man, that He should repent. Has He said, and will He not do? Or has He spoken, and will He not make it good?
Bahnar: Kră Yang ưh kơ trŏ thoi minh 'nu kon bơngai gơh pơma hơlĕnh, Kŭm ưh kơ trŏ thoi kon bơngai mă gơh tơplih tơdrong tơchĕng ôh. Tơdrong mă sư khan boih, mă sư jor kơ pơm hă? Tơdrong mă sư pơkă, sư ưh kơ pơm keh hă?

English: Behold, I have received a command to bless; He has blessed, and I cannot reverse it.
Bahnar: Na 'nâu, inh đei iŏk boih nơ̆r tơtă hơpơi ăn pŭn hiôk Kră Yang ăn boih pŭn hiôk, Inh ưh kơ pơjah ôh.

English: “He has not observed iniquity in Jacob, Nor has He seen wickedness in Israel. The LORD his God is with him, And the shout of a King is among them.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ đei 'bôh ôh tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lăm Jakôp, Păng ưh kơ đei tơdrong răm lăm Isơrael, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, oei hơdai lu sư, Lăm adrĕch Isơrael đei nơ̆r pơtao jreo chơt hiôk lăm lu sư.

English: God brings them out of Egypt; He has strength like a wild ox.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chông tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ. Lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m pran thoi rơmo bri.

English: “For there is no sorcery against Jacob, Nor any divination against Israel. It now must be said of Jacob And of Israel, ‘Oh, what God has done!’
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bơngai pơjâu lăm Jakôp. Lăm Isơrael kư̆m ưh kơ đei bơngai tơwir hơlĕnh yua kơ dang ei trŏ boih đe gô pơma khan gah Jakôp păng Isơrael thoi âu: Lăng đei tơdrong Kră Yang pơm hlĭch tơpă! Pă băt dang yơ.

English: Look, a people rises like a lioness, And lifts itself up like a lion; It shall not lie down until it devours the prey, And drinks the blood of the slain.”
Bahnar: To, đei minh khŭl kon pơlei iung thoi dăm-brang akăn, Păng iung dang dơ̆ng thoi dăm-brang tơno; Dĭng truh tơ đei rôp sa kon sem na mă drum, Păng huch sa pham lu kon sem mă đêl lu sư rôp sa.

English: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all!”
Bahnar: Na Balak khan kơ Balaam 'nĕ kơ hiap lu sư, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ hơpơi ăn pŭn hiôk.

English: So Balaam answered and said to Balak, “Did I not tell you, saying, ‘All that the LORD speaks, that I must do’?”
Bahnar: Balaam tơl Balak khan: Inh ưh tam mă khan kơ ih hă: Inh athei pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang gô khan athei.

English: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Please come, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
Bahnar: Balak khan kơ Balaam dơ̆ng: Thoi ei, hiăng năm, inh gô năm ba ih tơ anih nai; rŏ lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ ih hiap lu kon pơlei noh tơ noh.

English: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that overlooks the wasteland.
Bahnar: Balak chông ba Balaam truh tơ kơpal kông Pêôr, tơklă thŭng tơmăn glă.

English: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me here seven altars, and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
Bahnar: Balaam khan kơ Balak: Athei pơdơ̆ng ăn kơ inh tơ âu tơpơh tŏ chơnang soi păng chă lê̆ tơpơh tŏ rơmo dăm păng tơpơh tŏ triu tơno.

English: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on every altar.
Bahnar: Na, Balak pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Balaam athei; tơ rim chơnang soi, sư pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm păng minh pôm triu tơno.

English: Now when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he did not go as at other times, to seek to use sorcery, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
Bahnar: Balaam 'bôh Kră Yang hơdah dêh lăp đon sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael sư ưh pă đei năm thoi adrol ki wă chă Kră Yang Sư tơwih muh măt Sư tơklă char glă

English: And Balaam raised his eyes, and saw Israel encamped according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came upon him.
Bahnar: Balaam tơmang 'bôh adrĕch Isơrael pơm bơsŭn kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch păng Yang Bơhngol 'Bok Kei-Dei đei oei hơdai sư

English: Then he took up his oracle and said: “The utterance of Balaam the son of Beor, The utterance of the man whose eyes are opened
Bahnar: na sư pơma khan lê̆ adrol hăm nơ̆r hơri thoi âu: Nơ̆r hơri khan lê̆ adrol Balaam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr khan, Nơ̆r hơri sư thoi đei măt lar 'bôh hơdah

English: The utterance of him who hears the words of God, Who sees the vision of the Almighty, Who falls down, with eyes wide open
Bahnar: nơ̆r hơri đơ̆ng bơngai mă sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, Bơngai mă 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh đơ̆ng Kră Yang mơsêh mơyang sư bon drap kơkuh păng măt sư lar boih.

English: “How lovely are your tents, O Jacob! Your dwellings, O Israel!
Bahnar: Ơ Jakôp anih kơđông ih 'lơ̆ng pă băt dang yơ! Ơ Isơrael bơsŭn ih 'lơ̆ng tơpă!

English: Like valleys that stretch out, Like gardens by the riverside, Like aloes planted by the LORD, Like cedars beside the waters.
Bahnar: Thoi thŭng đe tơraih rai să, thoi pơgar 'nhot cheng đak glung, thoi 'long 'bâu phu mă đêl Kră Yang pơtăm 'long hơngo chăt cheng đak glung.

English: He shall pour water from his buckets, And his seed shall be in many waters. “His king shall be higher than Agag, And his kingdom shall be exalted.
Bahnar: Đak gô ro đơ̆ng thŭng blai lah lai truh tơ 'nguaih, găr adrĕch lu sư gô oei tơ lăm anih đei đak, Pơtao sư jing tih hloh kơ Agak. Dêh char sư rai să rai tih

English: “God brings him out of Egypt; He has strength like a wild ox; He shall consume the nations, his enemies; He shall break their bones And pierce them with his arrows.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chông tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, jơhngơ̆m lu sư pran kơtang thoi rơmo bri. Luăn sa lu dêh char nai, wă khan lu ayăt kơ sư. Gơ̆ pơchah lê̆ kơting lu sư, 'bet lu sư hăm 'brơ̆m hră

English: ‘He bows down, he lies down as a lion; And as a lion, who shall rouse him?’ “Blessed is he who blesses you, And cursed is he who curses you.”
Bahnar: lu sư drap, drum thoi dăm-brang tơno, kư̆m thoi dăm-brang akăn: Bu pơ̆n râu tơiung lu sư? Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ bơngai bu hơpơi ăn pŭn hiôk kơ ih, Hiap bĕ lu bơngai bu hiap ih.

English: Then Balak’s anger was aroused against Balaam, and he struck his hands together; and Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and look, you have bountifully blessed them these three times!
Bahnar: Balak hil areh kơ Balaam, tap ti păng khan kơ Balaam: Inh krao ih wă kơ ih hiap lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh; na ih rai sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ lu sư đei pêng wơ̆t boih.

English: Now therefore, flee to your place. I said I would greatly honor you, but in fact, the LORD has kept you back from honor.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, dang ei kơdâu wih bĕ tơ tơring ih kơdih! Inh khan boih, inh gô pôk apah kơ ih tơpă, mă-lei dang ei Kră Yang găn ih ưh kơ wă ih đei iŏk.

English: So Balaam said to Balak, “Did I not also speak to your messengers whom you sent to me, saying
Bahnar: Balaam khan kơ Balak, “Inh ưh kơ đei khan kơ lu bơngai mă ih wơh năm krao inh hă?

English: ‘If Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not go beyond the word of the LORD, to do good or bad of my own will. What the LORD says, that I must speak’?
Bahnar: Mă khan Balak ăn kơ inh hnam sư 'bĕnh kơ hu 'maih, inh kư̆m ưh kơ lê̆ ôh nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang tơtă athei, wă pơm tơdrong trŏ 'lơ̆ng dah kơnê̆ mơ̆ng kơ inh kơdih wă; inh athei pơma dôm tơdrong kiơ mă Kră Yang đei khan!

English: And now, indeed, I am going to my people. Come, I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the latter days.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, dang ei adrol kơ inh wih brŏk tơ kon pơlei inh kơdih. Năm tơ âu bĕ, inh gô roi ăn kơ ih băt lu kon pơlei âu gô pơm kiơ kơ lu kon pơlei ih ning-mônh.

English: So he took up his oracle and said: “The utterance of Balaam the son of Beor, And the utterance of the man whose eyes are opened
Bahnar: Balaam hơri khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu: Nơ̆r hơri khan lê̆ adrol Balaam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr, Nơ̆r hơri khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng bơngai mă măt đei 'bôh hơdah boih.

English: The utterance of him who hears the words of God, And has the knowledge of the Most High, Who sees the vision of the Almighty, Who falls down, with eyes wide open
Bahnar: Nơ̆r hơri khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng bơngai mă kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma, Băt hlôh tơdrong gơh hơgei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Lăng 'bôh tơdrong tơ'bôh đơ̆ng Kră Yang Mơsêh Mơyang. Drap bon tơ teh na măt sư lar 'bôh hơdah boih.

English: “I see Him, but not now; I behold Him, but not near; A Star shall come out of Jacob; A Scepter shall rise out of Israel, And batter the brow of Moab, And destroy all the sons of tumult.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh sư, mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ dang ei ôh; inh lăng tơ sư, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh jê̆ ôh; Đei minh pôm sơnglŏng lĕch đơ̆ng Jakôp. Đei minh pôm 'long jra pơtao lĕch dơ̆ng Isơrael; Gô teh pơchah kơ̆l Môap păng pơlôch đĭ kon bơngai mă ngăl iung blah sư.

English: “And Edom shall be a possession; Seir also, his enemies, shall be a possession, While Israel does valiantly.
Bahnar: Gô blah iŏk char Eđôm păng kư̆m gô blah iŏk char Seir, mă ayăt kơ Sư; Isơrael gô tơ'bôh tơdrong pran kơtang sư.

English: Out of Jacob One shall have dominion, And destroy the remains of the city.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu yŏng pơgơ̆r gô lĕch đơ̆ng Jakôp, gô pơlôch pơrăm đĭ lu bơngai oei klaih đơ̆ng lăm pơlei tih.

English: Then he looked on Amalek, and he took up his oracle and said: “Amalek was first among the nations, But shall be last until he perishes.”
Bahnar: Balaam kư̆m 'bôh Amalek, na roi tơbăt adrol khan: Amalek jing kơ̆l kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak; mă-lei tuch-luch sư, kư̆m gô lôch.

English: Then he looked on the Kenites, and he took up his oracle and said: “Firm is your dwelling place, And your nest is set in the rock
Bahnar: Balaam 'bôh bơngai Kênit na khan tơbăt lê̆ adrol hăm nơ̆r hơri: Anih ih oei noh kơjăp thoi. Tơpu oei lăm tơmo.

English: Nevertheless Kain shall be burned. How long until Asshur carries you away captive?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kain hiong răm. Dĭng truh tơ Asur rôp ba ih pơm bơnă?

English: Then he took up his oracle and said: “Alas! Who shall live when God does this?
Bahnar: Balaam pơma khan lê̆ adrol: Ô! Tơdah Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm tơdrong âu, bu gơh oei arih?

English: But ships shall come from the coasts of Cyprus, And they shall afflict Asshur and afflict Eber, And so shall Amalek, until he perishes.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei gô đei lơ duk đơ̆ng dêh Kitim truh rôp pơmat lu bơngai Asur păng lu bơngai Eber; Păng lu sư đe kư̆m gô pơrăm đĭ mơ̆n.

English: So Balaam rose and departed and returned to his place; Balak also went his way.
