Bahnar: Balaam wih brŏk tơ tơring sư kơdih. Balak kư̆m wih brŏk mơ̆n.

English: Now Israel remained in Acacia Grove, and the people began to commit harlotry with the women of Moab.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu bơngai Isơrael oei 'bơ̆t Sitim lu kon pơlei pơtơm ngôi kư̆ kă hăm lu drŏ-kăn Môap.

English: They invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-kăn 'nâu pơtơm kon pơlei Isơrael et sa pơm yang hơdai lu sư; kon pơlei Isơrael et sa păng drap kơkuh kơ yang lu sư.

English: So Israel was joined to Baal of Peor, and the anger of the LORD was aroused against Israel.
Bahnar: Isơrael pơm yang kơkuh kơ yang Baal Pêôr, đei Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ lu bơngai Isơrael

English: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people and hang the offenders before the LORD, out in the sun, that the fierce anger of the LORD may turn away from Israel.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Rôp đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei păng hrek atol lu sư 'bơ̆t tŏ, anăp Kră Yang wă kơ tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl weh đơ̆ng Isơrael.

English: So Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Every one of you kill his men who were joined to Baal of Peor.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis khan kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang: Rim 'nu lu iĕm athei pơlôch lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ yang Baal, Pêôr.

English: And indeed, one of the children of Israel came and presented to his brethren a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Âu, đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo Isơrael chông ba minh 'nu drŏ-kăn bơngai Madian kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư, 'bơ̆t anăp Môis păng 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael oei akŭm, kơplah lu sư oei nhơ̆m 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Now when Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose from among the congregation and took a javelin in his hand
Bahnar: Phinêhas, kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, sâu Arôn 'bok soi tơm, 'bôh tơdrong 'nâu, sư iung ti sư chĕp tơju, na weh đơ̆ng anăp lu bơngai tơpôl oei akŭm

English: and he went after the man of Israel into the tent and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her body. So the plague was stopped among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: kiơ̆ bơngai Isơrael mơ̆t lăm bơsŭn, 'bet hloi bơngai drŏ-nglo Isơrael noh klĕch hloi tơ klak bơngai drŏ-kăn; đơ̆ng noh tơdrong truh kơ bơngai Isơrael pơdơh hloi.

English: And those who died in the plague were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Na, wă đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai lôch yua kơ tơdrong pơrăm truh âu.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned back My wrath from the children of Israel, because he was zealous with My zeal among them, so that I did not consume the children of Israel in My zeal.
Bahnar: Phinêhas, kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, sâu Arôn, 'bok soi, đei tơjur lê̆ 'biơ̆ tơdrong Inh hil kơ bơngai Isơrael, yua kơ sư kư̆m gar lu sư thoi Inh; thoi ei, na Inh huay pă pơlôch pơrăm bơngai Isơrael lăm tơdrong inh hil gar dơ̆ng

English: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I give to him My covenant of peace
Bahnar: yua kơ thoi noh, khan bĕ: Inh ăn kơ sư tơdrong pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian Inh

English: and it shall be to him and his descendants after him a covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was zealous for his God, and made atonement for the children of Israel.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'măn kơ sư, hăm lu kon sâu sư, tơdrong bơ̆jang 'bok soi ling-lang, yua kơ sư đei jơhngơ̆m đon tơnăp băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Now the name of the Israelite who was killed, who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader of a father’s house among the Simeonites.
Bahnar: Anăn bơngai drŏ-nglo Isơrael mă đe 'bet lôch hơdai bơngai drŏ-kăn Madian noh, Simri kon drŏ-nglo Salu, yŏng kơdră kơ adrĕch bơngai Simêôn.

English: And the name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi the daughter of Zur; he was head of the people of a father’s house in Midian.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn Madian đe 'bet lôch hơdai noh, anăn Kôsbi kon drŏ-kăn Sur, yŏng kơdră kơ minh adrĕch bơngai Madian.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Harass the Midianites, and attack them
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ lu bơngai Madian thoi lu ayăt păng blah pơlôch bĕ lu sư.

English: for they harassed you with their schemes by which they seduced you in the matter of Peor and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a leader of Midian, their sister, who was killed in the day of the plague because of Peor.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư pơrŭng pơm kơ iĕm, pơhlŭ lu iĕm kơkuh kơ yang Pêôr păng lăm tơdrong Kôsbi, kon drŏ-kăn yŏng kơdră adrĕch Madian, mŏ lu sư đe pơlôch lăm năr đei tơdrong jĭ truh lôch rŭng, yua kơ kơkuh kơ yang Pêôr.

English: And it came to pass, after the plague, that the LORD spoke to Moses and Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong lôch hơbuh, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn 'bok soi tơm

English: “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel from twenty years old and above, by their fathers’ houses, all who are able to go to war in Israel.”
Bahnar: Athei iŏk hla bơar chih jô̆ bĕ đĭ adrĕch Isơrael, iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch gah 'bok lu sư, wă khan đĭ-đăng adrĕch bơngai Isơrael mă gơh năm tơblah.

English: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho, saying
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis păng Êlêasar 'bok soi, khan kơ lu sư lăm char glă Môap jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă pơlei Jêrikô.

English: “Take a census of the people from twenty years old and above, just as the LORD commanded Moses and the children of Israel who came out of the land of Egypt.”
Bahnar: Pơm hla bơar chih jô̆ bĕ kon bơngai Isơrael, iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, thoi Kră Yang đei athei Môis păng kon pơlei Isơrael, mă lĕch boih đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: Reuben was the firstborn of Israel. The children of Reuben were: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites
Bahnar: Rubên 'nhŏng kơdră lu bơngai Isơrael, kon drŏ-nglo Rubên noh Hanok; đơ̆ng Hanok pơjing adrĕch adrung Hanok; đơ̆ng Palu pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Palu

English: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Hêsrôn pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Hêsrôn, đơ̆ng Karmi pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Karmi.

English: These are the families of the Reubenites: those who were numbered of them were forty-three thousand seven hundred and thirty.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih jing adrĕch adrung Rubên, chih jô̆ đĭ lu sư đei puăn-jĭt pêng-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'nu.

English: And the son of Pallu was Eliab.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Palu noh Êliap.

English: The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram, representatives of the congregation, who contended against Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the LORD
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Êliap: Nêmuel, Đathan păng Abiram. Đathan păng Abiram 'nâu boih, mă pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl tơpôl iung blah pơjah hăm Môis păng Arôn, kiơ̆ kơ khŭl Kôrê kơplah lu sư iung blah hăm Kră Yang.

English: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up together with Korah when that company died, when the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men; and they became a sign.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, teh ha 'bơ̆r luăn 'bar 'nu bre sư păng Kôrê hơdai, lu bơngai kiơ̆ khŭl sư lôch hloi kơ ŭnh sa đĭ 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu drŏ-nglo; noh boih tơ'bôh wă kơ kơchăng.

English: Nevertheless the children of Korah did not die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu kon sâu Kôrê huay kơ lôch.

English: The sons of Simeon according to their families were: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Simêôn, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung sư: Đơ̆ng Nêmuel pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Nêmuel; đơ̆ng Jamin pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Jamin; đơ̆ng Jakin pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Jakin

English: of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites; of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Sêra pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Sêra; đơ̆ng Sal pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Sal.

English: These are the families of the Simeonites: twenty-two thousand two hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung Sêmêôn, đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Gad according to their families were: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Gat kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung sư, đơ̆ng Sêphôn pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Sêphôn; đơ̆ng Hagi pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Hagi; đơ̆ng Suni pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Suni

English: of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Ôsni pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Ôsni; đơ̆ng Eri pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Eri

English: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Arôt pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Arôt; đơ̆ng Arêli pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Arêli.

English: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those who were numbered of them: forty thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung lu kon drŏ-nglo Gat kiơ̆ kơ đei jô̆ lu sư, đei puăn-jĭt rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan; and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Juđa: Er păng Ônan; mă-lei Er păng Ônan lôch boih tơ lăm dêh char Kanaan.

English: And the sons of Judah according to their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Perez, the family of the Parzites; of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Juđa, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung sư: Đơ̆ng Sêla đei pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Sêla; đơ̆ng Pêres đei pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Pêres; đơ̆ng Sêra đei pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Sêra.

English: And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Pêres: Đơ̆ng Hêsrôn đei pơjing adrĕch adrung Hêsrôn; đơ̆ng Hamul đei pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Hamul.

English: These are the families of Judah according to those who were numbered of them: seventy-six thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu adrĕch adrung Juđa kiơ̆ kơ đei chih jô̆ lu sư, đei tơpơh-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Issachar according to their families were: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puah, the family of the Punites
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Isakar, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung sư kơdih: Đơ̆ng Tôla pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Tôla; đơ̆ng Puwa pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Puwa

English: of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Jasup; pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Jasup; đơ̆ng Simrôn pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Simrôn.

English: These are the families of Issachar according to those who were numbered of them: sixty-four thousand three hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung Isakar chih jô̆ lu sư đei tơdrâu-jĭt puăn-rơbâu pêng-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Zebulun according to their families were: of Sered, the family of the Sardites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Sabulôn kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Sêret pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Sêret; đơ̆ng Êlon pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Êlon; đơ̆ng Jahlel pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Jahlel.

English: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those who were numbered of them: sixty thousand five hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung Sabulôn đei chih jô̆ lu sư, tơdrâu-jĭt rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Joseph according to their families, by Manasseh and Ephraim, were
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Manase păng Êphraim.

English: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir begot Gilead; of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Manase, đơ̆ng Makir pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Makir, Makir jing 'bă kơ Gileat; đơ̆ng Gileat pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Gileat.

English: These are the sons of Gilead: of Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Gileat: Đơ̆ng Lêser pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Lêser; đơ̆ng Hêlek pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Hêlek

English: of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Asriel pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Asriel; đơ̆ng Sichem pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Sichem

English: of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Sêmida pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Sêmida; đơ̆ng Hêpher pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Hêpher.

English: Now Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters; and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
Bahnar: Sêlôpêhat kon drŏ-nglo Hêpher ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo ôh, đei kon drŏ-kăn đĕch. Anăn lu kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat, Mahla, Nôa, Hogla, Mika păng Tirsa.

English: These are the families of Manasseh; and those who were numbered of them were fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung Manase, chih jô̆ lu sư đei pơđăm-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu.

English: These are the sons of Ephraim according to their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites; of Becher, the family of the Bachrites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Êphraim kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Suthêla đei pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Suthêla; đơ̆ng Bêker pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Bêker; đơ̆ng Tahan pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Tahan.

English: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Suthêla: Đơ̆ng Êran pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Êran.

English: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those who were numbered of them: thirty-two thousand five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph according to their families.
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch adrung lu kon drŏ-nglo Êphraim chih jô̆ lu sư, đei pêng-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu. 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: The sons of Benjamin according to their families were: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Bênjamin kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Bêla pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Bêla; đơ̆ng Asbel pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Asbel; đơ̆ng Ahiram pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Ahiram

English: of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Supham pơjing kơ adrĕch adrung Supham; đơ̆ng Hupham pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Hupham.

English: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites; of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Bêla: Ardơ păng Haman. Đơ̆ng Ardơ pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Ardơ; đơ̆ng Naman pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Naman.

English: These are the sons of Benjamin according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu kon drŏ-nglo Bênjamin kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư. Chih jô̆ lu sư đei puăn-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: These are the sons of Dan according to their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan according to their families.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Đan kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Suham pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Suham. 'Nâu adrĕch adrung Đan kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those who were numbered of them, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch adrung Suham chih jô̆ lu sư đei tơdrâu-jĭt puăn-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Asher according to their families were: of Jimna, the family of the Jimnites; of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites; of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Aser kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Imna pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Imna; đơ̆ng Iswi pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Iswi; đơ̆ng Bêria pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Bêria.

English: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Bêria: Đơ̆ng Heber pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Hêber; đơ̆ng Malkiên pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Malkiên.

English: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
Bahnar: Anăn kon drŏ-kăn Aser noh Sêra.

English: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those who were numbered of them: fifty-three thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung lu kon drŏ-nglo Aser chih jô̆ lu sư, đei pơđăm-jĭt pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The sons of Naphtali according to their families were: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Neptali kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung lu sư: Đơ̆ng Jaseel pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Jaseel; đơ̆ng Guni pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Guni

English: of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Jeser pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Jeser; đơ̆ng Silem pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Silem.

English: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand four hundred.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih adrĕch adrung Neptali kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư; chih jô̆ lu sư đei puăn-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng 'nu.

English: These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel: six hundred and one thousand seven hundred and thirty.
Bahnar: 'Nâu đei chih jô̆ lu kon pơlei adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael, tơdrâu-hrĕng minh-rơbâu, tơpơh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'nu.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis.

English: “To these the land shall be divided as an inheritance, according to the number of names.
Bahnar: Ih athei asong ăn kơ lu đe âu teh wă jang sa kiơ̆ kơ kơ̆l bơngai mă đei jô̆

English: To a large tribe you shall give a larger inheritance, and to a small tribe you shall give a smaller inheritance. Each shall be given its inheritance according to those who were numbered of them.
Bahnar: adrĕch adrung ayơ kon pơlei sư lơ ih asong sư să 'biơ̆, adrĕch adrung ayơ kon pơlei sư tŏ sĕt ih asong teh jang sa lu sư iĕ 'biơ̆. Ih athei asong teh jang sa kơ rim adrĕch adrung kiơ̆ kơ đei chih jô̆ boih.

English: But the land shall be divided by lot; they shall inherit according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.
Bahnar: Ih athei hlang lăng mưh ih wă asong teh, lu sư gô đei teh jang sa kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư

English: According to the lot their inheritance shall be divided between the larger and the smaller.”
Bahnar: Ih athei asong teh jang sa kiơ̆ kơ đei hlang lăng boih, mơ'nah trŏ kơ teh jang sa să, mơ'nah trŏ kơ teh jang sa iĕ 'biơ̆.

English: And these are those who were numbered of the Levites according to their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch adrung Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ đe đei jô̆ boih lu sư: Đơ̆ng Gersôn pơjing adrĕch adrung Gersôn; đơ̆ng Kôhat pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Kôhat; đơ̆ng Mêrari pơjing đei adrĕch adrung Mêrari

English: These are the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, and the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begot Amram.
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch adrung Lêwi; adrĕch adrung Lipni; adrĕch adrung Hêbrôn; adrĕch adrung Mahli, adrĕch adrung Musi, adrĕch adrung Kôra, Kôhat jing 'bă kơ Amram.

English: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; and to Amram she bore Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
Bahnar: Akăn Amram anăn Jôkêbêt kon drŏ-kăn Lêwi tơpŭ tơ lăm dêh char Êyiptơ; sư tơpŭ ăn kơ Aram, Arôn, Môis păng mŏ kơ bre sư anăn Miriam.

English: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Bahnar: Arôn pơjing Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar, Ithamar.

English: And Nadab and Abihu died when they offered profane fire before the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre Nađap păng Abihu lôch kơplah bre sư pơyơ̆r ŭnh pha 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Now those who were numbered of them were twenty-three thousand, every male from a month old and above; for they were not numbered among the other children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given to them among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng minh khei tơ kơpal, đei 'bar-jĭt pêng-rơbâu; adrĕch bơngai Lêwi đe ưh kơ đei jô̆ hơdai hăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael, yua kơ ưh kơ đei asong ôh teh jang sa hơdai lu kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: These are those who were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Môis păng Êlêasar 'bok soi chih jô̆ lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael lăm char glă Môap jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn tơklă pơlei Jêrikô.

English: But among these there was not a man of those who were numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest when they numbered the children of Israel in the Wilderness of Sinai.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai âu, ưh kơ đei bu mă Môis păng Arôn, 'bok soi tơm, đei jô̆ kơplah bre sư chih jô̆ kon pơlei Isơrael lăm char glă Sinai.

English: For the LORD had said of them, “They shall surely die in the wilderness.” So there was not left a man of them, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang đei khan boih gah lu bơngai noh thoi âu: Lu sư gô lôch lăm char glă ưh kơ đei bu oei arih, lăp bre Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê păng Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun đĕch oei arih.

English: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, from the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and these were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat, kon drŏ-nglo Hêpher, sâu Gileat, sâu i Makir, sâu ach Manase, lăm adrĕch adrung kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep. 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-kăn sư: Mahla, Nôa, Hogla, Milka păng Tirsa.

English: And they stood before Moses, before Eleazar the priest, and before the leaders and all the congregation, by the doorway of the tabernacle of meeting, saying
Bahnar: Lu sư năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Môis păng Êlêasar 'bok soi, 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră pơgơ̆r păng 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng khăn, na khan

English: “Our father died in the wilderness; but he was not in the company of those who gathered together against the LORD, in company with Korah, but he died in his own sin; and he had no sons.
Bahnar: 'Bă lu nhôn lôch boih tơ lăm char glă; sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ ôh lu tơpôl akŭm wă blah Kră Yang, wă khan lu khŭl Kôrê, mă-lei sư lôch yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih; păng sư ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo ôh.

English: Why should the name of our father be removed from among his family because he had no son? Give us a possession among our father’s brothers.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ anăn 'bă lu nhôn sŭt lê̆ ưh kơ đei chih tơmơ̆t lăm lu adrĕch adrung sư yua kơ sư ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo ôh? Asong bĕ lu nhôn teh jang sa hơya minh lăm lu 'nhŏng oh 'bă lu nhôn.

English: So Moses brought their case before the LORD.
Bahnar: Môis ba tơdrong lu sư apinh noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “The daughters of Zelophehad speak what is right; you shall surely give them a possession of inheritance among their father’s brothers, and cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat pơma noh trŏ; ih athei asong lu sư teh jang sa minh đơ̆ng lăm lu 'nhŏng oh 'bă lu sư, wă khan ăn kơ lu sư teh jang sa đơ̆ng 'bă lu sư.

English: And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘If a man dies and has no son, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass to his daughter.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael thoi âu: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai bu lôch mă ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo, lei lu iĕm athei jao ăn teh jang sa sư noh kơ lu kon drŏ-kăn sư.

English: If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-kăn, lei lu iĕm gô ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư.

English: If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư ưh kơ đei 'nhŏng oh pôm mĕ 'bă lei ăn kơ lu 'nhŏng oh 'bă sư.

English: And if his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to the relative closest to him in his family, and he shall possess it.’ ” And it shall be to the children of Israel a statute of judgment, just as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă lu sư ưh kơ đei 'nhŏng oh ôh, lei jao ăn teh jang noh kơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai bu mă jê̆ hloh; păng bơngai noh iŏk jang sa. Noh jĭ minh tơdrong juăt păng tơdrong tơtă ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă khan ăn kơ Môis.

English: Now the LORD said to Moses: “Go up into this Mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Tŏk bĕ tơ kông Abarim na tơmang lăng bĕ tơ dêh char mă Inh wă ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael.

English: And when you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was gathered.
Bahnar: Đang kơ ih lăng dêh char noh boih, ih kư̆m gô wih kiơ̆ 'bok yă ih, thoi 'nhŏng ih Arôn kư̆m wih kiơ̆ 'bok yă boih.

English: For in the Wilderness of Zin, during the strife of the congregation, you rebelled against My command to hallow Me at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the waters of Meribah, at Kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin.)
Bahnar: Yua kơ ih sơngah ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Inh tơtă tơ lăm char glă Yin sơ̆, kơplah lu kon pơlei iung blah. Yua kơ măr iĕm ưh pă pơyom boih kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư kơ tơdrong đak Mêriba krao đak tơhil băl tơ dêh Kalđê, lăm char glă Yin

English: Then Moses spoke to the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Môis tơl Kră Yang

English: “Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Yang kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai, apinh Ih rơih chă ăn bĕ minh 'nu lăm khŭl adrĕch adrung âu pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r.

English: who may go out before them and go in before them, who may lead them out and bring them in, that the congregation of the LORD may not be like sheep which have no shepherd.”
Bahnar: Wă kơ bơngai noh mơ̆t lĕch năm 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, wă kơ bơngai noh chông ba lu sư mơ̆t păng chông ba lu sư lĕch, wă kơ khŭl akŭm Kră Yang huay kơ thoi triu ưh kơ đei bơngai wei.

English: And the LORD said to Moses: “Take Joshua the son of Nun with you, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Iŏk bĕ Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, bơngai đei Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng lăm sư; pel bĕ kơ̆l sư.

English: set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation, and inaugurate him in their sight.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh năm ba sư tơ'bơ̆p Êlêasar 'bok soi păng lu khŭl akŭm, na ih jao hloi kơ sư tơdrong jang 'bơ̆t anăp tơpôl

English: And you shall give some of your authority to him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may be obedient.
Bahnar: păng ih kư̆m jao hloi kơ tơdrong gơh kĕ ih wă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael chu yom mơ̆ng kiơ̆ sư.

English: He shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire before the LORD for him by the judgment of the Urim. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, he and all the children of Israel with him—all the congregation.”
Bahnar: Sư gô năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi, Êlêasar, sư apinh Urim 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang ăn kơ Jôsuê wă kơ sư băt sek tơdrong liơ, Jôsuê păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael athei kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong jang lu sư gô mơ̆t dah gô lĕch.

English: So Moses did as the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua and set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis pơm kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei khan athei sư, rơih iŏk Jôsuê năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi Êlêasar păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: And he laid his hands on him and inaugurated him, just as the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Dan ti kơpal kơ̆l sư păng pơjao ăn, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă athei Môis pơm thoi noh.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Command the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘My offering, My food for My offerings made by fire as a sweet aroma to Me, you shall be careful to offer to Me at their appointed time.’
Bahnar: Tơtă bĕ tơdrong 'nâu hăm lu kon pơlei Isơrael păng khan: Ăn lu iĕm kơchăng jah pơyơ̆r kơ Inh tơmam sa kiơ̆ trŏ kơ đêl nơ̆r Inh tơtă, pơyơ̆r kơ Inh noh tơmam soi 'buh na 'bâu phu truh tơ Inh.

English: “And you shall say to them, ‘This is the offering made by fire which you shall offer to the LORD: two male lambs in their first year without blemish, day by day, as a regular burnt offering.
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: 'Nâu tơmam pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh na lu iĕm gô pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang: Rim năr 'bar tŏ triu kon iĕ tơno đei minh sơnăm ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, jing tơmam pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, the other lamb you shall offer in the evening
Bahnar: Ih athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm kon triu kiơ̆ pơgê, minh pôm kiơ̆ kơsơ̆ măng

English: and one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil.
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, ih athei pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt êphaa tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm minh lăm puăn hinb đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: It is a regular burnt offering which was ordained at Mount Sinai for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Noh tơmam soi 'buh ling-lang inh đei tơtă kơ iĕm tơ kông Sinai, noh jơ̆ minh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And its drink offering shall be one-fourth of a hin for each lamb; in a holy place you shall pour out the drink to the LORD as an offering.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi huch noh minh lăm puăn hin tơdrô tơ rim minh pôm kon triu. Ih athei pơyơ̆r tơmam huch păng tơdrô ăn kơ Kră Yang lăm anih rơgoh.

English: The other lamb you shall offer in the evening; as the morning grain offering and its drink offering, you shall offer it as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Ih athei pơyơ̆r kon triu mă 'bar noh kơplah kơsơ̆ măng păng pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba păng tơmam huch thoi til pơgê hei, noh boih tơmam soi soh păng ŭnh pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘And on the Sabbath day two lambs in their first year, without blemish, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, with its drink offering
Bahnar: Năr Sa'bat ih athei pơyơ̆r 'bar tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, ưh kơ jĭ kiơ păng 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ đak rơmă pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r ưh kơ đei pham hơdai hăm tơmam huch hai.

English: this is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering.
Bahnar: Noh tơdrong tơmam pơyơ̆r 'buh lăm rim năr giĕng Sa'bat, sư 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r ling-lang păng tơmam soi huch hai.

English: ‘At the beginnings of your months you shall present a burnt offering to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year, without blemish
Bahnar: Năr blŭng-a lăm rim khei, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno păng tơpơh triu kon tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for each bull; two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram
Bahnar: Pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ đak rơmă ôliwơ yua pơm tơmam soi 'buh hơdai kơ rim rơmo dăm; 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ đak rơmă ôliwơ pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba ưh kơ đei pham kơ minh pôm triu tơno

English: and one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour, mixed with oil, as a grain offering for each lamb, as a burnt offering of sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: minh lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ yua pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba. Noh boih jing tơmam soi 'buh đei 'bâu phu, pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Their drink offering shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, one-third of a hin for a ram, and one-fourth of a hin for a lamb; this is the burnt offering for each month throughout the months of the year.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi huch iŏk lăm minh puăt hin sik hơmu kơ rim minh pôm rơmo tơno păng minh lăm pêng hin kơ kon triu tơno. Minh puăn hin kơ rim triu kon tơno. Noh boih tơmam soi 'buh kơ lăm rim năr blŭng-a kơ khei lăm sơnăm.

English: Also one kid of the goats as a sin offering to the LORD shall be offered, besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh mă juăt kơ pơyơ̆r păng tơmam soi huch hai, kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang minh pôm kon bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi pơklaih yoch.

English: ‘On the fourteenth day of the first month is the Passover of the LORD.
Bahnar: Năr mơjĭt-puăn khei mônh, athei pơm giĕng năm brih kơ Kră Yang.

English: And on the fifteenth day of this month is the feast; unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
Bahnar: Truh năr mơjĭt-pơđăm lăm khei noh jing năr giĕng; sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông lăm tơpơh năr.

English: On the first day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă mônh gô đei akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh kơ jang dah pơm minh tơdrong kiơ gah sĕch akar ôh.

English: And you shall present an offering made by fire as a burnt offering to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm păng tơpơh tŏ triu tơno, lăp minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei rơka, pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: Their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah you shall offer for a bull, and two-tenths for a ram
Bahnar: Tơmam soi phe 'ba gô iŏk tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ; lu iĕm iŏk pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ minh pôm rơmo tơno, iŏk 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ kon triu tơno

English: you shall offer one-tenth of an ephah for each of the seven lambs
Bahnar: păng iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rim kon triu

English: also one goat as a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
Bahnar: hăm minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi pơklaih yoch, wă huai iŏk yoch đơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a regular burnt offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'nâu, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh kiơ̆ pơgê, noh tơmam soi 'buh đei hơnơ̆ng.

English: In this manner you shall offer the food of the offering made by fire daily for seven days, as a sweet aroma to the LORD; it shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Athei pơyơ̆r rim năr lăm tơpơh năr, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh lăm ŭnh, đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang. Ăn kơ lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh đei hơnơ̆ng păng pơyơ̆r hơdai hăm tơmam huch hai.

English: And on the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơpơh iĕm athei akŭm rơgoh 'lơ̆ng lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh jang kiơ gah sĕch akar ôh.

English: ‘Also on the day of the firstfruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the LORD at your Feast of Weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work.
Bahnar: Lăm năr giĕng phĕ yuă blŭng-a, lăp iĕm đei plei blŭng-a kĕch yuă đei 'ba hle lăm bơyan, kơplah iĕm pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi phe 'ba hle, iĕm athei akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; lăm năr noh lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh jang minh tơdrong kiơ gah sĕch akar.

English: You shall present a burnt offering as a sweet aroma to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô rôp 'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno păng tơpơh tŏ triu kon tơno lăp minh sơnăm, wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang

English: with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram
Bahnar: tơmam soi phe 'ba peh iŏk tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ minh pôm rơmo dăm, 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ minh pôm triu tơno

English: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs
Bahnar: minh lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rim kon triu

English: also one kid of the goats, to make atonement for you.
Bahnar: kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm bơbe tơno, wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ bơ̆n kơdih.

English: Be sure they are without blemish. You shall present them with their drink offerings, besides the regular burnt offering with its grain offering.
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ tơmam soi juăt kơ đei pơyơ̆r hơnơ̆ng păng hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba kư̆m đei lu tơmam soi huch hai. Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r lu kon sem tơmam soi noh, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ.

English: ‘And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work. For you it is a day of blowing the trumpets.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mônh khei tơpơh, lu iĕm gô đei akŭm hơdai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; ưh kơ gơh kơ jang minh tơdrong kiơ gah sĕch akar lu iĕm, năr noh năr giĕng hlôm keng.

English: You shall offer a burnt offering as a sweet aroma to the LORD: one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year, without blemish.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp minh pôm kon rơmo dăm; minh pôm triu tơno păng tơpơh tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ pơm tơmam soi 'buh, soh pơyơ̆r đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Their grain offering shall be fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the ram
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba iŏk tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rơmo dăm, 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ triu tơno

English: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs
Bahnar: iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rim lăm tơpơh tŏ kon triu tơno.

English: also one kid of the goats as a sin offering, to make atonement for you
Bahnar: Rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi, wă huai iŏk đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lu iĕm.

English: besides the burnt offering with its grain offering for the New Moon, the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, as a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'nâu 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh mă juăt rim năr lăm khei hơdai hăm pơyơ̆r tơpŭng phe 'ba, hăm tơmam soi 'buh juăt kơ đei ling-lang păng tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng hơdai hăm tơmam huch, kiơ̆ thoi đei pơkă lê̆ boih kơ rim tơmam soi noh, na yua ŭnh soh đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall afflict your souls; you shall not do any work.
Bahnar: Năr mơjĭt lăm khei tơpơh 'nâu, lu iĕm akŭm hơdai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tih, lu iĕm athei pơjuăt pơmat akâu iĕm kơdih, a lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh jang minh tơdrong kiơ gah sĕch akar ôh.

English: You shall present a burnt offering to the LORD as a sweet aroma: one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs in their first year. Be sure they are without blemish.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno păng tơpơh tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao lăp minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, pơm tơmam soi 'buh pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, two-tenths for the one ram
Bahnar: Tơmam soi phe 'ba iŏk tơpŭng jrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, tuh pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rơmo dăm, 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ triu tơno.

English: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs
Bahnar: Minh lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rim kon triu tơno.

English: also one kid of the goats as a sin offering, besides the sin offering for atonement, the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai yoch; 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch tơmam soi 'buh mă juăt rim năr păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, hăm tơmam soi huch.

English: ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work, and you shall keep a feast to the LORD seven days.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei tơpơh lu iĕm athei akŭm tih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'nĕ kơ jang minh tơdrong jang kiơ gah sĕch akar, iĕm athei pơm giĕng bơsŭn kơ Kră Yang lăm tơpơh năr.

English: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire as a sweet aroma to the LORD: thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year. They shall be without blemish.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp mơjĭt-pêng tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno păng mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ jĭ kiơ, pơm tơmam soi 'buh, soh hăm ŭnh đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Their grain offering shall be of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each of the two rams
Bahnar: Tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, b iŏk tơpŭng jrâu bơlŭ hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, pêng lăm mơjĭt êpha kơ rim rơmo dăm, 'bar lăm mơjĭt kơ rim triu tơno

English: and one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs
Bahnar: păng minh lăm mơjĭt kơ rim kon triu tơno.

English: also one kid of the goats as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi wă huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r mă juăt ling-lang păng tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai.

English: ‘On the second day present twelve young bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă 'bar, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r mơjĭt-'bar tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ jĭ kiơ

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: hăm tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba pơm tơmam soi huch kơ rơmo dăm, triu tơno păng kon triu tơno, kiơ̆ thoi juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi noh.

English: also one kid of the goats as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai juăt pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: ‘On the third day present eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r mơjĭt-mônh tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ.

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno păng rim kon triu, tơno kiơ̆ kơ thoi juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r.

English: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh hơdai lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai mă juăt kơ pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: ‘On the fourth day present ten bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year, without blemish
Bahnar: Năr mă puăn lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r mơjĭt tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ jĭ kiơ

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai, kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno păng kơ rim kon triu tơno, kiơ̆ kơ thoi đei juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: also one kid of the goats as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh hơdai lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai mă juăt kơ pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: ‘On the fifth day present nine bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: Năr mă pơđăm, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơsĭn tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ jĭ kiơ.

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: Hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno păng rim kon triu tơno, kiơ̆ thoi juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai mă juăt kơ pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: ‘On the sixth day present eight bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: Năr mă tơdrâu lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơhngam tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ jĭ kiơ

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: Hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai, kơ rim rơmo dăm, rim kơ triu tơno păng kon triu, kiơ̆ thoi juăt soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno păng kơ rim kon triu tơno, kiơ̆ kơ thoi juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: ‘On the seventh day present seven bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: Năr mă tơpơh, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơpơh tŏ rơmo dăm, 'bar tŏ triu tơno, mơjĭt-puăn tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch hai kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno, kơ rim kon triu tơno kiơ̆ thoi mă juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno, pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng hăm tơmam soi huch hai mă juăt kơ pơyơ̆r ling-lang.

English: ‘On the eighth day you shall have a sacred assembly. You shall do no customary work.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơhngam, lu iĕm athei akŭm tih; ưh kơ gơh jang minh tơdrong jang kiơ kơ sĕch akar

English: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire as a sweet aroma to the LORD: one bull, one ram, seven lambs in their first year without blemish
Bahnar: athei rôp minh pôm rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno păng tơpơh tŏ kon triu tơno 'nao minh sơnăm, huay kơ đei jĭ kiơ, pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh đei 'nhui 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang

English: and their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, by their number, according to the ordinance
Bahnar: hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch kơ rim rơmo dăm, kơ rim triu tơno păng kơ rim kon triu tơno kiơ̆ thoi mă juăt kơ soi pơyơ̆r boih.

English: also one goat as a sin offering, besides the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh mă juăt kơ pơm ling-lang, hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch et hai.

English: ‘These you shall present to the LORD at your appointed feasts (besides your vowed offerings and your freewill offerings) as your burnt offerings and your grain offerings, as your drink offerings and your peace offerings.’ ”
Bahnar: Noh boih mă tơmam soi lu iĕm athei soi pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang lăm năr iĕm soi sơmah tih, wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, tơmam soi huch păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê hiôk-hian, 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi mă đêl pơkă păng lu tơmam soi pơyơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk lu iĕm.

English: So Moses told the children of Israel everything, just as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Môis roi kơ lu bơngai Isơrael dôm tơdrong mă Kră Yang đei pơkă athei sư.

English: Then Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, “This is the thing which the LORD has commanded
Bahnar: Môis kư̆m khan kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: 'Nâu mă nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan

English: If a man makes a vow to the LORD, or swears an oath to bind himself by some agreement, he shall not break his word; he shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo wă pơkă pơkăm hăm Kră Yang tơdrong kiơ sư athei pơm mă keh nơ̆r đêl pơkăm noh.

English: “Or if a woman makes a vow to the LORD, and binds herself by some agreement while in her father’s house in her youth
Bahnar: Dah đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn, kơplah sư oei 'lơ̆p oei lăm hnam 'bă sư, đei pơma pơkă pơkăm hăm Kră Yang tơdrong kiơ.

English: and her father hears her vow and the agreement by which she has bound herself, and her father holds his peace, then all her vows shall stand, and every agreement with which she has bound herself shall stand.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă sư băt boih tơdrong nơ̆r sư pơkă pơkăm păng sư chu pŭ iŏk, lei na sư athei pơm mă 'blep đêl nơ̆r sư pơkă pơkăm noh.

English: But if her father overrules her on the day that he hears, then none of her vows nor her agreements by which she has bound herself shall stand; and the LORD will release her, because her father overruled her.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă sư kơtơ̆ng na khă hloi kon sư 'bơ̆t sư băt lei na nơ̆r kon sư pơkă pơkăm noh kon sư huay pă pŭ boih. Kră Yang gô mơnat kơ sư yua kơ 'bă sư khă găn.

English: “If indeed she takes a husband, while bound by her vows or by a rash utterance from her lips by which she bound herself
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-kăn noh đei klo boih, kơplah sư đei nơ̆r pơkă dah đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư pơma pơkăm, minh tơdrong kiơ

English: and her husband hears it, and makes no response to her on the day that he hears, then her vows shall stand, and her agreements by which she bound herself shall stand.
Bahnar: tơdah klo sư kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, mă-lei ưh kơ đei pơma kiơ hăm sư lăm năr sư kơtơ̆ng, lei nơ̆r pơkăm noh oei đei păng wei jơhngơ̆m sư đei pơkă boih kơdih akâu sư pŭ iŏk gô oei đei.

English: But if her husband overrules her on the day that he hears it, he shall make void her vow which she took and what she uttered with her lips, by which she bound herself, and the LORD will release her.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah klo sư băt tơdrong noh, na khă sư, thoi noh nơ̆r sư pơkă noh ưh pă sĭt, gô hiong tôch mă nơ̆r ayơ sư pơma 'bơm ưh kơ đei tơchĕng đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư, yua kơ noh na sư chu pŭ, na Kră Yang gô mơnat ăn kơ sư.

English: “Also any vow of a widow or a divorced woman, by which she has bound herself, shall stand against her.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r pơkă pơkăm lu bơngai drŏ-kăn adro klo lôch păng lu drŏ-kăn adro pơ̆ng, dôm tơdrong kiơ mă sư pơkăm gô oei đei.

English: “If she vowed in her husband’s house, or bound herself by an agreement with an oath
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn đei pơkă boih lăm hnam klo sư, dah đei pơma pơkăm hăm jơhngơ̆m tơdrong kiơ

English: and her husband heard it, and made no response to her and did not overrule her, then all her vows shall stand, and every agreement by which she bound herself shall stand.
Bahnar: păng dah klo sư băt boih tơdrong 'nei, mă-lei huay kơ pơma kơ sư, huay kơ khă sư, lei bơngai drŏ-kăn noh athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong mă đêl sư pơkă păng tơdrong mă sư đei pơkăm oei sĭt.

English: But if her husband truly made them void on the day he heard them, then whatever proceeded from her lips concerning her vows or concerning the agreement binding her, it shall not stand; her husband has made them void, and the LORD will release her.
Bahnar: Tơdah klo sư băt boih, lei dôm tơdrong đêl sư pơkă păng tơdrong đêl sư pơkăm noh kư̆m huay pă đei jô̆ boih; lei na dôm tơdrong đêl sư pơkă pơkăm Kră Yang kư̆m mơnat ăn huay pă jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong noh.

English: Every vow and every binding oath to afflict her soul, her husband may confirm it, or her husband may make it void.
Bahnar: Klo sư jô̆ yoch dah huay dôm tơdrong sư đei pơkă pơkăm hăm dih kâu sư.

English: Now if her husband makes no response whatever to her from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or all the agreements that bind her; he confirms them, because he made no response to her on the day that he heard them.
Bahnar: Dah klo sư oei huay kơ jô̆ yoch đunh truh dơning, klo sư wei kơjăp mă sư băt boih tơdrong noh.

English: But if he does make them void after he has heard them, then he shall bear her guilt.”
Bahnar: Tơdah klo sư băt mă-lei gô đunh boih na khan, lei klo sư gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch akăn sư.

English: These are the statutes which the LORD commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, and between a father and his daughter in her youth in her father’s house.
Bahnar: Noh boih dôm tơdrong juăt mă Kră Yang đei khan ăn kơ Môis gah klo kăn, dah 'bă hăm kon drŏ-kăn sư, kơplah oei 'lơ̆p oei lăm hnam 'bă sư.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Take vengeance on the Midianites for the children of Israel. Afterward you shall be gathered to your people.”
Bahnar: Năm blah bĕ adrĕch Madian pơm 'mong ăn kơ adrĕch bơngai Isơrael; đơ̆ng noh na ih gô wih brŏk hơdai 'bok yă.

English: So Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm some of yourselves for war, and let them go against the Midianites to take vengeance for the LORD on Midian.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis khan tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei thoi âu: Lăm lu iĕm athei hơmet hơlă đao kơtuang năm blah adrĕch Madian wă pơm 'mong ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: A thousand from each tribe of all the tribes of Israel you shall send to the war.”
Bahnar: Rim adrĕch Isơrael athei wơh minh-rơbâu 'nu linh năm tơblah.

English: So there were recruited from the divisions of Israel one thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lăm adrĕch Isơrael đei rơih iŏk kư̆ minh adrĕch minh-rơbâu 'nu linh, đei mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu bơngai hơmet 'brơ̆m, đao, kơtuang năm tơblah.

English: Then Moses sent them to the war, one thousand from each tribe; he sent them to the war with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, with the holy articles and the signal trumpets in his hand.
Bahnar: Môis wơh mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu noh năm tơblah, wă khan wơh minh-rơbâu 'nu đơ̆ng lăm rim adrĕch, hơdai hăm Phinêhas, kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, 'bok soi, sư chĕp ba tơmam tơblah păng keng wă hlôm krao đơ̆ng lăm anih rơgoh.

English: And they warred against the Midianites, just as the LORD commanded Moses, and they killed all the males.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu sư tơblah băl hăm bơngai Madian, thoi Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis păng pơlôch đĭ lu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of those who were killed—Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. Balaam the son of Beor they also killed with the sword.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơlôch pơđăm 'nu pơtao Madian hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă lu sư đei pơlôch boih, anăn pơđăm 'nu pơtao noh, Êwi, Rêkem, Sur, Hur păng Reba, kư̆m iŏk đao pơlôch Balaam, kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr.

English: And the children of Israel took the women of Midian captive, with their little ones, and took as spoil all their cattle, all their flocks, and all their goods.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael rôp ba lu bơngai drŏ-kăn păng lu kon hơ'lơ̆p Madian, rôp iŏk đĭ lu sem dơrong, triu păng đĭ-đăng tơmam mŭk măk lu sư.

English: They also burned with fire all the cities where they dwelt, and all their forts.
Bahnar: Soh đĭ lu pơlei tih lu hnam oei, lu bơngai Madian

English: And they took all the spoil and all the booty—of man and beast.
Bahnar: kư̆m chĕp iŏk pơđĭ dôm lu mŭk tơmam mă đơ̆ng lu sư blah iŏk, mă tơmam dah bơngai.

English: Then they brought the captives, the booty, and the spoil to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the children of Israel, to the camp in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.
Bahnar: Lu sư chông păng chĕp ba pơđĭ bơngai dah lu mŭk tơmam mă đơ̆ng lu sư blah iŏk ăn kơ Môis păng Êlêasar, 'bok soi păng ăn kơ lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael oei tơ kơđông tơ lăm tơmăn glă char Môap, jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă pơlei Jêrikô.

English: And Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the congregation, went to meet them outside the camp.
Bahnar: Môis, Êlêasar 'bok soi păng đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r năm tơ'bơ̆p lu linh tơ đaih kơ kơđông linh.

English: But Moses was angry with the officers of the army, with the captains over thousands and captains over hundreds, who had come from the battle.
Bahnar: Môis sư hil kơ lu yŏng, wă khan lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh lăm minh-rơbâu păng yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm minh-hrĕng 'nu linh mă 'nao brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah 'nâu.

English: And Moses said to them: “Have you kept all the women alive?
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: Lu iĕm oei rong lu bơngai drŏ-kăn oei arih hă?

English: Look, these women caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to trespass against the LORD in the incident of Peor, and there was a plague among the congregation of the LORD.
Bahnar: To, lu sư noh boih mă kiơ̆ đon hơlĕnh Balaam pơhlŭ kon pơlei Isơrael pơm yang kơkuh kơ Pêôr păng yoch tih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch noh boih pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael đei tơdrong gleh truh

English: Now therefore, kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known a man intimately.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, pơlôch bĕ đĭ lu kon drŏ-nglo hơ'lơ̆p păng pơlôch đĭ hloi lu bơngai drŏ-kăn mă đei 'bĭch hăm drŏ-nglo boih

English: But keep alive for yourselves all the young girls who have not known a man intimately.
Bahnar: mă-lei 'nĕ pơlôch lu bơngai drŏ-kăn mă tam mă đei 'bĭch hơdai hăm drŏ-nglo.

English: And as for you, remain outside the camp seven days; whoever has killed any person, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves and your captives on the third day and on the seventh day.
Bahnar: Bĕ gah lu iĕm athei, 'bĭch tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông lăm tơpơh năr. Bu mă đei pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai dah pel hơtŭt 'bơm akâu bơngai lôch, dah bơngai mă bơ̆n đei rôp, athei ming hơmet akâu mă rơgoh lăm năr mă pêng păng năr mă tơpơh.

English: Purify every garment, everything made of leather, everything woven of goats’ hair, and everything made of wood.”
Bahnar: Kŭm athei pih hơbĕn ao mă rơgoh, athei ôp đĭ dôm tơmam đe pơm păng akar păng sŏk bơbe păng dôm lu tơmam đe pơm păng 'long.

English: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who had gone to the battle, “This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD commanded Moses
Bahnar: Êlêasar, 'bok soi, khan kơ lu linh 'nao brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah thoi âu: 'Nâu tơdrong juăt bơtho đơ̆ng Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis

English: Only the gold, the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead
Bahnar: Hu, maih, kong, bơsei, kem bơlơ̆k

English: everything that can endure fire, you shall put through the fire, and it shall be clean; and it shall be purified with the water of purification. But all that cannot endure fire you shall put through water.
Bahnar: wă khan dôm lu tơmam mă gơh 'buh lăm ŭnh, lu iĕm athei 'buh lăm ŭnh wă kơ goh, mă-lei đe kư̆m yua đak wă ôp sư rơgoh, gah tơmam kiơ mă ưh kơ gơh kơ 'buh lăm ŭnh, athei tong sư lăm đak ôp 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And you shall wash your clothes on the seventh day and be clean, and afterward you may come into the camp.”
Bahnar: Năr mă tơpơh lu iĕm athei pih hơbĕn ao iĕm, lei na sư goh; đơ̆ng noh na iĕm gơh mơ̆t lăm kơđông.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Count up the plunder that was taken—of man and beast—you and Eleazar the priest and the chief fathers of the congregation
Bahnar: Ăn kơ ih, hăm Êlêasar 'bok soi păng đĭ-đăng yŏng kơdră rim kơ adrĕch, athei chih jô̆ dôm tơmam mă iĕm đei blah iŏk đơ̆ng lu ayăt, mă bơngai dah sem dơrong

English: and divide the plunder into two parts, between those who took part in the war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.
Bahnar: na asong tơmam noh ăn kơ lu iĕm bơngai mă năm tơblah păng asong ăn kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl tơpôl akŭm.

English: And levy a tribute for the LORD on the men of war who went out to battle: one of every five hundred of the persons, the cattle, the donkeys, and the sheep
Bahnar: Gah tơmam kơ lu linh năm tơblah, mă bơngai, dah rơmo, aseh iĕ dah triu, ih athei iŏk minh lăm pơđăm-hrĕng na akŭm pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang

English: take it from their half, and give it to Eleazar the priest as a heave offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: wă khan na iŏk minh puăt đơ̆ng lăm tơmam lê̆ kơ linh tơblah noh păng ăn kơ Êlêasar, 'bok soi, pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And from the children of Israel’s half you shall take one of every fifty, drawn from the persons, the cattle, the donkeys, and the sheep, from all the livestock, and give them to the Levites who keep charge of the tabernacle of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Mă oei minh puăt noh ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael, mă bơngai, rơmo, aseh iĕ, dah triu, wă khan lu kon sem dơrong, ih kư̆ iŏk mưh đei pơđăm-jĭt ih iŏk minh 'măn lê̆ pha păng jao ăn kơ adrĕch Lêwi bơngai jang lăng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Kră Yang.

English: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Môis păng Êlêasar, 'bok soi, pơm kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis.

English: The booty remaining from the plunder, which the men of war had taken, was six hundred and seventy-five thousand sheep
Bahnar: Na, tơmam mă đơ̆ng lu linh blah iŏk đơ̆ng lu ayăt noh, tơdrâu-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu tŏ triu

English: seventy-two thousand cattle
Bahnar: tơpơh-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu rơmo

English: sixty-one thousand donkeys
Bahnar: tơdrâu-jĭt mônh rơbâu aseh iĕ.

English: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of women who had not known a man intimately.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn adruh tam băt kơ drŏ-nglo, đĭ-đăng đei pêng-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu 'nu.

English: And the half, the portion for those who had gone out to war, was in number three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep
Bahnar: Minh puăt đơ̆ng gah lu bơngai năm tơblah, đei pêng-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng tŏ triu

English: and the LORD’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred and seventy-five.
Bahnar: na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơdrâu-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt pơđăm tŏ

English: The cattle were thirty-six thousand, of which the LORD’s tribute was seventy-two.
Bahnar: pêng-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu tŏ rơmo, na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang đei tơpơh-jĭt 'bar tŏ

English: The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which the LORD’s tribute was sixty-one.
Bahnar: pêng-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng tŏ aseh iĕ păng na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơdrâu-jĭt mônh tŏ

English: The persons were sixteen thousand, of which the LORD’s tribute was thirty-two persons.
Bahnar: mơjĭt-tơdrâu rơbâu 'nu bơngai păng na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang pêng-jĭt 'bar 'nu

English: So Moses gave the tribute which was the LORD’s heave offering to Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Môis pơjao ăn kơ Êlêasar, 'bok soi, tơmam na jing tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang, trŏ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan kơ Môis.

English: And from the children of Israel’s half, which Moses separated from the men who fought
Bahnar: Minh puăt tơmam noh ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael mă Môis đei klah lê̆ boih minh puăt kơ lu linh năm tơblah

English: now the half belonging to the congregation was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep
Bahnar: minh puăt 'nâu asong kơ khŭl akŭm, pêng-hrĕng pêng-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng tŏ triu

English: thirty-six thousand cattle
Bahnar: pêng-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu tŏ rơmo

English: thirty thousand five hundred donkeys
Bahnar: pêng-jĭt rơbâu pơđăm-hrĕng tŏ aseh iĕ

English: and sixteen thousand persons
Bahnar: păng mơjĭt-tơdrâu 'nu bơngai.

English: and from the children of Israel’s half Moses took one of every fifty, drawn from man and beast, and gave them to the Levites, who kept charge of the tabernacle of the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Lăm minh puăt noh asong kơ adrĕch Isơrael, Môis klah lê̆ kư̆ lăm pơđăm-jĭt tŏ minh pôm, mă bơngai dah sem tơmam păng pơjao ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi wă bơ̆jang wei-lăng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Kră Yang, kiơ̆ trŏ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă khan kơ sư.

English: Then the officers who were over thousands of the army, the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, came near to Moses
Bahnar: Lu yŏng linh, wă khan yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu 'nu linh păng yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng 'nu linh, năm jê̆ Môis

English: and they said to Moses, “Your servants have taken a count of the men of war who are under our command, and not a man of us is missing.
Bahnar: na khan: Lu nhôn đĭch đam ih đei chih jô̆ boih linh, lu bơngai ala kơ lu nhôn pơgơ̆r, jô̆ tôm đĭ ưh kơ đei bu hiong.

English: Therefore we have brought an offering for the LORD, what every man found of ornaments of gold: armlets and bracelets and signet rings and earrings and necklaces, to make atonement for ourselves before the LORD.”
Bahnar: Rim 'nu lu nhôn chĕp ba maih mă đơ̆ng lu nhôn blah iŏk, rơbưn, kong, tơkhiĕn, le đon, kon kiơng, wă pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang wă huai đơ̆ng yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: So Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from them, all the fashioned ornaments.
Bahnar: Môis păng Êlêasar 'bok soi iŏk maih păng đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam pơhrôp mă đei hling tuh boih.

English: And all the gold of the offering that they offered to the LORD, from the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu maih păng tơmam pơyơ̆r mă đơ̆ng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh, yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng linh na pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang, jô̆ đĭ mơjĭt-tơdrâu rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt seikơl.

English: (The men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)
Bahnar: Rim 'nu linh năm tơblah kư̆m iŏk tơmam kơ sư kơdih mơ̆n.

English: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tabernacle of meeting as a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis păng Êlêasar 'bok soi iŏk maih đơ̆ng yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh păng đơ̆ng yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng linh, na chĕp ba tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm pơm tơmam wă kơ 'blŏk kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock; and when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, that indeed the region was a place for livestock
Bahnar: Kon sâu Rubên hăm kon sâu Gat đei lơ sem dơrong; 'bôh tơring char Jaser hăm char Gileat jing anih 'lơ̆ng trŏ kơ wei rong rơmo, triu.

English: the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the leaders of the congregation, saying
Bahnar: Na năm khan kơ Môis, Êlêasar 'bok soi păng bơngai pơgơ̆r Isơrael thoi âu

English: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Shebam, Nebo, and Beon
Bahnar: Pơlei Atarôt, Đibôn, Jaser, Nimra, Hesbôn, Êlêaleh, Sêbam, Nêbô păng pơlei Bêôn.

English: the country which the LORD defeated before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock, and your servants have livestock.”
Bahnar: Pơlei tơring mă Kră Yang ăn tơblah jei 'bơ̆t anăp lu tơpôl akŭm adrĕch Isơrael, noh jơ̆ minh tơring 'lơ̆ng trŏ kơ wei rong sem dơrong păng lu đĭch đam ih đei sem dơrong lơ.

English: Therefore they said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants as a possession. Do not take us over the Jordan.”
Bahnar: Pơma khan dơ̆ng: Tơdah lu nhôn gơh mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp ih, rŏ ăn kơ nhôn đĭch đam ih oei tơring âu jang sa, apinh 'nĕ ăn kơ lu nhôn ngĕ kơ mah tŏk hlôi pah to đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: And Moses said to the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben: “Shall your brethren go to war while you sit here?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Môis tơl nơ̆r lu kon sâu Rubên păng Gat thoi âu: 'Nhŏng oh lu iĕm gô năm tơblah, na iĕm gô oei tơ âu hă?

English: Now why will you discourage the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the LORD has given them?
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm pơklai adrĕch Isơrael tơplih jơhngơ̆m, kuă kơ 'maih năm tơ dêh char mă Kră Yang đei ăn boih?

English: Thus your fathers did when I sent them away from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
Bahnar: Noh, yă 'bok lu iĕm kư̆m pơm thoi noh sơ̆ kơplah lu sư oei 'bơ̆t Kades Barnêa, inh wơh lu sư năm chop lăng dêh char.

English: For when they went up to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, so that they did not go into the land which the LORD had given them.
Bahnar: Lu yă 'bok iĕm tŏk năm truh tơ thŭng kuĕl Êskôl, lăng 'bôh tơring char, na pơhlŭ pơm ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael tơplih jơhngơ̆m kuă kơ năm mơ̆t tơ lăm dêh char mă Kră Yang ăn.

English: So the LORD’s anger was aroused on that day, and He swore an oath, saying
Bahnar: Lăm noh hloi, Kră Yang hil mĭl păng sư pơkă khan

English: ‘Surely none of the men who came up from Egypt, from twenty years old and above, shall see the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because they have not wholly followed Me
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ, iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpơ̆ng, gô ưh kơ 'bôh ôh dêh char mă Inh đei pơkă pơ'ngam wă ăn kơ Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp, yua kơ lu bơngai noh ưh kơ kiơ̆ Inh tơnăp

English: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun, for they have wholly followed the LORD.’
Bahnar: lăp Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê bơngai Kênisit păng Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun, yua kơ bre sư kiơ̆ Kră Yang tơnăp đĭ jơhngơ̆m.

English: So the LORD’s anger was aroused against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation that had done evil in the sight of the LORD was gone.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl dêh kơ lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, na sư ăn kơ lu đe noh yak thông huang lăm char glă noh puăn-jĭt sơnăm, dĭng mă đĭ-đăng jơhnơr lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lôch đĭ.

English: And look! You have risen in your fathers’ place, a brood of sinful men, to increase still more the fierce anger of the LORD against Israel.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu iĕm iung tơplih kơ 'bă lu iĕm, adrĕch bơngai kơnê̆ yoch, wă kơ rai pơthim tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ lu adrĕch Isơrael dơ̆ng.

English: For if you turn away from following Him, He will once again leave them in the wilderness, and you will destroy all these people.”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Sư, na Sư lê̆ lu adrĕch 'nâu oei hơnơ̆ng lăm char glă păng lu iĕm pơm ăn kơ adrĕch âu lôch đĭ.

English: Then they came near to him and said: “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock, and cities for our little ones
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu đe noh năm tơ jê̆ Môis khan: Lu nhôn gô pơm hơdrong kơ lu sem dơrong păng pơlei tih ăn kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p nhôn

English: but we ourselves will be armed, ready to go before the children of Israel until we have brought them to their place; and our little ones will dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
Bahnar: mă-lei lu nhôn gô chĕp tơmam tơblah yak năm 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Isơrael dĭng lu nhôn ba lu sư truh tơ anih mă đei klah asong ăn kơ lu sư. Gah kon akăn lu nhôn lu sư gô oei lăm pơlei tih kơjăp yua hli kơ kon pơlei lăm dêh char âu.

English: We will not return to our homes until every one of the children of Israel has received his inheritance.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn ưh tam mă brŏk tơ hnam lu nhôn adrol kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael tam mă iŏk teh jang sa.

English: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has fallen to us on this eastern side of the Jordan.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn ưh kơ đei kiơ lăm kon pơlei Isơrael oei pah to đak Krong Jôrđăn dah oei ataih đơ̆ng noh yua kơ lu nhôn đei teh jang sa tơ pah âu kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơ gah hơlĕch.

English: Then Moses said to them: “If you do this thing, if you arm yourselves before the LORD for the war
Bahnar: Môis tơl lu sư khan: Tơdah lu iĕm pơm thoi noh, tơdah chĕp đao kơtuang wă năm tơblah 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: and all your armed men cross over the Jordan before the LORD until He has driven out His enemies from before Him
Bahnar: tơdah lu iĕm chĕp đao kơtuang găn tŏk đak Krong Jôrđăn 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, dĭng truh tơ layơ puh lê̆ đĭ lu ayăt đơ̆ng anăp Sư

English: and the land is subdued before the LORD, then afterward you may return and be blameless before the LORD and before Israel; and this land shall be your possession before the LORD.
Bahnar: păng tơdah dơning dơmônh char 'nâu blah iŏk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang boih, iĕm wih brŏk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang hăm kon pơlei Isơrael, lu iĕm ưh pă đei pơma kiơ păng teh âu gô jing teh iĕm jang sa 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: But if you do not do so, then take note, you have sinned against the LORD; and be sure your sin will find you out.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh, lu iĕm gô pơm yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, iĕm athei băt tơdrong yoch noh gô tuh tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu iĕm.

English: Build cities for your little ones and folds for your sheep, and do what has proceeded out of your mouth.”
Bahnar: Pơm pơjing lu pơlei tih ăn kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p iĕm păng kư̆m pơm hơdrong kơ lu sem dơrong iĕm păng pơm thoi iĕm đei pơkă.

English: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying: “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gat păng kon sâu Rubên khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis: Lu đĭch đam ih gô pơm kiơ̆ kơ yŏng nhôn pơkă athei.

English: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock will be there in the cities of Gilead
Bahnar: Kon hơ'lơ̆p, lu akăn nhôn, khŭl triu păng đĭ-đăng lu sem dơrong lu nhôn gô oei tơ lăm pơlei tih tơ tơring char Gileat âu

English: but your servants will cross over, every man armed for war, before the LORD to battle, just as my lord says.”
Bahnar: mă-lei đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam ih gô chĕp đao hơlă, tŏk tơ pah to, răp găn păng năm tơblah 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, kiơ̆ thoi yŏng nhôn đei tơtă.

English: So Moses gave command concerning them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, gah tơdrong 'nâu Môis đei tơtă ăn kơ Êlêasar, 'bok soi, tơtă ăn kơ Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun păng tơtă ăn kơ lu yŏng kơdră rim adrĕch bơngai Isơrael

English: And Moses said to them: “If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben cross over the Jordan with you, every man armed for battle before the LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
Bahnar: na khan: Tơdah kon sâu Gat păng kon sâu Rubên chĕp đao hơlă tŏk găn đak Krong Jôrđăn hăm lu iĕm wă năm tơblah 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng tơdah dêh char noh jei lu iĕm, lei lu iĕm athei ăn kơ lu sư teh tơring Gileat jing teh lu sư jang sa.

English: But if they do not cross over armed with you, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu sư ưh kơ đei tŏk găn đak Krong chĕp đao hơlă hơdai iĕm, lei asong lu sư teh jang sa lăm dêh char Kanaan đĕch.

English: Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying: “As the LORD has said to your servants, so we will do.
Bahnar: Sâu Gat păng sâu Rubên tơl khan: Lu nhôn pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong kiơ mă Kră Yang đei tơtă khan hăm đĭch đam ih.

English: We will cross over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, but the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us on this side of the Jordan.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn gô chĕp đao hơlă tơmam tơblah tŏk yak rok anăp Kră Yang mơ̆t lăm dêh char Kanaan; mă-lei lu nhôn gô iŏk teh jang sa tơ pah âu đak Krong Jôrđăn.

English: So Moses gave to the children of Gad, to the children of Reuben, and to half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land with its cities within the borders, the cities of the surrounding country.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na Môis ăn kơ kon sâu Gat, kon sâu Rubên păng ăn minh puăt kơ kon sâu Manase, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep, dêh char Sihôn, pơtao Amôrit păng dêh char Ôk pơtao char Basan, wă khan dêh char hăm pơlei tih sư păng lu pơlei iĕ lăm tơring oei tăp dăr.

English: And the children of Gad built Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gat tơiung ming pơlei Dihôn, Atarôt păng pơlei Arôe

English: Atroth and Shophan and Jazer and Jogbehah
Bahnar: pơlei Atrôt Sôgan, pơlei Jaser, pơlei Jôbêha

English: Beth Nimrah and Beth Haran, fortified cities, and folds for sheep.
Bahnar: pơlei Bêt Nimra păng pơlei Bêt Haran, pơlei tih đei dur war kơjăp păng đei hơdrong sem dơrong hai.

English: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon and Elealeh and Kirjathaim
Bahnar: Kon sâu Rubên tơiung ming pơlei Hesbôn, Êlêaleh, Kiriathim

English: Nebo and Baal Meon (their names being changed) and Shibmah; and they gave other names to the cities which they built.
Bahnar: pơlei Nêbô, pơlei Baal Mêôn, anăn kơ rim pơlei sư đei tơplih păng Sipma; păng krao anăn plơ̆ng pơlei ayơ mă lu sư đei pơdơ̆ng

English: And the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead and took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were in it.
Bahnar: kon sâu Maki, kon drŏ-nglo Manase, năm blah iŏk tơring char Gileat păng puh tơweh lê̆ lu bơngai Amôrit lĕch.

English: So Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he dwelt in it.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Môis ăn tơring char Gileat kơ kon sâu Maki, kon drŏ-nglo Manase, lu sư oei tơ noh.

English: Also Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its small towns, and called them Havoth Jair.
Bahnar: Jair, kon sâu Manase, năm blah iŏk lu pơlei iĕ đơ̆ng kon pơlei adrĕch Amôrit, krao hloi anăn pơlei Hawôt Jar.

English: Then Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages, and he called it Nobah, after his own name.
Bahnar: Nôba năm blah iŏk pơlei tih Kênat hăm lu pơlei iĕ sư na krao hloi anăn pơlei Nôba kiơ̆ kơ anăn sư kơdih.

English: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, who went out of the land of Egypt by their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anih lu bơngai Isơrael yak păng pơdơh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ kiơ̆ kơ khŭl sư, đei Môis păng Arôn pơgơ̆r wei-lăng.

English: Now Moses wrote down the starting points of their journeys at the command of the LORD. And these are their journeys according to their starting points
Bahnar: Môis chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă chih jô̆ anih trong lu kon pơlei yak năm, hăm chih jô̆ kiơ̆ kơ anih lu sư pơdơh. Thoi noh 'nâu lu anih lu sư pơdơh păng trong lu sư yak năm.

English: They departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the day after the Passover the children of Israel went out with boldness in the sight of all the Egyptians.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei mônh, năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr giĕng năm brih lu sư pơtơm yak đơ̆ng pơlei Ramese, lu sư yak hmă ưh kơ hli tơm măt lu kon pơlei bơngai Êyiptơ 'bôh.
