English: For the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had killed among them. Also on their gods the LORD had executed judgments.
Bahnar: Bơngai Êyiptơ oei 'bŭ kon lu sư mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơlôch, đĭ-đăng kon kơdră: Kră Yang phak lu yang lu sư.

English: Then the children of Israel moved from Rameses and camped at Succoth.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Ramese năm pơm pơlei pơdơh tơ Sukôt

English: They departed from Succoth and camped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
Bahnar: lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Sukôt lu sư pơm pơlei pơdơh tơ Êtham, oei tơ jih kơ thŭng tơmăn glă.

English: They moved from Etham and turned back to Pi Hahiroth, which is east of Baal Zephon; and they camped near Migdol.
Bahnar: Lĕch đơ̆ng Êtham yak dăr gah Pi Hahirôt, gah hơlĕch pơlei Baal Sêphôn; păng pơm pơlei pơdơh tơ Mikdôl.

English: They departed from before Hahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness, went three days’ journey in the Wilderness of Etham, and camped at Marah.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei lê̆ Pi Hahirôt, yak rok lăm đak dơsĭ truh tơ thŭng tơmăn glă, yak pêng năr kơ trong lăm char glă Êtham, đơ̆ng noh lu sư pơm pơlei pơdơh tơ Mara.

English: They moved from Marah and came to Elim. At Elim were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; so they camped there.
Bahnar: Yak đơ̆ng Mara truh tơ Êlim; tơ Êlim đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ tu đak mơlĕch păng tơpơh-jĭt tơnơm 'long gol, na pơm pơlei pơdơh tơ noh.

English: They moved from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei năm đơ̆ng Êlim oei pơdơh jê̆ đak Dơsĭ 'Brê

English: They moved from the Red Sea and camped in the Wilderness of Sin.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ 'brê năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ thŭng tơmăn glă Sin

English: They journeyed from the Wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng tơmăn glă Sin năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Dôpkah

English: They departed from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Dôpkah năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Alus

English: They moved from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Alus năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Rêphiđim, tơ anih noh đak ưh kơ đei ôh ăn kơ lu kon pơlei nhă.

English: They departed from Rephidim and camped in the Wilderness of Sinai.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng Rêphiđim năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ thŭng glă Sinai.

English: They moved from the Wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
Bahnar: Năm đơ̆ng thŭng glă Sinai năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Kibrôt Hatawa.

English: They departed from Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
Bahnar: Weh đơ̆ng Kibrôt Hatawa năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Haserôt

English: They departed from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Haserôt năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Ritma

English: They departed from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Ritma năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Rimon Pêres

English: They departed from Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Rimon Pêres năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Lipna

English: They moved from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Lipna năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Risa

English: They journeyed from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Risa năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Kêlêhata

English: They went from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Kêlêhata năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh 'bơ̆t kông Sêpher

English: They moved from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng kông Sêpher năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh 'bơ̆t Harada

English: They moved from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Harada năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Makhêlôt

English: They moved from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Makhêlôt năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Tahat

English: They departed from Tahath and camped at Terah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Tahat năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Têra

English: They moved from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Têra năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Mitka

English: They went from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Mitka năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Hasmôna.

English: They departed from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
Bahnar: Lu sư weh đơ̆ng Hasmôna năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Mosêrôt

English: They departed from Moseroth and camped at Bene Jaakan.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Mosêrôt năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Bênê Jakan

English: They moved from Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Hagidgad.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Bênê Jakan năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Hôr Hagitgat.

English: They went from Hor Hagidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
Bahnar: Lu sư weh đơ̆ng Hôr Hagitgat năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Jôtbata

English: They moved from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
Bahnar: Lu sư weh đơ̆ng Jôtbata năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Abrôna

English: They departed from Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng Abrôna năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Êsiôn Gêber

English: They moved from Ezion Geber and camped in the Wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Êsiôn Gêber năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Kades lăm thŭng tơmăn glă Jin

English: They moved from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng Kades năm pơm pơlei oei tơ kông Hôr tôch hơdral hăm dêh char Eđôm.

English: Then Aaron the priest went up to Mount Hor at the command of the LORD, and died there in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
Bahnar: Arôn 'bok soi, kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang tơtă sư tŏk tơ kơpal kông Hôr păng lôch hloi tơ kơpal kông noh, lăm năr mônh khei pơđăm, sơnăm mă puăn-jĭt đơ̆ng rŏng kơ kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
Bahnar: Kơplah Arôn lôch tơ kơpal kông Hôr, sư arih đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt pêng sơnăm.

English: Now the king of Arad, the Canaanite, who dwelt in the South in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, pơtao đe Arat, noh bơngai Kanaan, oei tơ gah gơal tơring Kanaan, kơtơ̆ng khan kon pơlei Isơrael wă truh.

English: So they departed from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng kông Hôr păng pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Salmôna.

English: They departed from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
Bahnar: Weh đơ̆ng Salmôna năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Punon

English: They departed from Punon and camped at Oboth.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng Punon năm oei pơdơh tơ Ôbôt

English: They departed from Oboth and camped at Ije Abarim, at the border of Moab.
Bahnar: lu sư weh đơ̆ng Ôbôt năm oei pơdơh tơ Iyê Abarim hơdral hăm teh đak Môap.

English: They departed from Ijim and camped at Dibon Gad.
Bahnar: Weh đơ̆ng Iyê Abarim năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Đibôn Gat

English: They moved from Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.
Bahnar: weh đơ̆ng Đibôn Gat năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ Almôn-Diblatam.

English: They moved from Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
Bahnar: Weh đơ̆ng Almôn-Diblatam năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ kông Abarim tơ jê̆ Nêbô.

English: They departed from the mountains of Abarim and camped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.
Bahnar: Lu sư weh đơ̆ng kông Abarim năm pơm pơlei oei pơdơh tơ lăm thŭng glă char Môap jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă anăp pơlei Jêrikô.

English: They camped by the Jordan, from Beth Jesimoth as far as the Abel Acacia Grove in the plains of Moab.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơdơh jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei Bêt Jêsamôt truh tơ pơlei Abel Sitim lăm thŭng glă char Môap.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis lăm thŭng glă char Môap jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn tơklă anăp pơlei Jêrikô thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you have crossed the Jordan into the land of Canaan
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Kơplah iĕm tŏk găn hlôi đak Krong Jôrđăn wă mơ̆t tơ lăm dêh char Kanaan boih.

English: then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, destroy all their engraved stones, destroy all their molded images, and demolish all their high places
Bahnar: Puh bĕ pơđĭ kon pơlei oei lăm char noh đơ̆ng anăp lu iĕm, pơrăm pơđĭ lu rup yang mă lu sư mam hling kơtă păng kư̆m athei pơrăm lê̆ đĭ lu anih kơjung mă lu sư pơm yang.

English: you shall dispossess the inhabitants of the land and dwell in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô iŏk hloi tơring char noh, oei hloi tơ noh teh noh Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm jang sa.

English: And you shall divide the land by lot as an inheritance among your families; to the larger you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller you shall give a smaller inheritance; there everyone’s inheritance shall be whatever falls to him by lot. You shall inherit according to the tribes of your fathers.
Bahnar: Athei hlang lăng păng asong băl teh noh kiơ̆ kơ rim adrĕch 'bok lu iĕm. Adrĕch bu lơ, iĕm athei asong teh jang sa să 'biơ̆; adrĕch ayơ tŏ sĕt, iĕm asong lu sư iĕ 'biơ̆. Rim 'nu gô iŏk kiơ̆ kơ đei hlang lăng trŏ, iĕm kư̆ asong băl kiơ̆ adrĕch 'bok lu sư.

English: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then it shall be that those whom you let remain shall be irritants in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they shall harass you in the land where you dwell.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ đei puh tơweh lu kon pơlei oei lăm tơring char noh đơ̆ng anăp iĕm, na lu bơngai mă lu iĕm oei rong lê̆ gô nhen thoi 'long suĕng trŏ lăm măt, kư̆m thoi jơla trŏ kơiĕng lu iĕm, lu sư gô pơrŭng lu iĕm bơngai mă oei lăm char sư noh

English: Moreover it shall be that I will do to you as I thought to do to them.’ ”
Bahnar: lei Inh gô pơrŭng lu iĕm thoi Inh đei wă pơm kơ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Command the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall to you as an inheritance—the land of Canaan to its boundaries.
Bahnar: Khan tơbăt kơ kon pơlei Isơrael bĕ tơdrong 'nâu: Lu iĕm gô mơ̆t iŏk dêh char Kanaan jang sa, hơdral kơ dêh char noh thoi âu.

English: Your southern border shall be from the Wilderness of Zin along the border of Edom; then your southern border shall extend eastward to the end of the Salt Sea
Bahnar: Gah gơal hơdral lu iĕm, iŏk đơ̆ng tơmăn glă Yin, rok hơdral char Eđôm. Pơtơm đơ̆ng bơbah đak Dơsĭ 'Boh tơ gah hơlĕch.

English: your border shall turn from the southern side of the Ascent of Akrabbim, continue to Zin, and be on the south of Kadesh Barnea; then it shall go on to Hazar Addar, and continue to Azmon
Bahnar: Hơdral 'nâu rok dăr kơ kông Akrabim, gah Yin păng tơ'bưh gah gơal Kades Barnêa; đơ̆ng noh truh tơ Hasar Ađar hơloh truh tơ Asmôn

English: the border shall turn from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and it shall end at the Sea.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Asmôn rok weh gah đak glung Êyiptơ tơ'bưh tơ đak Dơsĭ tih.

English: ‘As for the western border, you shall have the Great Sea for a border; this shall be your western border.
Bahnar: Bĕ hơdral gah bơmơ̆t lu iĕm rok đak Dơsĭ Tih.

English: ‘And this shall be your northern border: From the Great Sea you shall mark out your border line to Mount Hor
Bahnar: Hơdral lu iĕm gah yă-nơ̆m: Iŏk đơ̆ng đak Dơsĭ Tih dĭng truh tơ kông Hôr

English: from Mount Hor you shall mark out your border to the entrance of Hamath; then the direction of the border shall be toward Zedad
Bahnar: iŏk đơ̆ng kông Hôr truh 'bơ̆t trong mơ̆t tơ pơlei Lebô Hamat, dĭng 'bơ̆t Sêđat.

English: the border shall proceed to Ziphron, and it shall end at Hazar Enan. This shall be your northern border.
Bahnar: Rok truh tơ gah Siphrôn, hơdral tôch 'bơ̆t Hasar Ênan noh boih hơdral lu iĕm tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: ‘You shall mark out your eastern border from Hazar Enan to Shepham
Bahnar: Gah hơlĕch hơdral lu iĕm iŏk đơ̆ng Hasar Ênan truh tơ Sêpham

English: the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain; the border shall go down and reach to the eastern side of the Sea of Chinnereth
Bahnar: đơ̆ng Sêpham jur truh tơ Ribla tơ gah hơlĕch kơ Ain; đơ̆ng noh jur tơ gah hơlĕch đak Dơsĭ Kinêret.

English: the border shall go down along the Jordan, and it shall end at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land with its surrounding boundaries.’ ”
Bahnar: Na tôch sư, truh jur tơ gah đak Krong Jôrđăn păng tơ'bưh tơ đak Dơsĭ 'Boh. Noh boih hơdral dêh char iĕm, đei hơdral tăp dăr thoi noh.

English: Then Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying: “This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which the LORD has commanded to give to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe.
Bahnar: Môis tơbăt nơ̆r tơtă 'nâu ăn kơ kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael thoi âu: Noh boih dêh char mă lu iĕm gô hlang lăng iŏk asong băl kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan ăn kơ tơsĭn adrĕch păng minh puăt adrĕch Manase.

English: For the tribe of the children of Reuben according to the house of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad according to the house of their fathers, have received their inheritance; and the half-tribe of Manasseh has received its inheritance.
Bahnar: Yua kơ adrĕch kon sâu Rubên, kiơ̆ kơ 'bok sư kơdih păng adrĕch kon sâu Gat, kiơ̆ kơ 'bok sư kơdih, hăm minh puăt adrĕch Manase đei iŏk boih teh jang sa kơ sư kơdih.

English: The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan, across from Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.”
Bahnar: 'Bar adrĕch păng minh puăt adrĕch 'nâu đei iŏk boih teh jang sa oei tơ paih âu gah hơlĕch đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă pơlei Jêrikô tơ gah măt 'năr lĕch.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “These are the names of the men who shall divide the land among you as an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu bơngai wă asong teh tơring Êlêasar 'bok soi păng Jôsuê kon drŏ-nglo Nun.

English: And you shall take one leader of every tribe to divide the land for the inheritance.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu iĕm chă rơih minh 'nu kơdră pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng lăm rim adrĕch wă kơ lu sư năm tơgŭm chă asong teh oei jang sa.

English: These are the names of the men: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu sư: Lăm adrĕch Juđa, đei Kalep, kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê

English: from the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud
Bahnar: Gah adrĕch kon sâu Simêôn, Sêmuel kon drŏ-nglo Amihut

English: from the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon
Bahnar: gah adrĕch kon sâu Bênjamin, Êlidat kon drŏ-nglo Kislon

English: a leader from the tribe of the children of Dan, Bukki the son of Jogli
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon sâu Đan, minh 'nu yŏng kơdră anăn sư Buki, kon drŏ-nglo Jogli

English: from the sons of Joseph: a leader from the tribe of the children of Manasseh, Hanniel the son of Ephod
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Manase kon Jôsep, đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră Haniel kon drŏ-nglo Ephôt

English: and a leader from the tribe of the children of Ephraim, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Êphraim kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră Kêmuel kon drŏ-nglo Siptan

English: a leader from the tribe of the children of Zebulun, Elizaphan the son of Parnach
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon drŏ-nglo Sabulôn đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră Êlisaphan kon drŏ-nglo Parnak

English: a leader from the tribe of the children of Issachar, Paltiel the son of Azzan
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon drŏ-nglo Isakar đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră anăn sư Paltiel kon drŏ-nglo Asan

English: a leader from the tribe of the children of Asher, Ahihud the son of Shelomi
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon drŏ-nglo Aser đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră, anăn sư Ahihut kon drŏ-nglo Sêlômi

English: and a leader from the tribe of the children of Naphtali, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.”
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch kon sâu Neptali, đei minh 'nu yŏng kơdră anăn sư Pêdahel kon drŏ-nglo Amihut.

English: These are the ones the LORD commanded to divide the inheritance among the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
Bahnar: Lu đe âu boih Kră Yang pơkă athei lu sư klah asong teh jang sa kơ lu kon pơlei adrĕch bơngai Isơrael lăm char Kanaan.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis 'bơ̆t lăm thŭng glă char Môap jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn tơklă anăp pơlei Jêrikô

English: “Command the children of Israel that they give the Levites cities to dwell in from the inheritance of their possession, and you shall also give the Levites common-land around the cities.
Bahnar: Tơtă bĕ kơ lu kon sâu adrĕch Isơrael wă kơ lu sư klah asong ăn teh đơ̆ng lu sư đei, kơ lu bơngai Lêwi oei tơ lăm pơlei tih; păng asong ăn hloi teh kơ lu sư tơ tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih noh

English: They shall have the cities to dwell in; and their common-land shall be for their cattle, for their herds, and for all their animals.
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi lu sư gô đei oei lăm lu pơlei tih; na teh 'nhĕt tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih noh lê̆ kơ khŭl sem dơrong lu sư sa.

English: The common-land of the cities which you will give the Levites shall extend from the wall of the city outward a thousand cubits all around.
Bahnar: Teh mă tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih lu iĕm ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung bơngai Lêwi noh minh-rơbâu hơgăt tăp dăr, iŏk đơ̆ng dur pơlei truh tơ 'nguaih.

English: And you shall measure outside the city on the east side two thousand cubits, on the south side two thousand cubits, on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits. The city shall be in the middle. This shall belong to them as common-land for the cities.
Bahnar: Lei na lu iĕm athei pơtŏ, gah 'nguaih kơ dur pơlei năm tơ gah hơlĕch noh 'bar-rơbâu hơgăt, năm tơ gah gơal 'bar-rơbâu hơgăt, năm tơ gah bơmơ̆t 'bar-rơbâu hơgăt, năm tơ gah yă-nơ̆m kư̆m 'bar-rơbâu hơgăt; lei pơlei tih noh tŏk-bŏk. Noh boih teh 'măn lê̆ kơ lu bơngai adrĕch Lêwi mă oei lăm pơlei tih.

English: “Now among the cities which you will give to the Levites you shall appoint six cities of refuge, to which a manslayer may flee. And to these you shall add forty-two cities.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei tih lu iĕm gô asong ăn kơ lu bơngai adrĕch Lêwi, gô đei tơdrâu tŏ pơlei tih wă ôn kơ'nơp mă lu iĕm athei tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu bơngai mă pơlôch đe kơdâu ôn tơ noh; 'nguaih kơ tơdrâu tŏ pơlei tih noh, lu iĕm athei 'măn lê̆ kơ adrĕch bơngai Lêwi puăn-jĭt 'bar tŏ pơlei.

English: So all the cities you will give to the Levites shall be forty-eight; these you shall give with their common-land.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng pơlei tih mă lu iĕm asong ăn kơ lu bơngai adrĕch Lêwi kư̆m asong ăn teh lăm hai, đĭ-đăng đei puăn-jĭt tơhngam tŏ pơlei.

English: And the cities which you will give shall be from the possession of the children of Israel; from the larger tribe you shall give many, from the smaller you shall give few. Each shall give some of its cities to the Levites, in proportion to the inheritance that each receives.”
Bahnar: Gah lu pơlei tih lu iĕm wă asong lu bơngai adrĕch Lêwi đơ̆ng teh adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, lu iĕm athei iŏk kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch, adrĕch đei teh lơ 'biơ̆ lu iĕm iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư lơ 'biơ̆, adrĕch đei pơlei tih tŏ sĕt lu iĕm athei iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư tŏ sĕt 'biơ̆; rim kơ adrĕch wă klah asong ăn kơ lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi noh kiơ̆ kơ tih pơlei đei lơ dah tŏ sĕt.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ adrĕch kon pơlei Isơrael: Mưh iĕm tŏk hlôi kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char Kanaan

English: then you shall appoint cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the manslayer who kills any person accidentally may flee there.
Bahnar: athei rơih chă kơ iĕm pơlei tih wă pơm pơlei ôn kơ'nơp, anih kơ lu bơngai mă hơch 'bơm pơlôch đe, gơh kơdâu ôn.

English: They shall be cities of refuge for you from the avenger, that the manslayer may not die until he stands before the congregation in judgment.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei tih noh wă yua pơm pơlei ăn kơ lu bơngai mă đe wă pơlôch kơdâu ôn kơ lu bơngai wă pơlôch 'mong tơiung kơting, wă kơ lu bơngai đe wă pơlôch noh huay kơ lôch dĭng truh tơ năr năm 'bơ̆t anăp khŭl tơpôl sek tơlang.

English: And of the cities which you give, you shall have six cities of refuge.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lăm lu pơlei tih mă lu iĕm 'măn lê̆ noh, đei tơdrâu tŏ pơlei tih wă ăn kơ lu iĕm ôn.

English: You shall appoint three cities on this side of the Jordan, and three cities you shall appoint in the land of Canaan, which will be cities of refuge.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô ăn pêng tŏ pơlei tih pah âu đak Krong Jôrđăn păng pơm pêng tŏ pơlei tih lăm char Kanaan; 'nâu mă lu pơlei mă lu iĕm wă kơdâu kơ'nơp.

English: These six cities shall be for refuge for the children of Israel, for the stranger, and for the sojourner among them, that anyone who kills a person accidentally may flee there.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu tŏ pơlei tih 'nâu wă pơm anih ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael ôn kơ'nơp, hăm kư̆m ăn kơ lu kon pơlei tơmoi păng lu bơngai mă oei lăm pơlei tih noh, wă kơ lu bơngai bu mă hơch 'bơm pơlôch đe gơh kơ kơdâu ôn tơ noh.

English: ‘But if he strikes him with an iron implement, so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah sư teh đe hăm mam, na lôch hloi, lei bơngai noh jô̆ sư pơlôch bơngai; bơngai mă pơlôch đe noh pơlôch bĕ sư.

English: And if he strikes him with a stone in the hand, by which one could die, and he does die, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Dah sư yua tơmo chĕp lăm ti sư na teh đe, bơngai mă sư teh hăm tơmo noh lôch, na đe jô̆ sư bơngai pơlôch bơngai; bơngai pơlôch đe noh pơlôch bĕ sư.

English: Or if he strikes him with a wooden hand weapon, by which one could die, and he does die, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh, tơdah bơngai bu chĕp 'long teh đe lôch hloi, bơngai noh jô̆ sư pơlôch bơngai; bơngai pơlôch đe noh pơlôch bĕ sư.

English: The avenger of blood himself shall put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he shall put him to death.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai iung kơting, gô pơlôch lu bơngai pơlôch đe; layơ lu bơngai wă iung kơting chă 'bôh tơ'bơ̆p lu bơngai mă pơlôch sư athei pơlôch hloi.

English: If he pushes him out of hatred or, while lying in wait, hurls something at him so that he dies
Bahnar: Dah đei bu mă yua kơ klai areh na tơlơ̆ đe, dah pơrơ̆ng klơ̆m hăm tơmam kiơ, yua kơ tơdrong noh na đe lôch

English: or in enmity he strikes him with his hand so that he dies, the one who struck him shall surely be put to death. He is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
Bahnar: dah yua kơ blĕk khŏn pơm 'mong na teh tŭr, yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong noh na đe lôch, bơngai bu mă pơm thoi noh đe pơlôch sư hloi. Noh jô̆ bơngai pơlôch bơngai; tơdah bơngai iung kơting chă 'bôh bơngai pơlôch đe noh athei pơlôch lê̆ sư.

English: ‘However, if he pushes him suddenly without enmity, or throws anything at him without lying in wait
Bahnar: Tơdah ưh kơ đei tơhil băl, oei hiôk băl đĕch, mă-lei đei minh 'nu năm tơlơ̆, dah klơ̆m chaih, tơmam kiơ 'bơm bơngai nai

English: or uses a stone, by which a man could die, throwing it at him without seeing him, so that he dies, while he was not his enemy or seeking his harm
Bahnar: dah ưh kơ đei ayăt băl ưh kơ đei wă pơrăm băl, kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh sư na hơch 'bơm tơhuŏng tơmo 'bơm bơngai na sư lôch hloi

English: then the congregation shall judge between the manslayer and the avenger of blood according to these judgments.
Bahnar: lei athei sek kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt 'nâu thoi âu. Khŭl tơpôl akŭm athei sek tơlang kơ lu bơngai mă teh đe păng bơngai wă iung kơting

English: So the congregation shall deliver the manslayer from the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall return him to the city of refuge where he had fled, and he shall remain there until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
Bahnar: Khŭl tơpôl kon pơlei athei dŏng tơgŭm pơklaih lu bơngai mă pơlôch đe đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai wă iung kơting păng athei bơngai noh brŏk tơ pơlei tih ôn kơ'nơp, tơ anih mă sư đei kơdâu ôn akâu; păng bơngai noh athei oei tơ noh hloi dĭng truh tơ năr 'bok soi tơm mă đe đei tuh đak rơmă tơ kơ̆l sư noh lôch 'mơ̆i.

English: But if the manslayer at any time goes outside the limits of the city of refuge where he fled
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bơngai pơlôch bơngai lĕch năm hlôi 'nguaih kơ pơlei tih mă sư đêl kơdâu ôn, anih mă sư đei kơdâu ôn boih

English: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the limits of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood
Bahnar: păng dah lu bơngai iung kơting, tơ'bơ̆p, pơlôch sư tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei tih mă sư kơdâu ôn, lei lu bơngai iung kơting, 'mong pham noh huay kơ đei yoch glăi ôh kơ pơlôch bơngai.

English: because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest the manslayer may return to the land of his possession.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơngai mă pơlôch bơngai noh athei oei tơ lăm pơlei tih wă ôn akâu noh dĭng truh tơ 'bok soi tơm noh lôch boih, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bok soi lôch boih na bơngai mă pơlôch bơngai noh gơh wih tơ pơlei sư jang sa.

English: ‘And these things shall be a statute of judgment to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu iĕm oei tơ dêh char ayơ lu iĕm răk tơdrong juăt 'nâu na sek tơlang tơduă lu iĕm lăm rim jơhnơr lu iĕm.

English: Whoever kills a person, the murderer shall be put to death on the testimony of witnesses; but one witness is not sufficient testimony against a person for the death penalty.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai bu pơlôch bơngai, lu iĕm kư̆ rôp sek kiơ̆ kơ đơ̆ng đe roi khai kơ sư na gơh pơlôch sư; mă-lei dah lăp minh 'nu bơngai đĕch roi, lei ưh tam gơh pơlôch bu ôh.

English: Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, but he shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ iŏk jên đơ̆ng lu bơngai pơlôch đe ăn wă huai tơdrong arih sư mă đe sek trŏ kơ wă pơlôch.

English: And you shall take no ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, that he may return to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ iŏk jên bơngai kơdâu ôn boih lăm pơlei tih ôn kơ'nơp, ăn kơnh sư gơh brŏk wih tơ pơlei sư kơdih adrol kơ 'bok soi tơm lôch.

English: So you shall not pollute the land where you are; for blood defiles the land, and no atonement can be made for the land, for the blood that is shed on it, except by the blood of him who shed it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ teh iĕm wă oei; yua kơ đơ̆ng pham pơm mơgrĭ kơ teh đak; ưh kơ đei kiơ mă gơh pơm kơ teh rơgoh dơ̆ng dah đei bơngai tuh pham pơlôch đe, lăp minh tơdrong đĕch pơm mơgrĭ kơ teh, mưh ưh kơ pơlôch plơ̆ sư tuh pham lei ưh kơ gơh huai iŏk teh noh ôh.

English: Therefore do not defile the land which you inhabit, in the midst of which I dwell; for I the LORD dwell among the children of Israel.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu iĕm 'nĕ pơm mơgrĭ kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆ kơ teh đak mă lu iĕm wă oei noh, Inh oei; Inh boih Kră Yang oei hơdai lu adrĕch bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the leaders, the chief fathers of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng kơdră Gileat, kon drŏ-nglo Makir, sâu Manase, lăm adrĕch adrung kon sâu Jôsep, năm jê̆ păng pơma tơm măt kơ Môis păng lu yŏng kơdră lu bơngai Isơrael

English: And they said: “The LORD commanded my lord Moses to give the land as an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel, and my lord was commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
Bahnar: thoi âu: Kră Yang đei khan kơ yŏng kơdră inh hlang lăng păng asong ăn boih teh char âu ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael jang sa păng Kră Yang kư̆m tơtă kơ sư jao ăn teh jang sa đơ̆ng Sêlôpêhat 'nhŏng lu nhôn, ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-kăn sư.

English: Now if they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and it will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry; so it will be taken from the lot of our inheritance.
Bahnar: Lei tơdah lu kon drŏ-kăn sư chă klo bơngai adrĕch nai kơ lăm bơngai Isơrael, teh jang sa lu sư noh đe gô iŏk đơ̆ng adrĕch 'bok lu nhôn păng thim dơ̆ng ăn teh jang sa noh kơ adrĕch klo lu sư, lei đe gô iŏk pơdrâu teh jang sa noh đơ̆ng adrĕch nhôn, mă đei hlang iŏk boih.

English: And when the Jubilee of the children of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry; so their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
Bahnar: Mưh truh tơ sơnăm pơdơh hiôk-hian lu bơngai Isơrael kơplah noh teh jang sa lu sư rai thim đơ̆ng klo lu sư, lei teh sư jang sa noh gô iŏk đơ̆ng teh adrĕch 'bok lu nhôn.

English: Then Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the LORD, saying: “What the tribe of the sons of Joseph speaks is right.
Bahnar: Môis tơtă ăn hloi kơ bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei khan kơ sư thoi âu: Adrĕch kon sâu Jôsep pơma noh trŏ.

English: This is what the LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them marry whom they think best, but they may marry only within the family of their father’s tribe.’
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong Kră Yang đei khan gah lu kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat; lu sư wă oei kơ bu mơ̆ng kơ wă, mă-lei kư̆ oei lăm adrĕch adrung 'bok lu sư kơdih.

English: So the inheritance of the children of Israel shall not change hands from tribe to tribe, for every one of the children of Israel shall keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
Bahnar: Thoi ei na lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael, teh jang sa ayơ huay kơ hiong đơ̆ng adrĕch âu năm tơ adrĕch nai, yua kơ rim 'nu lăm kon pơlei adrĕch noh gô oei kiơ̆ kơ teh bơ̆n jang sa gah adrĕch 'bok sư kơdih.

English: And every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall be the wife of one of the family of her father’s tribe, so that the children of Israel each may possess the inheritance of his fathers.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn ayơ đei teh jang lăm lu adrĕch Isơrael, na athei oei kơ bơngai bu mă lăm hnam ayơ gah adrĕch adrung 'bok sư kơdih wă kơ rim 'nu lăm lu adrĕch Isơrael đei gơh iŏk teh tơmam jang sa đơ̆ng 'bok sư kơdih.

English: Thus no inheritance shall change hands from one tribe to another, but every tribe of the children of Israel shall keep its own inheritance.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, wă ưh kơ gơh đei teh jang sa tŏ yơ đơ̆ng adrĕch âu chĕp ba tơ adrĕch nai; mă-lei lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael iŏk bơwei teh jang sa kơdih noh.

English: Just as the LORD commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat pơm rok kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to the sons of their father’s brothers.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Mahla, Tirsa, Hogla, Milka păng Nôa kon drŏ-kăn Sêlôpêhat iŏk klo oei kơ tơduă kơtum adrĕch 'bok lu sư kơdih ngăl

English: They were married into the families of the children of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of their father’s family.
Bahnar: lu sư iŏk klo lăm lu adrĕch kon sâu Manase, kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep păng gah teh jang sa lu sư oei đei lăm adrĕch 'bok lu sư kơdih.

English: These are the commandments and the judgments which the LORD commanded the children of Israel by the hand of Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.
Bahnar: Noh boih nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang tơtă pơkă kơ Môis khan ăn kơ kon pơlei adrĕch Isơrael, tơ thŭng glă char Môap, jê̆ đak Krong Jôrđăn, tơklă anăp pơlei tih Jêrikô.
